story:
ABOUT US

Troy Parham, a songwriter, screenwriter, author and actor.  His controversial, true story novel

"MR. MALIK" has gained national recognition, and inspired his first short film production, "MILLIONAIRE". With drama training from the Cobbs Creek Center for the Arts in Philadelphia, he has performed in several onstage productions.

Susan C. Small, an award-winning playwright, has written and produced plays for sold out audiences since 2010.  Known for her meticulously rehearsed, Broadway-quality productions, she founded S. Charli Productions with a mission to increase diversity in theater.

​

In 2015, S. Charli Productions, Inc. produced their first children's musical, Princess Nylah and the Journey to the Magic Window, to a sold out audience and would continue to do so for the next four years, while growing a following and receiving enthusiastic reviews.

​

Inspired by the success of the stage play, Susan penned her first children's fairy tale of the same name, with the hopes of spreading the magic of this story worldwide.

 

​As writers and lead publishers at Small House Publishing, Troy and Susan share a passion for writing, and publishing literary work by authors of color with the hopes of increasing diversity in children’s literature and inspiring both the young and old to pursue their literary dreams.

 

ABOUT OUR WORK

Magic to the World is a global initiative aimed at providing quality looks written by authors of color that center on diverse characters while also curating exciting literary experiences like: 

The Story Time Event Series which consists of:

  • Story Time in Black
    • A video series streamed on YouTube that highlights books by authors of color, read by artists of color.

 

  • Story Time Live
    • A live story time event that takes the magic out of the pages of books and brings it to life in a live performance and interactive museum setting. A

In addition to the Story Time Event series, Small House Publishing is also thrilled to announce the publication of our sophomore children’s book “The Wishing Well”, the story of a young girl who discovers how unique she is after finding a magical well.

Your contribution will assists us in providing high quality literature and story time experiences that are sure to make a huge impact on every child who experiences the Small House Publishing magic.

What We Need What You Get

To succeed in our endeavors we need to secure $7000 in funding. Your contributions will help us secure the following:

  • $5000 – Illustrating and printing of “The Wishing Well”.
  • $2000 - Securing a venue for The Story Time Live Event.

The Impact

In 2020, during a global pandemic, Small House Publishing has been able to successful launch its first children’s book Princess Nylah and the Journey to the Magic Window, the story of a little girl who receives an ancient book that transports her to a magical dimension where she much discover her true identity. Princess Nylah and the Journey to the Magic Window launched to rave reviews from children and parents alike. Beautifully illustrated, well written and unique packaging placed Princess Nylah and the Journey to the Magic Window at the top of the must-haves lists for new children’s books! Along with the successful launch of their first book, Small House publishing also hosted its first Story Time Event “Story Time in the Garden” to a sold out group of enthusiastic families!

Your contributions will ensure that we are able to continue the rewarding work of publishing children’s books and producing story time events that leave a huge impact on the families we serve.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the challenges of being a small publishing company are covering the upfront cost of producing well illustrated and printed books as well as securing an event venue that can accommodate our young audience. Your contributions will go towards paying our illustrator and cover the cost of our overseas print run and cover the rental deposit for the event spaces needed to host the Story Time Live event.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be in the position to donate but you can still help us spread this magic by sharing our campaign on your social media pages and sharing with family and friends.

story:
Hello!

My name is Jayne Entwistle. I'm a British-born actress living in Los Angeles and I am in this fantastic play called, Tilda Swinton Answers an Ad on Craigslist starring Byron Lane, Tom Lenk,  Mark Jude Sullivan and directed by Tom DeTrinis. It's just as whimsical and absurd as it sounds and we're going to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival for the whole month of August. I know!!!! Thrilling.

In an effort to raise money for my part in this lofty undertaking, I am making the children's book I have written the cornerstone of my fundraising event. As I am an audiobook narrator who has recorded loads of thrilling children's books, I thought it only right that I also record the audiobook of Sock City with some of my very talented friends. 

I aim to raise $5,000 to cover:

     * Printing and duplication costs for the book, the playing cards and the audiobook

     * Shipping costs 

     * Sharing funds with the illustrator, Chris Sheets 

     * Travel, accommodations, and living expenses while in Edinburgh

Any amount of money I raise will go towards funding two of my dreams; to go home to the UK and perform at the Fringe Festival and to write and publish children's books. The more I raise, the more I will be able to share funds with the talented artists who contributed to Sock City the book and the audiobook. The more eyes on this campaign, the more eyes looking at the incredible artwork of Chris Sheets and with enough energy swirling around Sock City, I can write the next book in the series and work towards getting the book published by a real publisher.

Please share this campaign as you see fit. After all, who doesn't love socks?

Sock City is a short, illustrated children's book that touches on themes of compassion, forgiveness and friendship.

ppropriate for ages 7+ 

Everyone in Sock City has amazing, snuggly socks. But when the townspeople's socks begin mysteriously disappearing, it is up to Lucy Peabody and her best friend Peter to find out who, or what is stealing socks from Sock City!

 Thank you,

 Jayne

*If you would prefer to support live performance, Tilda Swinton Answers an Ad on Craigslist will be performing at Casita del Campo in Silverlake June 28 - 30. Tickets available at Brown Paper Tickets: https://bpt.me/3446586

 

**You do not have to receive any of the perks listed in order to participate in this campaign. Perhaps you'd rather I climb atop Arthur's Seat in Edinburgh and halloo your name to your ancient ancestors, or raise a pint in your honour in Scotland's oldest pub, The Sheep Heid Inn, where Queen Elizabeth herself had a tipple!

story:
HI, My name is Chris Torres and I am creating a marketing book and online course specifically for tours and activity businesses.

Lookers to Bookers will not be just another general marketing book. It will be a crystallisation of 26 years of marketing knowledge, and 13 years in the tourism marketing sector, into one practical resource, giving you the specialist tools you need to market your tours and activity business.

Many marketing books are great at saying what you should do but they often don’t provide you with the tools to actually make practical changes. This often leaves business owners disheartened and frustrated, and they tend to give up after a few weeks of trying to reinvigorate their marketing efforts.

Lookers to Bookers will, of course, advise you on what you should be doing, but it will also include practical worksheets and guides to help you take your newly acquired insight and turn it into an increased customer base and, ultimately, increased revenue. Each section will also be accompanied by online videos revisiting and reinforcing how the advice I provide can be used to improve your tours and activity business.

To help you, the book will follow the progress of a fictional tour company, showing you the company’s performance at each stage. This, I hope, will make it easier for the reader to envisage their own business in the same position, going on a similar journey.

The Book - Lookers to Bookers

The book will consist of 10 sections…

Section One will contain the introductions and an overview of the book, as well as a forward from a well respected influencer from our industry. I can’t wait to announce who this is.

Section Two is entitled “Who Do you Think You Are?”. This section will contain a brand workshop that will help you and your team find out where your business currently sits and the path you should take to grow your business. If you are just starting up a tour business, then this section is one of the first steps you should take.

I will help you find your brand voice and personality, helping you to create a consistent message across all your media outlets.

I will even advise on how you should create, or change, your brand logo.

Section Three is called  “Laying The Foundations”. These are the things you need in place before you think about marketing your business.

This section will cover many elements, looking at how to build a lead generating website, selecting the right booking system for your needs, the best practices for setting up your social media and TripAdvisor, and whether you should use an Online Travel Agent.

Section Four, as yet untitled, will cover how you can research your destination, sector, your competitors and customers, all of which helps you know who you should target and how you should market yourself to this target audience.

Section Five, the biggest section in the book, is titled “Building A Content Strategy”. With this section, I will provide you with the tools and knowledge you need to create streams of content to use across all marketing channels. I will even help you create 90 days of content ideas in 1 day!

I will cover topics such as Video Strategies, How to build your email lists legally (and responsibly), and even how you should implement a phone strategy.

This section will also show you how you can create a super successful Facebook campaign for only $5 per day.

Section Six is called “Setting The Budget and it covers a question I get asked a lot… “what should my marketing budget be”. I will give you a formula I use when advising the many businesses I work with each year.

Section Seven, titled “Implementation”, provides you with the tools and knowhow to implement your strategies, including when and how to post new content.

Section Eight, is called “Report. Review. Repeat.” I will explain how you can look over the data you collect and how to use it to further refine your marketing strategies and grow your business.

Section Nine, is called “Now… Go, Do.” I provide some final advice and some further steps that you should consider.

Section Ten is our handy resource section where you can view, download and visit all the information and companies I mention in the book.

As mentioned previously, each section will also be accompanied by online videos, so you can take in the information at a rate that suits you, helping you fully understand how the advice I provide can be used within your tour and activity business.

The Webinar Course

Not only will I be producing a book with accompanying videos, I will be diving deeper into each subject by creating an online course that you can follow at your leisure. The course will guide you further on the path to growing your business and generating more revenue.

The course covers many aspects of digital marketing — from branding to SEO, and everything in between. It is ideal for start-ups and small to medium-sized businesses who have their own marketing teams, or business owners who want to tackle these aspects themselves. You will also receive all new course updates and access to future additions.

Includes a 1-hour consultation with the TMA team.

More details on this will be available soon.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be self published. I believe it will become an important resource that will help tour and activity businesses improve their marketing practices. I set up these pledges to help with the costs associated with self-publishing this book. Money raised will go towards the print and publication costs, purchasing ISBN numbers for the hardback, paperback and digital copies. It will also help cover the initial test print copies before fully going into production.

By funding in advance, you will also receive the book for less that its retail price.

I am also offering some exclusive incentives for pledges:

  • Your tour and activity business name, web address and short description could be added to the resources section of the book for every edition published now or in the future.
  • You could receive a 2-hour conference workshop with me where we discuss any marketing topic you wish.
  • You could be entitled to a full 2-day workshop with myself and one of my team.
  • You could be part of a VIP boardroom level group of only 12 people, with access to me, my team and some of my strategic partners, all with the aim of helping you grow your business.

I hope you can help me raise the funds required to publish this book. With a little marketing guidance, you could reach your own business goals… turning those lookers in revenue-generating bookers!

About Chris

I have 26 years’ experience working in brand development and marketing, and I’ve spent the last 13 years running my own marketing company, the Tourism Marketing Agency.

My client base is truly international, with around 80% of clients based outside of the UK, where I am based. I have worked with some of the biggest players in the industry, including Gray Line – the oldest and largest sightseeing company in the world.

I have helped clients all over Europe, The Americas, Asia, and even Antarctica! This broad range of clients has been challenging and exciting; it has helped me and my team develop considerable knowledge and expertise in a huge variety of different destinations and tourism markets.

I have won numerous awards over the years, such as Best Marketing Agency, Best Tourism Website and Businessman of the Year in 2018. I have also had the pleasure of speaking at numerous tourism events, such as Arival, the Scottish Tourism Alliance, Travel Massive, several Gray Line conferences, and Landing Madrid.

I have lived and breathed marketing for the tours and activities sector for years and this book is my attempt to compile what I’ve learned into a practical resource for anyone who needs some help turning their own lookers into bookers.

Publish Date

I am looking to finish and publish the book in April 2019 with the course following shortly after. Two of the 10 sections have been written and I am already sitting at 10,000 words (not including worksheets). This will be a large book full of practical advice that I know will help grow your business.

The only risk I see is the publish date may slip a little but I am confident this will not happen as I am accumulating, refining and re-writing many years of knowledge.

Testimonials

“Chris Torres has the ability to execute marketing strategies that are unlike anything I've seen in the tour & activity industry. He and his team don't just hit the bullseye — they blow it to pieces... again and again.” Matthew Newton, Director of Marketing at PeekPro

“I am a huge admirer of Chris Torres and his Digital Tourism Show. The man gives away so much knowledge around increasing revenue." Shane Whaley, Former Director of Get Your Guide and Producer and Host of Tourpreneur.

"Having worked with Chris on a number of projects over the years, and having the pleasure of hearing him speak at various events, there is no doubt he knows his stuff! If you need to get your tourism brand moving in the market Chris Torres is definitely the guy to assist you." Will Plummer, owner of Trust My Travel

“Since i joined the tourism industry, Chris has been the go to guy for me. He always has his finger on the pulse and thinks one step ahead of everyone else when it comes to reacting to the latest industry developments. I've found his advice to be invaluable on several occasions.” Russel Astle-Coates, Director of Business Development, TourismTiger

"Chris and his team have been instrumental in helping us grow the Gray Line Iceland brand. The extra bookings and revenue we have received from their marketing efforts have been nothing short of remarkable." Hrafnkell Konráðsson, E-commerce Manager at Gray Line Iceland

"Having worked with Chris and his team for the last 6 months, I can confidently say there really is no other company that compares to their understanding of the tourism industry. A 36.7% increase in revenue from my previous year, and a 328% return from my Adwords spend says it all." Dylan David, Owner of Dylan’s Tours

"We have been working with Chris and his team since 2015, when we opened for the first time a B2C channel launching our new website. In only one month, we gained a complete return of our investment. Our online business has constantly increased since then. Thank you for your valuable support." Martín Tartara, I Love Rome

"Thank you for all the great things you have been sharing on your Digital Tourism Show group. Your ideas and insights have inspired improvements for 2019 that will help many of our partners. They wouldn't have been the same without your input." Vangelis Andrikopoulos at Sigodu

"The world of marketing can often be a black hole. There are so many moving parts that can easily overwhelm you if you let it. This is where TMA truly excels. They removed the ‘guesswork’ and provided me with a clear and detailed work plan for the upcoming year. I would strongly recommend everyone to consider TMA to assist them with their marketing strategy." Michael Harris, Gray Line Washington DC

Excerpt from Intro:

The story I am about to tell is a personal one. A true story, so bare with me. It helps set the tone as to why I feel this book is a must for all tours and activity businesses.

Ever since primary school I have always had a love of Japan. Its history, its culture and its people. In-fact, I have my father to thank for that one.

Our class was assigned to create a mood board to present to the class of any point in history we decided to talk about. I could see my fellow classmates were already deciding on your typical topics such as the world wars or ancient Egypt (this was standard back in the 1980’s), but I wanted to do something different.

After getting home I walked into our lounge and started to flick through my father’s books. This was pre-internet! He was an avid book reader and subscribed to the Reader’s Digest (Is this still a thing?*) which delivered a set of books each month to our door. Once of the books instantly caught my eye.

My Father just received a book on the ancient history of Japan. It had an image of a Samurai warrior on the cover, something I had never seen before but immediately sparked my imagination, and my love for all things Japanese.

Fast forward 25 year and my wife and I decided we wanted to start a family but before we did, wanted to take a ‘once in a lifetime’ trip to somewhere special. It was a choice between Canada and Japan. Suffice to say, Japan won and we set out looking to see what we could do over our planned 2 week trip.

We knew we wanted to to travel across Japan and see as much as we could so, after a quick Google search, we found one company who felt could deliver what we wanted. Why did we decide this? Simple… content.

You see, this company went to great lengths to create good content through video, with most being presented by their own tour guides. I cannot stress enough how important this is. You could see the passion and enthusiasm the guides had for a land they obviously loved.

One such guide, Tyler Palmer, helped the most in selling the various sights we could see in destination. One of these sights would be witnessing the sunrise at the top of Mt Fuji. “Not a chance” was my first thought. Although we are fairly fit and healthy individuals, there is no way we could climb Mt Fuji. We are not ‘athletes’.

After a quick phone call with the company (yes, we spoke to someone… more on this later in the book), we were assured that, although there was no guarantees, we should be able to reach the top of Mt Fuji barring any server altitude sickness.

With this, and with the other sights we did not wish to pass up on, we extended our stay from 2 weeks to nearly a month.

When we finally arrived at Narita Airport we were met by none other than Tyler Palmer, the guide from the videos. Because we saw his videos, meeting him at the airport was like meeting an old friend. It broke the ice and made us feel instantly welcome.

Our time in Japan was a first class experience. We travelled around Japan, visiting many cities and towns, meeting locals and eating some of the best food I have ever had. The sense of accomplishment we also felt when we finally reached the top of Mt Fuji will be with us forever. And the view at the top… stunning.

At time of writing this book, nearly 12 years on, we have recommended that business, and Tyler, on many occasions. We are also still friends with Tyler and keep in communication through Facebook. He now has a young family himself.

The reason I am telling you all this, and incase you have missed the point, the real value to that business was not just our time spent in Japan, but the relationships and recommendations we have made many years later. Hey, I am still sharing my experience with you now.

All off the back on one peice of video marketing, we:

  • Extended our stay by a further 2 weeks - generating the company more in revenue.
  • Referred that business on to countless others, and who booked with that company - providing more referral business
  • Built a friendship with the tour guide and will go back to Japan once our kids are a little older - providing repeat business (We have told Tyler he must be our guide!)

This is how powerful it can be if you tell your story in a genuine, honest way with a cohesive strategy in place.

With this book, my aim is to provide you with the tools and knowhow so you can build your own ‘tribe’ of customers and brand advocates, promoting your business in the right way. I will not only provide practical advice, but worksheets and help guides to assist you along the way.

The Digital Tourism Show

I also provide lots of free marketing advice though my online channel, The Digital Tourism Show, which I make available on a dedicated Facebook group. This group is free to join; it’s  where I ‘hang out’, and it’s also where members post up questions for me to answer. I have also posted over 200 videos on the Digital Tourism show so far; all members have unlimited access to these videos.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/digitaltourismshow/

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help me reach my dream of publishing this book by sharing across social media and other outlets.

With warmth and gratitude,

Chris Torres

tourismmarketing.agency

lookerstobookers.co.uk

You could be part of a VIP boardroom level group of only 12 people, with access to me, my team and some of my strategic partners, all with the aim of helping you grow your business.

I hope you can help me raise the funds required to publish this book. With a little marketing guidance, you could reach your own business goals… turning those lookers in revenue-generating bookers!

About Chris
I have 26 years’ experience working in brand development and marketing, and I’ve spent the last 13 years running my own marketing company, the Tourism Marketing Agency.
My client base is truly international, with around 80% of clients based outside of the UK, where I am based. I have worked with some of the biggest players in the industry, including Gray Line – the oldest and largest sightseeing company in the world.
I have helped clients all over Europe, The Americas, Asia, and even Antarctica! This broad range of clients has been challenging and exciting; it has helped me and my team develop considerable knowledge and expertise in a huge variety of different destinations and tourism markets.
I have won numerous awards over the years, such as Best Marketing Agency, Best Tourism Website and Businessman of the Year in 2018. I have also had the pleasure of speaking at numerous tourism events, such as Arival, the Scottish Tourism Alliance, Travel Massive, several Gray Line conferences, and Landing Madrid.
I have lived and breathed marketing for the tours and activities sector for years and this book is my attempt to compile what I’ve learned into a practical resource for anyone who needs some help turning their own lookers into bookers.
Publish Date

I am looking to finish and publish the book in April 2019 with the course following shortly after. Two of the 10 sections have been written and I am already sitting at 10,000 words (not including worksheets). This will be a large book full of practical advice that I know will help grow your business.
The only risk I see is the publish date may slip a little but I am confident this will not happen as I am accumulating, refining and re-writing many years of knowledge.
Testimonials
“Chris Torres has the ability to execute marketing strategies that are unlike anything I've seen in the tour & activity industry. He and his team don't just hit the bullseye — they blow it to pieces... again and again.” Matthew Newton, Director of Marketing at PeekPro
“I am a huge admirer of Chris Torres and his Digital Tourism Show. The man gives away so much knowledge around increasing revenue." Shane Whaley, Former Director of Get Your Guide and Producer and Host of Tourpreneur.
"Having worked with Chris on a number of projects over the years, and having the pleasure of hearing him speak at various events, there is no doubt he knows his stuff! If you need to get your tourism brand moving in the market Chris Torres is definitely the guy to assist you." Will Plummer, owner of Trust My Travel
“Since i joined the tourism industry, Chris has been the go to guy for me. He always has his finger on the pulse and thinks one step ahead of everyone else when it comes to reacting to the latest industry developments. I've found his advice to be invaluable on several occasions.” Russel Astle-Coates, Director of Business Development, TourismTiger
"Chris and his team have been instrumental in helping us grow the Gray Line Iceland brand. The extra bookings and revenue we have received from their marketing efforts have been nothing short of remarkable." Hrafnkell Konráðsson, E-commerce Manager at Gray Line Iceland
"Having worked with Chris and his team for the last 6 months, I can confidently say there really is no other company that compares to their understanding of the tourism industry. A 36.7% increase in revenue from my previous year, and a 328% return from my Adwords spend says it all." Dylan David, Owner of Dylan’s Tours
"We have been working with Chris and his team since 2015, when we opened for the first time a B2C channel launching our new website. In only one month, we gained a complete return of our investment. Our online business has constantly increased since then. Thank you for your valuable support." Martín Tartara, I Love Rome
"Thank you for all the great things you have been sharing on your Digital Tourism Show group. Your ideas and insights have inspired improvements for 2019 that will help many of our partners. They wouldn't have been the same without your input." Vangelis Andrikopoulos at Sigodu
"The world of marketing can often be a black hole. There are so many moving parts that can easily overwhelm you if you let it. This is where TMA truly excels. They removed the ‘guesswork’ and provided me with a clear and detailed work plan for the upcoming year. I would strongly recommend everyone to consider TMA to assist them with their marketing strategy." Michael Harris, Gray Line Washington DC

Excerpt from Intro:
The story I am about to tell is a personal one. A true story, so bare with me. It helps set the tone as to why I feel this book is a must for all tours and activity businesses.
Ever since primary school I have always had a love of Japan. Its history, its culture and its people. In-fact, I have my father to thank for that one.
Our class was assigned to create a mood board to present to the class of any point in history we decided to talk about. I could see my fellow classmates were already deciding on your typical topics such as the world wars or ancient Egypt (this was standard back in the 1980’s), but I wanted to do something different.
After getting home I walked into our lounge and started to flick through my father’s books. This was pre-internet! He was an avid book reader and subscribed to the Reader’s Digest (Is this still a thing?*) which delivered a set of books each month to our door. Once of the books instantly caught my eye.
My Father just received a book on the ancient history of Japan. It had an image of a Samurai warrior on the cover, something I had never seen before but immediately sparked my imagination, and my love for all things Japanese.
Fast forward 25 year and my wife and I decided we wanted to start a family but before we did, wanted to take a ‘once in a lifetime’ trip to somewhere special. It was a choice between Canada and Japan. Suffice to say, Japan won and we set out looking to see what we could do over our planned 2 week trip.
We knew we wanted to to travel across Japan and see as much as we could so, after a quick Google search, we found one company who felt could deliver what we wanted. Why did we decide this? Simple… content.
You see, this company went to great lengths to create good content through video, with most being presented by their own tour guides. I cannot stress enough how important this is. You could see the passion and enthusiasm the guides had for a land they obviously loved.
One such guide, Tyler Palmer, helped the most in selling the various sights we could see in destination. One of these sights would be witnessing the sunrise at the top of Mt Fuji. “Not a chance” was my first thought. Although we are fairly fit and healthy individuals, there is no way we could climb Mt Fuji. We are not ‘athletes’.
After a quick phone call with the company (yes, we spoke to someone… more on this later in the book), we were assured that, although there was no guarantees, we should be able to reach the top of Mt Fuji barring any server altitude sickness.
With this, and with the other sights we did not wish to pass up on, we extended our stay from 2 weeks to nearly a month.
When we finally arrived at Narita Airport we were met by none other than Tyler Palmer, the guide from the videos. Because we saw his videos, meeting him at the airport was like meeting an old friend. It broke the ice and made us feel instantly welcome.
Our time in Japan was a first class experience. We travelled around Japan, visiting many cities and towns, meeting locals and eating some of the best food I have ever had. The sense of accomplishment we also felt when we finally reached the top of Mt Fuji will be with us forever. And the view at the top… stunning.
At time of writing this book, nearly 12 years on, we have recommended that business, and Tyler, on many occasions. We are also still friends with Tyler and keep in communication through Facebook. He now has a young family himself.
The reason I am telling you all this, and incase you have missed the point, the real value to that business was not just our time spent in Japan, but the relationships and recommendations we have made many years later. Hey, I am still sharing my experience with you now.
All off the back on one peice of video marketing, we:

Extended our stay by a further 2 weeks - generating the company more in revenue.
Referred that business on to countless others, and who booked with that company - providing more referral business
Built a friendship with the tour guide and will go back to Japan once our kids are a little older - providing repeat business (We have told Tyler he must be our guide!)

This is how powerful it can be if you tell your story in a genuine, honest way with a cohesive strategy in place.
With this book, my aim is to provide you with the tools and knowhow so you can build your own ‘tribe’ of customers and brand advocates, promoting your business in the right way. I will not only provide practical advice, but worksheets and help guides to assist you along the way.

The Digital Tourism Show
I also provide lots of free marketing advice though my online channel, The Digital Tourism Show, which I make available on a dedicated Facebook group. This group is free to join; it’s  where I ‘hang out’, and it’s also where members post up questions for me to answer. I have also posted over 200 videos on the Digital Tourism show so far; all members have unlimited access to these videos.
https://www.facebook.com/groups/digitaltourismshow/
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please help me reach my dream of publishing this book by sharing across social media and other outlets.
With warmth and gratitude,
Chris Torres

lookerstobookers.co.uk

story:
Fashion and sustainability are intrinsic partners. Yet, it is hard for many to lead an environmentally conscious lifestyle. That’s where we come in.

PAGE has established itself as a cultural disruptor. We want to bring the nostalgia of print back into the fantasy of fashion, the sustainable way. With our first issue in production and almost ready to be sent to printers, we need your support. It’s time that we had a physical reminder that fashion can run adjacent to the needs of our planet.

On our path to publishing, leading sustainable brands have committed to us. But we have hit a roadblock with the worldwide COVID-19 pandemic. Sill, we believe that there is light on the other side of this.

As we continue to produce content daily, our bi-annual print will feature exclusive articles and content limited or removed entirely from our online platform. With your help, the enthusiasts of fashion done the sustainable way, we bring you a collectible piece of culture -- PAGE Print.

I am the Editor In Chief and Founder of PAGE magazine. Fashion is why I fell in love with photography and design. Working in media and the fashion industry, I have noticed the lack of representation, not just of groups but of the ideas that shape us in our everyday decisions. 

The challenges we face are that of printing costs and that we want to be able to distribute this magazine as far and wide as possible, as our audience is here in America and abroad in places like Paris, London, and Melbourne.

story:
Short Summary

Isn't It Amazing? is an illustrated song about awe. It is completely hand-drawn and was written, recorded and self-published (with the help of Solstice Press) in the Bay Area by Maya Elise and Meg Adler. 

This book and song (coming soon!) asks us to look at the world with wonder! Whether you are two years old or 102, this art is for you.

Additionally, when you support this project you are supporting the arts for young people in Oakland, CA. We will be contributing 10% of all proceeds to the Oakland Public Conservatory of Music.​​

What We Need

We have big dreams for this book, and with big dreams comes some expenses, but we really believe that we can reach our goal with the help of our community and beyond. Our $15,000 start-up goal will cover:

  • The initial 500 copies of the book (we want to sell 10,000 eventually!)
  • Recording costs & payment for musicians
  • Marketing
  • Publication Costs
  • And finally, if we reach our goal, we will be producing (drum roll please)........an ANIMATED music video made by the amazing Noah Reiner

We know this is a big goal, and self-publishing a book is expensive, but we know we can make it happen. 

What You Get

We'll let you check out the awesome perks associated with each giving level, but at the very least you will get one of the first edition copies of "Isn't It Amazing?" - an evergreen book & song that will speak to anyone who's ever seen something amazing. Maybe it's signed, or maybe you get a FaceTime reading of the book, or a virtual community gathering with your friends and family with a reading and activities. As we said, head over to the "perks" section to see your options!

Why So Amazing?

We (Maya & Meg), met in 2012 at Camp Tawonga where we learned to slow down, and be amazed by the natural world. We lived literally underneath the redwoods, saw millions of stars at night, swam in the Tuolumne river, and learned that in order to care for this world, we must form a relationship with it first. 

This book speaks to our values of slowing down, letting yourself be amazed by the natural world, and that we, as humans, have the capacity to cultivate love and admiration for this planet. 

This was a natural collaboration with meg as an illustrator deeply inspired by plants, trees, and imagination, and Maya as a musician who prefers to write about mountain-tops and oceans. 

Risks & Challenges

Self-publishing is a big endeavor, but we are up to the task. In order to share some of the risk with you, we have already fronted 15% of the start-up costs, because we really believe in this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to helping us reach our fundraising & pre-order goal, we would love your help in getting the word out! Do you know a bookstore that might want to purchase this wholesale? Let us know! Do you have friends and family that would love this project? Share it with them!

And don't forget to tag us on Instagram @isntitamazingthebook - can't wait to see those pictures of you reading your book and dancing along to the music!

story:
Executive Summary

The Betrayal of Ka is written, reviewed, and almost ready to go to market. I need your help to successfully launch my Indie publishing career, and to take a huge step toward some audacious goals.

After challenging myself to climb the three tallest peaks in Rocky Mountain National Park alone, I redefined the course of my life and am pursuing some previously secret dreams. I always wanted to write a novel, but found years and years of excuses for not doing it.  Standing alone on an isolated mountain peak, I realized that the only person standing in my way was me.

As an experienced entrepreneur, I am approaching the publication of my first book as any professional publishing company would. I need your assistance in financing a number of tasks, including:

  • Hiring a professional, independent editor
  • Designing a compelling, unique book cover
  • Creating a publishing infrastructure (ISBNs, POD accounts, etc.)
  • Launching the first marketing campaigns

Writing the book and surprising friends and family with the quality of the story was validation that I am on the right path. However, becoming a successful Indie author and publisher is only one element of a larger vision for my life. This isn't a one-and-done project. Book two is already partially written. Ultimately, after establishing myself as serious author and getting my wonderful sons through school, I plan to sail around the world.

Execution Plan and Budget

September 15, 2015 is the target date for The Betrayal of Ka to be available. Initially, it will be available as an eBook from Amazon. Paperback versions will be available at Amazon, BarnsAndNoble.com, and other online retailers. My launch distribution partners will be KDP Select for eBooks, and CreateSpace and Ingram Spark for print.

Pre-Launch Marketing

Pre-launch marketing efforts will be focused around three primary goals.

  1. Generate pre-launch sales
  2. Grow my social media presence as an author
  3. Create some prelaunch buzz about the book

I will be leveraging this Indiegogo campaign heavily to move towards those goals with my social media network, personal contacts, and professional contacts in multiple industries. 

Financial Budget

The follow items represent the primary budget items for preparing the book for launch, creating the publishing infrastructure, and launching sales of the novel.

  • $1,000 - Professional Editor
  • $500 - Book cover design
  • $500 - Initial online book marketing advertising 
  • $400 - Promotional print copies for giveaways and reviews
  • $300 - International Standard Book Numbers (ISBNs)
  • $150 - File Conversion, standardization, and management
  • $100 - Print On Demand (POD) & Distribution Setup

Total Budget = $2,950. Any amount raised above that amount will be used for additional marketing and for book two expenses.

The Betrayal of Ka (The Transprophetics #1)

The novel is approximately 96,500 words, which is likely to change some during final professional editing.

Blurb - (Publisher speak for that teaser on the back of the book)

As the spaceship lands on Earth, Ka's mission is clear - find and kill Transprophetics. His shipmates think of him as a killer. On his home planet of Koranth, he is considered a murderer. Even the boy who haunts his dreams taunts Ka with visions from the day that Ka's actions took his life.

A girl in a temple in Thailand. A boy kidnapped in Mexico. Both can do the impossible. Both can move object with their minds. These two Transprophetics pose grave risks to the Donavackia Corporation as it plans its invasion of Earth.

With a blade in his hand, Ka's decision to kill or not will reverberate across the galaxy.

Read Some Sample Chapters

If you are interested in reading a few sample chapters, please drop by The Betrayal of Ka page on my website.

Campaign Perks

A huge THANK YOU!!! in advance for your support. I greatly appreciate it!

Please note that if you would like to contribute at a higher dollar value, but would prefer a perk from a lower dollar value, I'm happy to honor your request.

Rocky Mountain National Park Packages

Both the Pear Lake Package and Wóablakela Peak Summit Package include an entire day of hiking with me in Rocky Mountain National Park. As I am not a guide, these are simply days for us to get together and have some fun, challenging days in the Park. We'll schedule these hikes in mid-to-late September. 

If you are not comfortable with high-altitude hiking and scrambling or do not live in Colorado, but plan to visit, please contact me. I love to share my passion for one of the most beautiful places on Earth. I am happy to offer some alternative dates for enjoying the Rockies together in a less strenuous and difficult setting.

In the event that weather or adverse conditions prevent these hikes, we'll change locations and schedule appropriately. As in any high-country adventure, there is no guarantee that we'll reach our stated destination, but we'll have a blast along the way. 

Supporter Exposure Package

On my Support Team page, I'm happy to link to your personal or business website or blog, your social media page, your crowdfunding project, or your favorite charity. However, I reserve the right to refuse links to pages and/or blurbs that contain themes related to pornography, guns, violence, politics, religion, or other polarizing topic. My intention is to do good for the world, not generate more controversy and strive.

My Publishing Company

My creative projects are run through my company, Colorado Sky Media,LLC, a Colorado Limited Liability Company. My existing logo will also become the imprint for my publishing business. 

Don't you just love this logo? I sure do!

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Why not just go with a prepacked publishing company?

That's a great question! The publishing industry is in a radical period of change right now. Many companies have arisen to provide "full service" packages and other services to independent authors.

Being an entrepreneur is in my blood. It's exciting to learn new industries and to face new challenges. Preparing for this, my first crowdfunding campaign, has been a blast! I can hardly wait to begin building more of the publishing infrastructure and launch some marketing campaigns.

However, the issues of control and flexibility are real drivers of the decision to launch a publishing company within Colorado Sky Media, LLC. Everything from distribution paths to royalty structures to marketing are quickly changing. Staying truly independent gives me the ability flex and change quickly, and I believe will maximize my earning potential, especially in the near-to-mid term.

Are you really working on book two?

Heck Yes!!! I had a wonderful time writing the first book, and am already enjoying the challenge of writing a second novel. There is something magical about escaping into a world that I create, then sharing it with others. 

Have your already contracted an editor?

Yes. There is a wide range of editing services available. I wanted to work with someone who would do more than just "proofread" once and walk away.  I am already going back and forth with my editor, and we'll continue the process until we've polished the book to a brilliant shine!

You can read a little more about the process on hiring an editor in my blog post, Hired An Editor for My First Novel


Sharing is Caring!

Even if you can't contribute today, you can make a HUGE impact! 

Please help me spread the word about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools right beside the video at the top of this page.

Get Connected with me and be the first to know!

Friend me on FACEBOOK

Follow me on TWITTER

Connect with me on LINKEDIN

Follow my blog at SheaOliver.com


If you have any questions or comments, I'd love to hear from you!!! And as always...

Sláinte!

story:
Me and the book

Hi, my name is Loredana de Michelis and I am an Italian psychologist, with some experience in Visual Training and perceptual rehabilitation. The book "Preferisco vederci chiaro" (I prefer to see clearly) is doing very well in Italian and French, and was going to be translated into English when the publisher had some business-bureaucracy crash-down. I still don't know what happened. 
I decided to translate it on my own, but I need a good professional and I do not have the funds. I also need some enthusiasm to go on with the project, to be honest.
The book has over 30 pictures and exercises and explains the Bates Method, the most famous visual training technique for short and far sighted people, to overcome sight tiredness, flying flies and get back some focus abilities. It also gives full instruction on how to use pinhole glasses while doing Visual Training.

Why

I believe anybody should learn how to preserve and take care of their sight in a natural and spontaneous way, like we do for other skills of our body. I have been working for years with people that simply used their eyes with a lot of effort and strain without even realize that, suffering from various and sometimes peculiar annoyances.
The book is simply explained and I tried to keep it interesting and funny: learning how to get back the abilities that we are supposed to own since we were born, must be joyful and intriguing, not a drag!
I already translated in English a small work of mine's as an e-book, that introduces the principles of Visual Training: "Pinhole glasses & the Bates Method: detective Mouser answers" and the readers have been very generous with me, giving wonderful reviews on Amazon. This is another reason why I am trying to go on with this project.

How

All the funds will be used to pay the translator: it is a long job that need experience and very good language skills, as simplicity about medical issues is difficult to perform. My English is not good enough for that.
If I wont get all the money I need, I will start the translation anyway: let's see how far I can go. If you can help me in other ways, sharing this crowdfunding by the IndieGogo tools or translating a small part, please do it: I will be happy to offer Skype sessions on Visual Training (or Facial Gymnastics) in exchange.

Let's Celebrate a Remarkable Life!

Hello Friends! 
My name is Kate Otto and like you, my life has been so positively transformed by the amazing human being that is Fr. Al Demos. Fr. Al has led an incredible life, and I am thrilled to share that he recently finished writing his Memoir!!!

Please let me know if you have any questions and PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN!!! 
All my best,
Kate Otto

story:
Hi! I'm Lacie, 


Basically, I'm me. I'm one writer who's chosen to self publish a good deal of her own work. Not because I couldn't hack it elsewhere, but because I want creative control to do what I want.

I'm Lacie, and I want to change the way world feels about about music. I also want to create the world's most interactive book.


What I Need & What You Get

Ideally if all of my funding is reached I will be able to self publish my first zine in five years  Pink & Orange Jam each issue will be a musical journey into an album, part anthropological dig, part critique, dash of love letter.   

($20 perk people will get the 15-16 season mailed to their house!) 

Next project is my Interactive ebook and game Love & Firefights- The story of an epic game that end the world as we know it. We played anyway you made the videos 

($15 perk people can contribute videos which will be hyperlinked into the book)

Last project but, perhaps my nearest and dearest help me bring Sins to print. Sins is the story of a future where genetics is a mess and nobody's laughing. 

Any other overage would go to book covers, website upkeep, video production and copy costs.

Okay...so..

While I've never done a project like this. I can keep myself to pretty tight deadlines. (I do a monthly column at PunkGlobe I've not missed in at least a year) If I didn't have to work my dayjob so hard to save up the money I could rest easy *doing* my art.

 Challenges? Yeah, I've had a few...

I'll be honest. I'm just a girl, I write about music, hell I LOVE music. I want to write about music because, I have synaesthesia, I want to share my view with ALL of you.

and well, choose your own adventure books are awesome, right? So are board games. I want to sort of combine these. You'll have a story to read, a game to play and just maybe if I do it right a fun mini movie.

I know the value of trying things a different way, let me tell you things that are this awesome aren't easy but, if you help me we can do this.

Help Me?

I know some of you can't donate and that's okay! Just spread the word for me...Tell your twitter, facebook, book group, gun club. I'm not picky!

x

Lacie

story:
Hello everyone,
My name is Shirley and I am a full-time nurse. I enjoy helping people and I also have a passion for writing.
Because of my back injury, I can no longer do this profession anymore. So I want to turn my manuscript into a book. I have been writing and revising two books for over 10 years. Now, they are both completed. 
I am trying to raise funds to get my 1st and 2nd book printed and published. I have already paid for the editing, and what is left is the cover art and designs.
I have received very good feedback from many critics that I have submitted my manuscripts to.

The first book is called "Breaking Free from the Dark Depression" and I wrote this book after I had suffered from my back injury, which caused me to have deep depression. My writing helped me to overcome my depression and bring joy back into my life. And I want to help other people how to get over deep depression and anxiety.

The second book is called "The Golden Nightmare" and I wrote this book as a Thriller/Adventure/Fiction that is based on true history. Writing this book was a lot of fun, bringing the future, past, and present together. If you love reading, then you will love this book. The story is about a young family who finds out about their true, but frightening past. And that past, has now come back to haunt them in more ways than one. Strange and mysterious things start to happen to make them turn against each other. Tearing the family apart. The battle begins, and only the strongest one will survive. There you go! The first few sentences.

So please contribute and share my fundraising site with anyone you think would support me. The 2,500 euros will be used to get both books printed, published and designed. Even if I don't reach my fundraising goal, everyone will get exactly what they paid for, no matter what.
I am hopeful and positive that we can do this together, so we can all read and enjoy new and exciting stories. I would be very grateful if somebody could help me to bring this project... To a happy end. 

Sincerely,

Shirley Sarp

story:
Short Summary

Here at The Peace Party our actions are fuelled by love.
However, love cannot pay for an electoral deposit or printing costs for campaign flyers and posters.
Who are we?
PPCs - John Morris (National Organiser, party co-founder), Jim Duggan ('People's Peace Party' founder) Tommy Holgate (Media Spokesperson), Julie Roxborough (Animal Rights Expert).
This campaign is important to us because it is about time the political arena saw more conscious discussion present in its day-to-day activity.
The Peace Party is a pacifist party that would rather see military deployed in a humanitarian manner.
By contributing to this campaign, you will be adding to the growing number of individuals who are taking an active role in the global discussion on how to achieve world peace.
Many people tell us 'it isn't possible'. However, on a literal level, it is.
Hence, we are committed to doing all we can to bring measures of peace into the world and are keen to be to peace what The Greens have been to environmental causes.

Mahatma Gandhi: "The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others."

Martin Luther King: "Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal."

John Lennon: "Peace is not something you wish for, it's something you make, something you do, something you are and something you give away."

Albert Einstein: "I am not only a pacifist but a militant pacifist. I am willing to fight for peace. Nothing will end war unless the people themselves refuse to go to war."

Jimi Hendrix: "When the power of love overcomes the love of power, then the world will know peace."

Mother Theresa: "Peace begins with a smile."

It is a sad reality that money talks so much in politics, and, without billionaire backing, The Peace Party are turning to crowdfunding in order to generate funds for the 2015 election and beyond.
We have set the fundraising target at a modest £500, which would be 100 memberships at £5 each, or just 25 members signing up for the £20 rate.
There are also perks related to dance classes, tai chi sessions and holistic health wellness days (including massage, colour therapy, nutrition workshops and more) that are tailored to teambuilding events for your school, workplace, sports team and so on.
RISKS:
There really is no risk to signing up to assist us in this campaign. 
The 'worst case scenario' is that we don't get elected, but will have spent several months spreading a message of peace in our communities. 
Our inner world creates our outer world, so by getting on board you are taking a step towards enjoying a fine sense of harmony in your inner world, knowing that your core intentions are aligned with those loving energies that so pervade the entire universe.
Sadly these loving energies are currently lacking in the spectrum of activity exhibited by certain power-hungry individuals.
But even at the heart of a warlord lies a human soul, and that soul must be welcomed into this new era with compassion.

As a Peace Party motto suggests: We live in a world with enough for everyone's need, but not everyone's greed.

If you are unable to contribute financially, worry not. Feel free to like our Facebook page 'The Peace Party - Non-violence, Justice, Environment' or follow us on Twitter @PeacePartyUK

story:
Summary

"Bridges" is a collection of short stories compiled into a 400+ page novel. It will feature roughly 16-20 short stories, including fan favorites "Fractured Soul," "Genus Amans," "Snowblind," and "Picture Perfect," and the debut of the much requested "Fractured Soul: Temporal Dissonance."


The Breakdown

I am asking for $1,000 in this campaign. The money will be used for commissioning the cover artwork (which will be hand-painted), getting the novel professionally edited, printed (in paperback, and hardcover if at least $800 is reached), and to help with promotion. Any extra funds will be further used for marketing and additional printing runs, along with potential transmedia ventures, such and film.

The book will contain all of the stories that I have shared up to this point, along with several brand new ones that will only be available in the book. As one of the reward tiers allows the backer to have me write a custom short story for inclusion in the book, there is the potential for a few extras as well. Plus, this will be the full debut for the much-requested Fractured Soul: Temporal Dissonance.

Included stories:

A Devil Like You
Barren Grove
Desolate Land
Digital Dreams
Fractured Soul
Fractured Soul: Temporal Dissonance
Genus Amans
Lucid Isolation
Not Alone
Picture Perfect
Snowblind
The Guardian
The Wanderer
Unsullied Innocence
And more!

See a few stories here:

Fractured Soul: http://bit.ly/2a6t5VP
Digital Dreams: http://bit.ly/29VAhp8
A Devil Like You: http://bit.ly/29JXcjR

And a sample from Fractured Soul: Temporal Dissonance: http://bit.ly/29PkXGI 

The Impact

This is something I've dreamed of doing for a long time, but it was only last year that I decided to start sharing my fiction writing with others. I've been doing some form of writing for most of my life, and spent over twelve years in music journalism. Just last April, I wrote "The Wanderer," my first short story in ages, and it blossomed from there. I was initially nervous to share my work, but as time went on and the number of readers I had grew, I felt that it was time to make the jump into getting a book published. I absolutely could not be here without the wonderful people that have taken their time to read my writing and leave positive words of encouragement, and I will be forever thankful to them.


Risks & Challenges

The actual writing on all of these stories (aside from any custom ones) is done. The only real challenge is raising enough money for printing. Even if the campaign doesn't reach the $1,000 goal, I will still get the printing done. Due to the increased cost of printing hardcover books, those will only be available if the campaign reaches at least $800. The first priorities are getting the cover art done and the stories professionally edited, which won't be terribly expensive. Printing is the priciest step in the process, but I will make sure it happens no matter what. In the chance that it does not, I will ensure that each and every backer receives a full refund, but the likelihood of that becoming necessary is slim to none.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, I absolutely understand. You can help by telling your friends, sharing my stories, and just helping to get the word out about "Bridges." My readers have grown entirely due to word of mouth from you guys, and that will help once again here. The simple fact that you take the time to read my writing already means so much to me, and I can never thank you all enough. So please feel free to share, or ask me if you wish to help in some other ways.

story:
Hi. I'm Greta Christina -- author and editor of several books, mostly about either sex or atheism. I'm writing an erotic fiction novel, and I'd love your help!

My novel is currently titled "Coming." It tells the story of one woman's sex life, starting in 1970 when she's 18, and ending in roughly the present day. Each chapter describes a different sexual encounter, at a different point in her life. The book is a series of intense sex scenes, with several years between them. I'm looking at this woman's life -- her name is Sheila -- through the lens of sex. I'm exploring Sheila's sex life, the rest of her life, and how they intertwine. In particular, I'm looking at how she makes choices about sex. Sheila is often adventurous, even reckless, she makes decisions impulsively -- but she's also cautious, a careful planner, likes to be in control. I'm interested in how being both impulsive and a control freak plays out out in her sex life.

I'm writing the novel with lots of fun, hot, sexy sex. Women with women, women with men, probably some men with men, probably some gender fluidity, some of it kinky and SM-y, some of it not. It is an erotic novel, and I'm making it erotic. It's also a novel -- a story about people's lives. As you know if you've read my erotic fiction, I hate erotica that's, "plot, sex scene, plot, sex scene." I don't see these as separate. Erotica is much hotter when you get a sense of what the sex feels like -- not just what's happening physically, but the emotions, the sensations, how this sex is going to change the characters' lives.

I'm not going to be falsely modest -- as an erotic fiction writer, I am very good at this, it's one of the things I do best. People who have read my short erotic fiction collection, Bending, can attest to this. (Don't take my word for it -- the reviews, both professional and from Amazon customers, are glowing.)

So. Hopefully you're intrigued, and want to read this novel. Why am I doing an Indiegogo campaign?

There are expenses with writing and publishing a book. I generally self-publish my ebooks, which means paying a formatter. I'm a control freak about cover design, which means I get wonderful covers -- but also means I have to pay a designer.

But the Number One expense of writing a book is time. Books do not spring fully formed from an author. It takes time -- and I'll need to pay the bills and the mortgage while I'm writing it. I'll keep doing my other paid writing -- blogging, magazine articles, etc. -- but I won't able to do as much of it. Writing a book is immensely fun, deeply rewarding -- erotic fiction especially -- and it produces something of substance that people want to read. But it takes time. Whenever you buy a book, or support an author's crowdfunding campaign, that's most of what you're paying for. The more money I raise, the more time I'll be able to put into this book, and the better it will be.

I'm offering a number of perks for donators. They're listed here, on this Indiegogo page. Perks include signed copies of the book, regular updates about the book's progress, invitations to a private book launch party, one-on-one Skype conversations about the book, and thank yous, of course. But mostly, I hope you want to read this novel. Please kick in what you can, and please help spread the word. Thanks!

scene." I don't see these as separate. Erotica is much hotter when you get
a sense of what the sex feels like
-- not just what's happening physically, but the emotions, the sensations, how
this sex is going to change the characters' lives.I'm not going to be falsely
modest -- as an erotic fiction writer, I am very good at this, it's one of the
things I do best. People who have read my short erotic fiction collection, Bending, can attest to this. (Don't take my word for it -- the reviews, both professional and from Amazon customers, are glowing.)
So. Hopefully you're intrigued, and want to read this
novel. Why am I doing an Indiegogo campaign?
There are expenses with writing and publishing a book. I
generally self-publish my ebooks, which means paying a formatter. I'm a control
freak about cover design, which means I get wonderful covers -- but also means
I have to pay a designer.
But the Number One expense of writing a book is time. Books
do not spring fully formed from an author. It takes time -- and I'll need to
pay the bills and the mortgage while I'm writing it. I'll keep doing my other
paid writing -- blogging, magazine articles, etc. -- but I won't able to do as
much of it. Writing a book is immensely fun, deeply rewarding -- erotic fiction
especially -- and it produces something of substance that people want to read.
But it takes time. Whenever you buy a book, or support an author's crowdfunding
campaign, that's most of what you're paying for. The more money I raise, the
more time I'll be able to put into this book, and the better it will be.
I'm offering a number of perks for donators. They're
listed here, on this Indiegogo page. Perks include signed copies of the book,
regular updates about the book's progress, invitations to a private book launch
party, one-on-one Skype conversations about the book, and thank yous, of
course. But mostly, I hope you want to read this novel. Please kick in what you
can, and please help spread the word. Thanks!

story:
Can I share my story with you?


My name is Kebrina (K'brina) Morgan and I am the author of Gemini Season ...musing. It is a book of poetry that tells of my journey from the lowest point in my life to where I currently am, "My journey from Pain to Prosperity" as I like to refer to it. The book begins with the death of a very influential friend and the introduction of Mr. Gemini. It continues to me having my daughter taken away, losing my husband, my home and basically everything that I valued or held dare to my heart. It speaks of my mindset and where I was and how I coped.

The $3,000 that I'm requesting will be used to pay for the printing, marketing and distribution of the books. I managed to cut some cost by doing the artwork and layout myself.

How Gemini Season came about…

The first poem in Gemini Season …musing, titled “See You Tomorrow?” speaks of Kenny, the person who unknowingly started it all. He was the one who introduced me to Michael, referred throughout the book as Mr. Gemini, Mic Truth, Boogie (Down Bronx) and Alexander the Great. After sharing the story of my life with him in poetic for he made the suggestion of putting a book together and I thought about it, prayed about it, discussed it with a fellow author and longtime friend of mine, Angelot Ndongmo, weighed the pros and cons of the different publishing options and decided that I was going to do it.


About Gemini Season ...musing

 “Gemini Season ...musing" is a 2 Part book of poetry that tells my journey from the lowest point in my life to where I currently am; rebuilding my life while trying to finding true happiness.”

This isnt an easy task seeing that I had lost an influential friend, parental rights to my daughter, my husband left me, and I was evicted from my home. Basically everything that I held dear was lost in the span of a year. It speaks of my mindset and how I coped. It also tells of Michael “Mr Gemini” Ampah-Baiden and how I felt he helped me until I was able to cope without him.

Most of this book was written after I left the Yorktown Shelter for Women lying next to the Humber River at Cruickshank Park, reflecting on where I was emotionally and everything that I overcame.


(Reading at the Yorktown Shelter for Women Christmas Dinner 2015)


The choice to self publish under my company’s name, The K’brina Morgan Co., came about because I had a vision for this book. I have a story that I NEED to tell and there was a specific way that I wanted it told. Being a single mother restarting my life from the bottom, this wasn’t the easiest or the cheapest way to go but I am willing to make sacrifices to see this dream into fruition.

There have been moments when things looked daunting and I reconsidered putting this work out until one night I was doing an open mic at the Harlem Restaurant for “Project R.I.S.E” a Domestic violence and awareness event hosted by Jessica Louiseli and someone came up to me after the reading and said, “Thank you for that, I NEEDED to hear your poem today.” That’s when I decided that no matter what hardships I faced I AM going to put out this book. If my poems are able to help at least ONE PERSON realize that their situation will get better one day, then everything I went through and all the money, effort and time I have invested so far wouldn’t be for naught."


How your contribution helps not only my dream but also the kids at Jane and Finch.

So last summer while I was working at Sunrise Finch and updating their Instagram page, I found out about this organization at Jane and Finch called Futuristic Kids.(https://www.facebook.com/futuristiickids/) The ladies that run the organization are amazing and the lengths that they go to in order to raise funds for educational materials for these kids drew me to them, so I decided to visit when they were at the Jane and Finch mall collecting donations. They were the nicest set of ladies everrrrrr (and yes I did sign their "I am awesome" board)!!!

Have you ever caught yourself in a situation where you wanted to do MORE or help but because of financial constraints or "LIFE" you weren't able to?! Well that's what happened. I still gave what I had but I walked away feeling like I wanted to do more. Well I shared their event on our Insta and fb page encouraging people in the area to donate whatever they could.

Well, after my prayers couple nights ago an idea came to mind and that is what I'm rambling on about now. lol

After discussing it with the printing company and calculating costs, this is what we worked out and I decided on.

The first 200 copies of Gemini Season ...musing that I print, I will be donating $5 from each book sold in stores and/or online or through preorders done through Indiegogo to Futuristic Kids!

Thank you for taking the time to read this all the way through, stay awesome!

If you're not able to donate at this time...

Please feel free to help spread the word about my campaign ... I can be found on most social media platforms. Simply search @kbrinamorgan including but not limited to:

www.instagram.com/KbrinaMorgan

www.twitter.com/KbrinaMorgan

www.kbrinamorgan.com

HAVE AN AWESOME DAY!!!

story:
Short Summary

I am an academic and media artist who studied at Eötvös Loránd University’s Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences Departments and holds two master degrees in aesthetics and cultural anthropology. In all of the three faculties I dealt with visual communication, representations of cultural identity and memory. This year I was a Fulbright scholar at New York University and I was researching on the American History about Jewish museums and novel modes of representation. I have worked in film, video, media art, commercials and music video since 2003.

I have been working on this topic the last seven years and I hope thanks to all who supported me in the museum and academic field I will be capable to write something meaningful and useful for the future generation. With your help, I can write and publish online my book that will be available for anyone. 

 

How I will use your support?

I will split the funding for 4 different areas. 

1. Finance as a half-time job to write the dissertation.

2. Travel expenses for lectures and meetings about the research area. 

3. Translator payment for the official English version. 

4. University fees for the final examination with the book.  

 

Innovative Jewish Museums is being spearheaded by a member of the Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Foundation network and has been awarded a matching grant. Schusterman is a global organization that seeks to ignite the passion and unleash the power in young people to create positive change for themselves, the Jewish community and the broader world. Learn more about the Foundation here.

More details about the research

Goals of research - My overall objective is to finalize my Ph.D. thesis that is focusing on the comparison of the European and American Jewish Museums, how the first salon like in Vienna or the basic collections in Budapest or Berlin become a center of Jewish culture and how it differs from the first Jewish Museum in the USA. Thanks to the Fulbright Scholarship I had a visiting scholar position at the New York University Skirball Department of Hebrew and Judaic Studies for the 2015/2016 academic year under the guidance of Professor Hasia R. Diner. Through this opportunity I was able to visit most of the American Jewish Museums that I planned to use for my dissertation and thanks to my supervisor I had the possibility to gain more knowledge about American Jewish history. I had the chance to visit the Skirball Museum and the Tolerance Center in Los Angeles (including an interview with the director), the Jewish Museums in Miami, Atlanta, Philadelphia and San Francisco, including all the museums that deals with Jewish topics in New York. 

As an aesthete and cultural anthropologist my thesis invokes various fields of discipline such as historiography, cultural and visual studies, cultural philosophy, sociology or anthropology. I argue for the power of art that is not only a product of history but also its agent to transform as well as shape the ways cultural, historical issues are being conceived. In my research I discover the educational methods behind the objects and memorials, and understand the international message of the museum itself. Besides the Fulbright scholarship until now I had the possibility through other scholarships to research in Hungary, Austria and Germany, but my interest brought me to visit several Jewish Museums in Europe to include them. I have visited the most of the Jewish Museums in Europe, like Belgium (Brussels), Czech Republic (Prague), France (Paris), The Netherlands (Amsterdam), Poland (Krakow, Warsaw), Spain (Barcelona, Cordoba), Turkey (Istanbul), U.K. (London), Bosnia and Herzegovina (Sarajevo), Lithuania (Vilnius), Italy (Rome) and Denmark (Copenhagen) which I like to use as examples when I create my categories and compare them by function. 

The dissertation starts with the most important question in this topic, what a Jewish Museum in general means, how we can define it as an institution and also what is the reason for their existence. The European and American way is different in how the ideology of the institution developed. As Barbara Kirshenblatt-Gimblett says “virtually all “Jewish museums” in Europe are Holocaust museums by another name, with some possible exceptions. Outside Europe, Jewish museums are often immigration museums by another name.” These characteristics give a value to the museum itself and also for the space that changed a lot in the last twenty years. As we look ahead to the future of the museums in the twenty-first century, we are not only talking about the changes of the space but also about the understandings of communication and online visibility. I am exploring the types of museological and educational tools being used to communicate offline and online about Jewish art and the interpretation of these pieces. 

Importance of the research - Jewish Museums are popular destinations for both Jewish and non-Jewish visitors. Most of these institutions were created to house the local community’s relics and ritual objects (Judaicas). Later on they became places for exhibiting Jewish history and culture. The museums are used for informal education purposes not only for students and adults in the local community but also for tourists. The permanent collection and the temporary exhibition together express the museum's image. This image has strongly expanded in the last few years thanks to the growing online presence of these institutions (website and other media platforms), so this conceptual development is becoming faster and more visible internationally. Still there are a lot of questions about the topic, - especially because of the development what I mentioned above, - not so many resources are focusing on this issue. The Jewish Museum’s concepts developed in the 1980s in Europe and there are only a few that are exceptions. Jewish Museums are in a transition phase in two ways. The first one is the technical development, - what I call Revolution in my title -, which changes not only the presentation but also the understanding of these institutions. The second one is the content, because the current exhibitions need to be rethought. Most of these places want to adopt this new, changing methodology and they want to catch the attention of a broader audience.

I believe this research is unique because a comparison still does not exist which discusses about the technical development as a new revolution and the representation of the Jewish Museums. There are some platforms to rethink the European Jewish museums future, which started their work not long time ago in public. These are the Association of European Jewish Museums, The Rothschild Foundation Europe and a new program called RFE-Paideia Museum Program, which organized their first conference in early 2014. These experiments are very promising, although the academic research is not part of the innovations yet. My research can join to this new way of thinking and rethinking of the Jewish Museums and I hope it can be useful not only as an academic dissertation but also as part of the renewal. With my previous research projects in Budapest, Vienna or Berlin I would say there is a constant need to redefine what a museum is or can be, but first we have to define the story behind the place.
