Bonus for all campaign visitors: Download two issues for free in PDF format!

We'll ask for details about your donation—such as which art print you've selected or which school you've designated to receive a book—after the campaign ends October 1st. BackerKit makes perk fulfillment easy! Details »

Received a postcard? Choose “get one + one” to reserve your copy of any issue of Ember and we’ll send a second copy of that issue to the classroom or library you specify!

This campaign comes on the heels of our first-year collection, which contained forty works in two issues ranging from delightful (like “Cat Tail” and “The Frog Who Swallowed the Moon”) to poignant (“The Precipice” and “The Anniversary”).

You can read our first two issues for free in PDF format.

Each volume of Ember contains two issues: Fall and Spring. Volume 2 has firm shipping dates of late October 2015 and late April 2016. The content and artwork of the Fall 2015 issue are complete, and we’re working on final editing and layout.

One of the most exciting things about each issue is the opportunity to feature work from young writers in addition to great stories for young readers. Our Issue 1 lineup includes six contributors aged 18 or under, designated below by the Ember quill:

  • “Red” by Susan Boesger
  • “Shadow” by Uche Okonkwo
  • “Silver” by Susan LaMoreaux
  • “Frankenstein’s Gryphon” by Mary E. Lowd
  • “The Balloon Man” by M.H. Liu
  • “Don’t be Scared” by Dylan Boyle
  • “The Cycle of the Seasons” by DJ Tryer
  • “The Last Giant Ammonite” by E.M. Eastick
  • “The Snake Changes His Wardrobe” by Nels Hanson
  • “Fear of Sudden Things” by Jennifer Pruiett-Selby
  • “Forging Destiny” by Michael Pignatella
  • “Sea Change” by Anna Zumbro
  • “The Listening” by Nathan Harris
  • “The Storm Witch” by C.I. Kemp
  • “Then Came a Spider” by Amanda Lara
  • “Fire” by Sophia Cabana
  • “Forget” by Sabrina Polly
  • “Here” by Hannah Manetsch
  • “Jazz Sequins” by Gloria Keeley
  • “Time” by E.N. Loizis

We want each issue of Ember to be exquisite—a true work of literary and visual art. The cover art for this issue is a custom commission from artist and illustrator Choong Yoon, created just for us!

Reprising her role as Ember illustrator, Casey Robin (www.caseyrobin.com) has created beautiful and unique illustrations for our Fall 2015 issue. Here are just a few of them—can you guess which stories and poems they belong to?

Right now we are polishing the Fall issue for publication, but we’re already hard at work picking the selections for Spring, too! We will update this list as it grows, but here are the first pieces already accepted:
  • “Black Tears in Heaven” by Dany G. Zuwen
  • “Stockholm Syndrome” by Anne Lawrence Bradshaw
  • “A Tibetan Epistle” by Sreyash Sarkar
  • “Close to Tomorrow” by Emily McCosh
  • “The Spider Shows You How” by Nels Hanson
  • “Bury the Pages” by S. Thomas Summers
  • “Grandma’s Leather Sofa” by Shannon Lawrence
  • “Vacated Plots” by Liesl Nunns
  • “The Panoptimom” by Erica L. Satifka

Sean Greenberg’s “The Carrot is Mightier than the Sword” is one of my favorite paintings, and Sean agreed to expand the original into a full landscape illustration that will wrap around the book.

Why mess with perfection? I love working with Casey Robin, and I look forward to featuring her amazing illustrations in Spring 2016, too.

 

All sponsors of this campaign (at every level) get digital full-color copies of our first four issues in PDF format.

Value: $25 / Your Donation: $10 — Despite best efforts to ensure quality, the first print run of any book often contains errors that are corrected in subsequent printings.

The interesting side effect is that even with these errors, first printings of many books become highly collectible because only a limited number exist. For our first issue, we printed 250 copies before making corrections. For our second, just 500 were printed on the first run. We anticipate each of our next first-run printings to be between 500 and 1,000 copies at most. Of course we’ll print more as justified by demand, but there will never be a second “first run”!

The next 100 funders can choose a signed First Printing copy of one issue of Ember for just $10—that’s a $25 value.

A note on availability: Volume 1 Issue 1 (Fall 2014) first printings are sold out. Volume 1 Issue 2 (Spring 2015) has about 100 copies left from the initial run of 500. We will create between 250 and 1,000 copies for each of the Volume 2 issues, depending on the demand from this campaign.

Margaret Dilloway is the award-winning author of Sisters of Heart and Snow, The Care and Handling of Roses With Thorns, and How to Be an American Housewife. Her new book for younger readers—the first in a series—was enthusiastically picked up by Disney-Hyperion and will be released in early 2016.

In Momotaro: Xander and the Lost Island of Monsters, young Xander Miyamoto would rather do anything other than listen to his sixth-grade teacher drone on about weather. But when Xander’s father disappears in an unexpected storm, the boy embarks on an epic journey to find him, and in the process—guided only by a comic book as a guide against acid waterfalls, angry giants, volcanoes, and more—discovers that he’s the latest in a line of Momotaro heroes.

How the book is connected to this campaign: I first met Margaret in 1992 at the California State Summer School for the Arts when we were both students there, and reached out after purchasing her first novel a few years ago. When she announced Momotaro last year, she also mentioned that Choong Yoon was doing the book’s cover art. That led to me contact the same artist to inquire about a commission for Ember—resulting in the perfect cover for our Fall 2015 issue.

Disney-Hyperion has donated 10 copies of Momotaro: Xander and the Lost Island of Monsters to this fundraiser, and Margaret Dilloway has graciously agreed to sign them for you! The book itself will retail for $17 in April 2016.

Bonus: When you select this perk, you may also choose a copy of any issue of Ember: A Journal of Luminous Things.

Authors and poets with work in our first four issues, together with selected staff at Ember, have created an eBook of writing prompts to inspire you on your own creative journey! Sentences, scenes, paragraphs, and instructions, this collection is sure to unleash your imagination. Which is why, not coincidentally, we’ve asked Enkel Dika to use his artwork “Unleashed Imagination” as the digital cover for this book of writing prompts!

The list of contributing authors and poets who are providing these prompts will grow, but the participants so far include:

• BC Flinton • Jennifer Pruiett-Selby • Liesl Nunns • Mariva DeBorde
• Bert Lowe • Kacey Vanderkarr • M.H. Liu • Stone Showers • JC Hemphill
• BL Draper • Mary E. Lowd • Gloria Keeley • John Biggs • Aidan Doyle
• Nathan Harris • Nels Hanson • S. Thomas Summers • Amanda Lara
• Michael Pignatella • Shannon Lawrence • C.I. Kemp • E.N. Loizis
• Erica Eastick • Susan LaMoreaux • Gerri Leen • P. Jo Anne Burgh
• Emily McCosh • Renee Carter Hall • Dany G. Zuwen

Each of our books is available in high-quality trade paperback with a sturdy 10pt glossy cover and coated 80# paper. This makes the text and artwork crisp on every page—and the book itself feels amazing in your hand.

Of course, there’s also the great content, and that is what justifies creating such a high-quality printed product. Every aspect of every issue of Ember makes it something you’ll be proud to keep on your shelf.

Availability

Volume 1, Issue 1 (Fall 2014)
Available Now

Volume 1, Issue 2 (Spring 2015)
Available Now

Volume 2, Issue 1 (Fall 2015)
Available in October

Volume 2, Issue 2 (Spring 2016)
Available in April

All funders will receive a copy from our first printing of each issue while supplies last. Volume 1 Issue 1 (Fall 2014) first printings are sold out. We have about 200 first printing copies of Volume 1 Issue 2 (Spring 2015) left. We will create between 500 and 1,000 copies for each of the Volume 2 issues, depending on the demand from this campaign.

Just One Issue

Your Donation: $20 — Pick any one issue of Ember from our first two years! You’ll be able to specify which issue you want when we send out our end-of-campaign survey.

One for You + One for Them

Value: $40 / Your Donation: $20 — Get the Ember issue of your choice, and we'll send a second copy of that issue to the classroom or library you specify! A great way to ensure that young readers have access to these collections. Plus, for the next 100 people who select this option, we'll cover all the shipping—worldwide—to you and to the classroom or library. You’ll be able to specify which issue you've reserved when we send out our end-of-campaign survey.

Pick Any Two

Value: $40 / Your Donation: $35 — Get two Ember issues of your choice. They don’t have to be sequential! You’ll be able to specify which issue you've reserved when we send out our end-of-campaign survey.

Gotta Read ’Em All

Value: $60 / Your Donation: $50 — Get all four issues from our first two years of Ember and start filling your bookshelf with the complete collection!

Class Pack

Value: $100 / Your Donation: $60 — Get five copies of the same issue for your classroom, library, or family! You’ll be able to specify which issue you've reserved when we send out our end-of-campaign survey.

Lifetime Subscription

Value: $400+ / Your Donation: $150 — You're a rockstar, and you deserve a rockstar perk. Donate $150 or more and get a trade paperpack copy of every past and future issue of Ember.

We want Ember to be exquisite, a true work of literary and visual art. All art prints are created on high-quality archival paper and are suitable for framing.

Browse all available cover art and illustrations at emberjournal.org/perks/artwork!

Illustrations by Casey Robin

Your Donation: $25 — Every story in our Spring 2015, Fall 2015, and Spring 2016 is lovingly and masterfully illustrated by artist and illustrator Casey Robin. Every illustration is available on two paper sizes: 8.5" × 11" (11" × 8.5" for landscape) and 13" × 19" (19" × 13" for landscape).

Below are just a few that work well in the smaller size, or you can browse them all here.

Illustrations by Casey Robin — Large Size

Your Donation: $40 — Some pictures are just better ... bigger! Every Casey Robin illustration is available on two paper sizes: 8.5" × 11" (11" × 8.5" for landscape) and 13" × 19" (19" × 13" for landscape).

Below are just a few that work well in the larger size, or you can browse them all here.

Cover Art by James R. Eads

Your Donation: $60 — Our inaugural issue features “Portals” by artist and illustrator James R. Eads, commissioned and created specifically for Ember. Limited Edition prints from a total of just 60 were provided by the artist. All but the 10 available here have sold out—this is your last chance to get one!

Each 12" × 18" high quality giclée print on archival paper is hand signed and numbered by the artist with a white border suitable for framing. Prints are shipped in a clear protective sleeve in a sturdy flat mailer.


Cover Art by Keliana Tayler

Your Donation: $60 — Each high quality fine art print is hand-embellished on stretched canvas, then signed and numbered by the artist. This edition is limited to 30 prints, with all but 12 prints sold out. Prints are shipped in a rigid stay-flat mailer.

We commissioned this artwork to go along with the story “The Frog Who Swallowed the Moon” by Renee Carter Hall, which leads our Sprint 2015 issue. The result—I'm sure you'll agree—is astounding! Limited Edition prints of “Frog and Sister Moon” by were provided by the artist.


Cover Art by Keliana Tayler — Open Edition

Your Donation: $45 — Open edition prints are high-quality giclée on 19" × 13" Epson Velvet Fine Art Paper suitable for framing, and are shipped in a clear protective sleeve in a sturdy flat mailer.

Illustrations by Sean Greenberg

Your Donation: $25 — In addition to providing the cover art to our Springt 2016 issue, Sean Greenberg illustrated selected works in our inaugural issue! Every illustration is available on 8.5" × 11" art paper.

Below are just a few of Sean's illustrations, or you can browse them all here.

Because we are a United States non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, your completed donations are tax-deductible in most jurisdictions.

Our U.S. Federal Tax ID:
Empire & Great Jones Creative Arts Foundation
46-1209424

Our Mailing Address:
6100 Horseshoe Bar Road
Suite A-133
Loomis, CA 95650

Here are some details on where the money goes.

Ember contributors receive an offer of 2¢ per word (or $20 per work, whichever is more). That’s what is known in the industry as “semi-pro” pay rate, and while it’s important that authors are paid for their work, it’s really not much. If we meet our fundraising goal, however, we’ll be able start offering professional rates to all contributors.

If you’re not a writer, you may wonder why you should know or care what we pay our authors and poets. While there are many good reasons, it comes down to these two: quality content and fulfilling our mission.

Quality Content: When we pay professional rates, we attract even better stories and poems for you to read.

Fulfilling our Mission: What better way to foster and encourage talented writers than by paying them a rate that demonstrates the value of their work? When we pay new writers the same rate as established pros, we send a clear message that we recognize the quality of their work and value of their talent.

There’s a reason each issue looks so good! From cover art to interior illustrations, every collection’s artwork is vibrant and engaging. So far, we’ve worked with James R. Eads, Keliana Tayler, Choong Yoon, Sean Greenberg, and Casey Robin—always contracting with the best artists to get the best work at the best price.

To ensure the highest quality presentation possible, we work with Alexander’s Print Advantage to create a perfect full-color trade paperback on sturdy, coated paper. The illustrations are crisp and the book feels great, too!

At E&GJ Press, we’ve been working with Alexander’s Print Advantage for about three years and have consitently enjoyed personal customer service, great prices, and top-tier printing expertise.

Don’t worry, I’ll cover these expenses—they are not coming out of this fundraiser—but I want to at least disclose what some of them are.

  • Website hosting fees
  • Payment processing fees (for store.egjpress.org)
  • Fulfillment service subscription fees

Actually ... no.

No one on the Ember staff is paid, including me. Everything you see is the work of a team of amazing volunteers who handle everything from reading manuscripts to sending responses to typesetting to marketing.

I’d actually like to change my volunteers to paid employees, and I certainly welcome your contributions toward making it happen, but paying the Ember staff is not part of this fundraiser. If you’d like to help me thank these volunteers, or if you’d like to join them, please contact me at editor@egjpress.org.

This campaign comes on the heels of our first-year collection, which contained forty works in two issues ranging from delightful (like “Cat Tail” and “The Frog Who Swallowed the Moon”) to poignant (“The Precipice” and “The Anniversary”).

We’ve shown that a collection with content appropriate for younger readers can be accessible but still provide challenge and stimulation for advanced students.

That the stories in Ember can be enjoyed by adults.

That our products are beautiful and high-quality publications.

To underscore that, and in the hope that you’ll be as excited as I am (and convinced to support this fundraiser), I’m offering you both of our Volume 1 issues free in PDF format just for taking the time to listen. Simply click on the covers above to download your digital copy!

If you’d like to help me thank these volunteers, or if you’d like to join them, please contact me at editor@egjpress.org.



This campaign comes on the heels of our first-year collection, which contained forty works in two issues ranging from delightful (like “Cat Tail” and “The Frog Who Swallowed the Moon”) to poignant (“The Precipice” and “The Anniversary”). 
We’ve shown that a collection with content appropriate for younger readers can be accessible but still provide challenge and stimulation for advanced students. 
That the stories in Ember can be enjoyed by adults. 
That our products are beautiful and high-quality publications.




To underscore that, and in the hope that you’ll be as excited as I am (and convinced to support this fundraiser), I’m offering you both of our Volume 1 issues free in PDF format just for taking the time to listen. Simply click on the covers above to download your digital copy!

story:
About Our Book

If you want to be part of the effort to sustain true and healthy, positive and richly textured, images of African Americans, and to support outstanding African American literature, then you will want to check out this new collection of short stories by the multi-talented Clarence Major . . . 

Do you like great stories about human interaction? Chicago Heat and Other Stories is a 280-page collection of short fiction by a master storyteller. Clarence Major is a prizewinning short story writer, novelist, poet, and painter. A finalist for the National Book Award and the Los Angeles Book Critics Prize, Clarence was also the recipient of the 2015 Lifetime Achievement Award in the Fine Arts, presented by the Congressional Black Caucus Foundation and professor emeritus at the University of California at Davis.

Please join me in helping to support the book launch and expenses for Clarence Major’s new collection of short stories. Having written more than eight novels, including My Amputations and Dirty Bird Blues, alongside a dozen books of poetry, Chicago Heat and Other Stories is Clarence Major’s second work of short fiction and first book with Green Writers Press, a small Brattleboro-based publishing company I founded in 2014, dedicated to spreading environmental awareness and social justice by publishing authors who proliferate messages of hope and renewal through place-based writing and environmental activism.

Chicago Heat and Other Stories employs a gorgeous purity and simplicity of language in a series of masterful stories exploring human interaction. Each narrative voice comes forward all at once, individual and complete, without obstacle or complication, enabling the reader to see the characters and feel their emotions. Major does not shy away from the bitter or the harsh; we get to hear it all. Like paint on an easel, he blends lyric harmony with moxie and the blunt with the beautiful. The imagery is completely accessible and generously given. Toni Morrison comes to mind. His work is like jewels.

This book will be released in hardcover with a dust jacket in early September of this year by Green Writers Press.


Why We Are Reaching Out to You

Thanks to the immense generosity and support of this prominent African American artist, writer, and poet, Clarence Major, we are set to publish what could very well be a breakout book for a small indie press that is only 3 years old. For us at Green Writers Press, this has been a labor of love; we have not paid ourselves a cent for our time editing, designing or promoting this book.

Glowing reviews are coming in now! 

“[Clarence] Major… creates embodied, engaging characters who observe events carefully and grow with their stories…Major is able to capture the ambiguity of the human condition… This work will appeal to all readers of literature.” —Library Journal, starred review

But a book does cost money to put on the shelf: the printing bill for the first 500 copies is $3,000 and we need money for publicity and to help pay for travel expenses for Clarence's Book Tour.

As our publishing date approaches, we are now seeking funds to support those needs. Half of the $3000 we are asking for will support our printing and production costs; the other half will support our publicity campaign and New England book tour. The $3000 will by no means cover all of our expenses, but it will help us along the way! If we raise more money, that will, of course, help!


Why We Think This Matters

We are a small press in southern Vermont and honored to have Clarence on our fall list of upcoming books. We need your help to get this book printed as a hardcover and additional financial support for publicity and to help fund travel to all the talks and readings he has been invited to—including at Harvard, NYU, Emerson College and more.

Clarence has just recently been invited to read at the AWP 50th Anniversary Conference and Book Fair, February 8-11, Washington, DC. His is a voice that needs to be heard—a calm, literate, and powerful voice—in the cloud of racism that has risen its ugly head and enveloped our great country.

“Here we have the best of literary fiction: visceral characters and compelling plots . . . ” —Kirkus Reviews

All, or most, of the characters in the collection, are African-American. The importance of this is not to be underestimated given the current climate of racism in our country, and I think that this collection really should reach a large audience. But we need your help.


What We Need & What You Get

Again, we are hoping to raise $3000 to help cover our printing and publicity costs and support our widespread publicity campaign along with travel expenses for Clarence to go on book tour.

By supporting this project via this fundraising campaign you will:

Provide us with the needed upfront funding to get these books on the shelf!

Receive your own hot-off-the-press copy of Chicago Heat and Other Stories

Give a higher percentage of your dollars directly to Green Writers Press

Support 350.org and the other environmental campaigns that Green Writers Press Supports—in this case, Clarence and the press will earmark a percentage of our profits to the Southern Poverty Law Center

Support an independent press with an environmental mission (www.greenwriterspress.com)

Help foster this country's African American literary community, literary history and literary vitality, namely, "How does an African American writer find a way in the highly volatile literary culture that is influenced by the history of race and politics in America?"

Help promote the work of one of our greatest writers

Receive other perks, depending on how much you are able to give (see "Perks" for details).                                                


A Little More About Us

Green Writers Press is a Vermont-based, global publisher whose mission is to spread a message of environmental activism through the words and images we publish.  Printing on demand (POD) in the US and using only FSC-certified paper, we are committed to preserving and protecting the natural resources of the earth and, to that end, donate a percentage of our proceeds  350.org and other environmental organizations. 

You can read more about Green Writers Press at www.greenwriterspress.com


Feeling Broke, But Still Want to Help? 

Believe us, we understand. And yes, there are still ways you can help!

Ask your local libraries to order copies.

Tell your local, independent bookstore about the book since we don't have money for a broad marketing campaign.

Share this campaign with your friends via word-of-mouth or social media—see easy links in top right column, or copy and paste the url from your browser and share in on Facebook, Twitter, by email . . . or just write a good old letter to your friends).

Check a copy of the book out of the library when it arrives, and enjoy!

story:
Do you love to read but hate the cost that comes with purchasing books? Do you avoid the library or just don’t have the time? Do you have a stack of books collecting dust because you didn’t enjoy them, have only read them once (not even all the way through), and don’t have the heart to throw them out? Are you running out of room in your apartment for all the books you’ve bought, or is the lack of space forcing you into e-books? Do you love the convenience of e-books but miss the feeling of paper between your fingers?

Curious Codex is hoping to save you from all of the hassle by creating a rental service that will make getting a print book convenient and inexpensive. We are looking to revolutionize the book subscription market by creating a cost-efficient, customer-focused book rental service that will allow subscribers to choose from a variety of plans at various price-points. All of these plans will allow you to rent an unlimited number of books per month without consequence - if you only have the time to read one book over the course of a month, or even two, it’ll still be affordable.

Don’t know what to read? Let us pick a book for you! With our “Curated Plan,” we’ll pick a book based on your preferences that we think you’ll enjoy reading. We won’t be charging you a premium for this plan; it’ll actually be our most cost-efficient option. All we ask is that you be a little bit curious!

As New Yorkers, founders Andy Cox and Kat Wood know how hard it is to live in a small New York City apartment while maintaining an enormous book collection. However, this problem is not limited to New York City or tiny apartments - homes can only accommodate so many bookshelves at once, if any! Visiting the library isn’t always a convenience, considering there are often crowds, long lines, and visits can be quite time consuming, and they usually don’t have the book you want and it can take several weeks to get it! While we are not looking to compete with libraries in general – after all, they offer more services than renting books - we are merely trying to provide a service for people who don’t want to take time out of their day to head to a library.

E-books are a fantastic alternative for city-dwellers and suburbanites alike, but after staring at a computer screen at work all day, who wants to stare at a tablet? And we can’t be the only ones who, when readjusting ourselves while reading on a tablet, accidentally move several pages from where we were – talk about losing the moment. There’s just something about a book in your hands that brings reading to life in a way that tablets do not. We get it, e-books are great (we own them!) but we are well aware that some people prefer physical books to e-books. With the creation of Curious Codex, we hope to bring the same convenience of e-books to print-lovers in a different capacity.

Lastly, we understand the struggle that comes with finding a quality book. We love recommending books to our friends and family, and we are often praised for our suggestions. We understand what goes into connecting a reader to a quality book – and we hope to pass this on to you!


Perks:

Our Indiegogo will offer a multitude of perks that people can receive if they donate money. We understand that not everyone can donate, but every dollar counts! We are offering perks to everyone who donates at least $1.


$1: You will receive a personalized email from us! We are extremely grateful that you have contributed to our campaign, and we want to show that. The only reason we are sending you an e-mail is because the cost of postage and the card would exceed the donation!


$5: You will receive a handwritten thank you card in the mail! We will include two book recommendations that we believe everyone should read, including a description about the books and why everyone should read them.


$20: You will receive one** paperback book from our Founder’s Bundle*. You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the book and why it’s one of our favorites!


$30: You will receive the first 3 months of our Curated Plan with 1 book checked out at a time for free, once we have officially launched!

Here’s how the service will work: We will ask you about your reading preferences ahead of time to get a better sense of what you’d like. Once we’ve launched, we will send you a book, which you can have out for as long as you’d like! Once you’re finished, just send it back to us in the same package you got it in, and we’ll send you a new book once we’ve received it. If you’re a quick reader and average one book a week, and taking into consideration the amount of time needed for shipping, you could potentially read 7-9 books at the cost of $30. Please see the Q&A at the end of our Indiegogo to hear our explanation about why we’ve chosen to list our service at $10 per month even though we plan to charge a slightly lower cost once we’ve launched.


$40: You will receive two** paperback books from our Founder’s Bundle*. You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites!


$60: You will receive the first 6 months of our Curated Plan with 1 book checked out at a time for free, once we have officially launched!

Here’s how the service will work: We will ask you about your reading preferences ahead of time to get a better sense of what you’d like. Once we’ve launched, we will send you a book, which you can have out for as long as you’d like! Once you’re finished, just send it back to us in the same package you got it in, and we’ll send you a new book once we’ve received it. If you’re a quick reader and average one book a week, and taking into consideration the amount of time needed for shipping, you could potentially read 17-19 books at the cost of $60. Please see the Q&A at the end of our Indiegogo to hear our explanation about why we’ve chosen to list our service at $10 per month even though we plan to charge a slightly lower cost once we’ve launched.

$75: You will receive an authentic leather book strap, handmade especially for us by a friend and fellow book-lover! You will also receive a handwritten thank you note, including two book recommendations that we believe everyone should read with a description about the books and why everyone should read them. The book strap is pictured above.


$80: You will receive four** paperback books from our Founder’s Bundle*. You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites!


$100: You will receive an authentic leather book strap, handmade especially for us by a friend and fellow book-lover, as well as one** hardcover book from our Founder's Bundle*! You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites!


$120: You will receive six** paperback books from our Founder’s Bundle*. You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites!


$130: You will receive an authentic leather book strap, handmade especially for us by a friend and fellow book-lover, as well as three** paperback books from our Founder's Bundle*! You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites! Please see the $75 perk for a picture of the book strap.


$150: You will receive six** hardcover books from our Founder's Bundle*! You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites!


$250: You will receive an authentic leather book strap, handmade especially for us by a friend and fellow book-lover, as well as six** paperback books from our Founder's Bundle*! You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites! You will also receive the first 6 months of our Curated Plan with 1 book checked out at a time for free, once we have officially launched! Please see the $75 perk for a picture of the book strap.


$500: You will receive an authentic leather book strap, handmade especially for us by a friend and fellow book-lover, as well as six** hardcover books from our Founder's Bundle*! You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites! You will also receive the first YEAR of our Curated Plan with 1 book checked out at a time for free, once we have officially launched! Please see the $75 perk for a picture of the book strap.


$750: You will receive an authentic leather book strap, handmade especially for us by a friend and fellow book-lover, as well as six** hardcover books from our Founder's Bundle*! You will also receive a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites! You will also receive the first YEAR of our Curated Plan with TWO books checked out at a time for free, once we have officially launched! Please see the $75 perk for a picture of the book strap.

Here’s how the “two books” service will work: We will send you two books in their own individual packaging, which will allow you to return them individually. This service will essentially allow you to almost always have at least one of our books, therefore letting you continue reading without having to wait for your next book, as you will not have to return them together!


$1,000: You will receive: an authentic leather book strap, handmade especially for us by a friend and fellow book-lover, six** hardcover books from our Founder's Bundle*, a handwritten thank you card, including a short explanation about the books and why they’re some of our favorites, your first YEAR of our Curated Plan with THREE books checked out at a time for free, and you will be featured on the "About" page of our website once we have officially launched, and THE FOUNDER'S WILL ALSO BE YOUR PERSONAL BOOK CONSULTANTS! Please see the $75 perk for a picture of the book strap.

Here’s how the “three books” service will work: We will send you three books in their own individual packaging, which will allow you to return them individually. This service will essentially allow you to always have at least one of our books, therefore letting you continue reading without having to wait for your next book, and allowing you to even have a backup, as you will not have to return them together! This plan is also an optimal choice for a household of two readers, as they can rotate the three books, and they can either choose to share the books or send them back once one person has finished reading, and this plan will almost always allow both readers to have another book at hand!

For donating $1,000 or more, your name or appropriate alias will be featured on our “About” page, next to our own biographies! This is our way of making sure you’re remembered for making Curious Codex happen!

What is a Personal Book Consultant, you ask? For donating at least $1,000, you will gain access to our personal emails, where you will be able to ask about anything book or New York City-related. Love a book by an author and want to know more about them and their other works? We can get you more information. Want to buy a book for a friend who likes Science-Fiction, but not sure what they’d like? We can give you list of great books with detailed recommendations for you to choose from. Want to find a cute bookstore in NYC? We know plenty! Please understand that this relationship can and will be terminated for any and all inappropriate communication.


$2,000: You will receive everything listed in the $1,000 perk, but you will also receive a LIFETIME membership to our service. At launch, this will be our Curated Plan with FIVE books checked out at a time, with the option to switch over to the Chosen Plan once that service has launched (we have no ETA at this time). By donating $2,000 or more, you have guaranteed that this service will go live, so we will always be grateful, and hope a lifetime membership to our service will suffice as a means of paying you back. We thank you!

A $2,000 or more donation easily warrants a lifetime subscription to Curious Codex. It is a lot of money, but it easily makes it possible for us to launch, no matter what! As long as Andy and Kat remain the owners of Curious Codex, you will receive our five books at a time, Curated or Chosen Plan, forever, and that’s our promise to you!


*The Founder’s Bundle is a compilation of six books, three from each founder, which they believe everyone should read at one point or another. They’re not only some of our favorite books, but they are wonderful reads!

**We will be sure to contact you regarding your preferences if you are unable to let us know. If you are not receiving all six books from the Founder’s Bundle, we want to make sure you are more likely to enjoy the two, three, or four books you do receive!

How your money will be used:

BOOKS: In order for us to provide this service, we need to purchase quite a few books. Books don’t come cheap. After all, that is one of the many reasons we’re looking to provide this service. In order for us to receive bulk pricing, we must buy books in bulk; therefore, we need a significant amount of money. To purchase the initial amount of books we expect to need at launch, we will need to spend roughly $5,000 - $7,500. This amount will go up significantly if there is more demand than we are expecting. If, for example, 5,000 people donate to this campaign with the intention of using our service once we have launch, we will need over 5,000 books, which would cost us roughly $50,000 - $75,000, at the very bare minimum! Since we are renting and reusing books, our long-term cost for books will go down significantly, but the initial cost, as you can see, is very high.


PACKAGING: In order to provide an efficient service, we need to create packaging that will prevent the books from being damaged, possesses the ability to fit in mailboxes of various sizes, and it must serve as a means of returning the book when done reading. As this is a task we cannot personally accomplish, we not only need to have someone else design the packaging with our creative input, but we must also make it possible for the packaging to be created and printed in bulk. We already have several potential designs in mind, and have a good idea of how we want the packaging to work with the primary goal being user-friendly packaging and assuring the book is protected during shipping. All we need now is to work with a professional to execute our plan, develop a means of creating the packaging in a cost-efficient manner, and buying enough to have ready for our launch date. Between the design, creation, and procurement of packaging, we expect this to be roughly $10,000 - $15,000, if not more, if more people use our service than expected at launch.


WEBSITE: While our website will be simple for the initial launch, it will eventually need to be able to support a vast database of books. The website needs to be user-friendly, visually pleasing, but most of all, we want it to be an enjoyable experience. While we have envisioned our dream website, we do not have the technical knowledge or expertise to accomplish this (if you’ve headed over to our current temporary website put together by Andy, our website capabilities are extremely limited). We will have to find a web professional to not only assist us in building the ultimate website, but to also help us maintain the website as we grow. Website creation and maintenance can vary in price, and we want to provide a unique, memorable, and painless experience. We do not have a solid price point for our website, as it will be an ongoing cost that will continue to increase in price. For our initial launch, which will revolve around our Curated Plan, a simple website with a subscription-based payment option would be easy to set up, would cost very little, and we would only need to create an area within each user's profile for you to notify us of your preferences. However, this isn’t the goal. We want a website where you will lose yourself in a world of books and be able to explore books just like getting lost in a library. Any “extra” money after books and packaging will essentially be allocated into our website with the intention of achieving our dream website sooner than later.


STORAGE: We live in New York City, so we do not possess the space necessary to store a handful of books in our apartments, let alone thousands of books. Initially, we will be renting a storage unit to act as our warehouse, where all of our books and packaging will be neatly organized. While we are first starting out, this will cost us up to $50/month. We will also need a PO Box to initially gather all return shipments. As we expand our collection, we will require more space, which means we will need a larger, more expensive storage unit. Depending on how many people use this service initially, we might just need a large office space that doubles as a library right from the start. This will cost anywhere from $50 to $3,000 per month.


MORE BOOKS: If we are somehow able to exceed our $50,000 goal, are able to allocate extra funds to areas that may require more (such as packaging and storage) accordingly, and still manage to have an excess, all of that money will be invested into more books! This will allow us to have a wider selection and we would then be able expedite the release our “Chosen Plan” sooner than planned (pending the completion of our website).


How we will use the funds if we don't reach our goal:

We are adamant about launching Curious Codex and we will do everything we can to make it happen, even if we don’t reach our goal. Our goal is to use Indiegogo as a means of skipping a few steps, and as a result, allowing up to create our dream website, permitting us to obtain thousands of books from the get-go, and to launch a detailed library database; however, if we do not manage to raise our goal amount of $50,000, we have other alternatives in mind that will allow us to still launch this service, but will require more time to forge ahead and provide every possible service we hope to make available to our customers.

Services we will be providing at launch:

Our rental service will be divided into two plans: “Curated” and “Chosen.” The “Curated Plan” will be the only plan available at launch. For the “Curated Plan,” a book will be selected by Curious Codex in regards to the preferences set by the customer. This plan allows Curious Codex to cut the costs of the subscription, as the books chosen will essentially be free of any “demand.” If, for example, 20 people were to want the same book but only 5 copies are available, in most instances this would drive up the price of the item. However, this is a scenario that will never occur under the “Curated Plan,” as there are several good books to choose from, therefore the books are unaffected by inflation caused by demand and scarcity. This also gives Curious Codex the opportunity to introduce a customer to a book or author that they would not have otherwise come across. We just ask you be a little bit curious!

Since this plan allows us to provide books free of demand, we are subsequently able to offer it at a lower cost, and unlike other curated services, we are choosing to not charge a premium. We have not yet finalized our pricing, but we expect the “1 book at a time” and “2 books at a time” plans to BOTH be under $10 per month. We are also positive our “3 books at a time” plan will be under $15, and our “5 books at a time” plan will fall between just under $15 to under $20 per month.

Our prices for these subscription plans will be finalized once we have finished calculating the price of packaging and shipping per book, but we only expect there to be a dollar or two in fluctuation, if at all. ALL SHIPPING WILL BE FREE!


Services we want to provide in the near future:

The Chosen Plan: This is our long-term goal for Curious Codex. We will not be able to make this service available at launch due to the cost necessary in creating a wide-enough and appealing collection of books. We will be working diligently from the beginning to create an extensive online library to allow this service to become available as quickly as possible. We will also be taking suggestions from customers as to what books to include in Curious Codex’s library, in addition to our list of favorites. Once we have attained enough books and created a user-friendly website to release the “Chosen Plan,” the service will function in a manner of a queue: customers will be able to put together a list of books that they want, ranked in an order of priority, and they will receive the books from Curious Codex in that order. The price for this service will be more than that of the “Curated Plan” due to demand and availability, as we will do everything possible to meet the demands of subscribers regardless of availability, even if it means purchasing several extra copies of a book. However, this service will only be $3-$5 more than the “Curated Plan” – it will still be a smart and cost-efficient choice!


Monthly Book Club: Curious Codex is also interested in creating and launching a “Monthly Book Club.” Several Monthly Book Clubs already exist, but we hope to create a book club more focused on cost and excellent reading material than monthly experiences. Current book clubs focus on specific genres and provide additional bookish items that go along with their monthly theme; however, as great as an experience they are, there is a premium involved. Don’t get us wrong, we love monthly themed book clubs, but not everyone can afford it or are interested in the themed goodies. Our Book Club will be less about the packaging and items, and more about getting a fantastic read without having to pay for the extras. This book club will be curated, meaning we will pick your monthly book based on your preferences, and there will be an option for used, paperback, or hardcover books. Prices have not yet been finalized, but we expect them to be just around market value for paperback and hardcover, and far less for used books. We expect this service to become available shortly after launch.

Our Mission:

Curious Codex’s mission is to provide an inclusive, reasonably priced online book rental service that will allow subscribers to access and explore books that we believe are exceptional, and that we truly believe subscribers will enjoy. We hope to exceed expectations, to provide an outstanding relationship between the company and its customers, to build a safe and environmentally responsible culture, to be respectful at all times, and most importantly, to display honesty and integrity in everything we do. Ultimately, we hope to create a convenient and inexpensive service that will motivate past readers to pick up and explore a book again.


Risks:

We are aware and fully understand the likelihood that we will send you a book you don’t like or have already read. If you aren’t a fan of the book we’ve sent you, we will be providing an outlet for you to let us know! While we will be unable to accommodate you for not liking the book, that information will allow us to better understand your preferences and increase the probability of finding a book you’ll truly love. If we’ve sent you a book you’ve already read and have no interest in rereading it, send it back and shoot us an email, and we’ll prorate your account the amount of days it took the book to leave our facility and get back (meaning, if for example, there were 7 days of travel time between the book getting to your home and back, we will give you 7 additional days of the service for free).


The “Curated Plan” is not a service made exclusively for the adventurous reader – it is about opening yourself up to reading new and different books. It doesn’t even have to be a completely different genre! Every writer is different, and every dystopian or mystery novel has a different kind of story that all fall under a different category. We will be picking books based on your preferences, so if you only want to read steampunk, you will definitely only be reading steampunk – though some might be based in London, others in South Africa, or in a very distant post-apocalyptic future, unless you’re specifically looking for it to just be based in Paris, then we will do our best to find as many books that fit this criteria. Don’t have any preferences whatsoever? Then expect to be dazzled by some of the greatest, most obscure works out there! Just want to read some literary classics? We’ve got you covered. Our “Curated Plan” is NOT a random book sent to you – a lot of thought will be put into it!


We will not only encourage you to provide feedback, but we will also do our best to make various outlets available to do so. We want Curious Codex to be about the customers and meeting their needs in order to offer a great experience. We not only understand how important a good book is, but also how important a good service is – and we are hoping to meld these two things. Curious Codex is a new kind of service, and we are hoping you will help us nurture it to help it grow into an exceptional service.


The Impact:

Our goal with Curious Codex is to build a new type of service that will make books more easily accessible without paying a premium. However, we don’t believe we are taking business away from libraries or book stores. Libraries offer several other services and will provide other books that we will not, such as cookbooks and technical books, and libraries act as local archives and safe spaces. We also do not believe we are taking business away from book stores. We’re letting you rent a book, but you will have to return it at some point. If you enjoyed reading the book we’ve sent you, our service will not stop you from going out and buying that book from your local bookstore. This service is merely an alternative for those who cannot afford to be constantly buying books, some of which they may end up not liking, or don’t have the time or easy access to a library. We’re merely providing a convenient service for everyone who wishes to read but does not have the necessary time or effort that goes into finding a new book.


We believe reading is integral to society. It is a means of passing along knowledge and conveying a story that differs from our own. We read to remember the past and to think up the future. Without books, cultures and societies would not exist or be remembered. Books help shape who we are as individuals, and introduce us to experiences we would have otherwise never experienced. Books are important but are often priced as a luxury, and Curious Codex is hoping to change this by providing an alternative to the traditional model.


Other ways you can help:

Help us spread the word! We know that not everyone can donate money, but if you are interested in this service and would like to see our work come into fruition, you can help us spread the word about our service and our Indiegogo. We are planning on having a raffle where the winners will receive the entire Founder’s Bundle. All you have to do is share our campaign on any social media platform with the hashtag #curiouscodex and we will randomly select and announce a few people (based on how much money we raise) as winners at the end of the campaign. By helping us spread the word, you will be assisting us in reaching our goal, and we want to show our appreciation in some way.

Donate your used books! Since we need so many books for our rental service, we are contemplating accepting legible, used books. While we currently cannot afford to pay for every used book, we would be more than willing to pay for shipping. If you would like to discuss sending your used books to us, please email us at inquiries@curiouscodex.com.

Contact us! If you have any questions or concerns, are interested in helping us with our website or packaging design, or would like to discuss being an ongoing investor, please feel free to email us at inquiries@curiouscodex.com.


Who we are:

Kat Wood recently graduated with a Bachelor’s degree in English and World Literatures. Recently released from the confinement of college and brought into the world of debt, she spends most of her free time buying books online. She currently lives in upper Manhattan with her roommate and Astrid the cat. Kat is the proud owner of 300 books (and counting!), but she struggles to find places for them in her tiny apartment.

She loves everything about books, from the smell of the paper to the way the spine cracks when you open a fresh book. She loves getting lost in a new world, and she loves being able to escape from reality for a short period of time. Kat sees reading a book as a sort of vacation. She is also a huge proponent of encouraging everyone to read. Everyone should be able to experience getting lost in a different reality. She believes that reading can be entertaining and educational.

Andy Cox is a sometimes-reader, sometimes-writer with a fixation on narratives starring complex and oppressed characters. A recent college graduate, he splits his time between being a researcher for a marketing agency, working on a dozen “projects” (many of which will never be realized), and cuddling with his cat, le dauphin Prince Henri. He sometimes forgets his love of reading due to bothersome e-books (they hurt his eyes after a half hour!), the lack of time or energy to peruse a local or online bookstore, and the cost of said books. He feels strongly about Curious Codex, not because it was his idea or because he would totally use it if it existed in the way he is envisioning it, but because he believes it will reignite the 21st century’s 20th century love affair with the ancient use of the tome. He’s also known for really bad metaphors.


Questions & Answers – send them to us!

Question: Why are the perks for your subscription listed at $30/$60 for 3/6 months? Does that mean it will be $10 per month?

Answer: We are asking for $10 per month for the perk for various reasons. The obvious reason is because we need as much money as possible to launch, and since our service is not yet in business, it will be a while before we are running efficiently. We also haven’t solidified our pricing, so we don’t want to charge too little and not have enough money to provide the service. The few extra dollars will essentially allow us to guarantee that this service will be launched. Once your 3 or 6 months of free service is over, you will be charged the cost of the subscription we have settled on, which will most likely be less than $10 per month. As a reward for donating the few extra dollars, people who purchase the $30 or $60 subscription perks are guaranteed access to Curious Codex at launch – so if an innumerable amount of people want to use our service, you will be assured first access.

Do you love to read but hate the cost that comes with
purchasing books? Do you avoid the library or just don’t have the time? Do you
have a stack of books collecting dust because you didn’t enjoy them, have only
read them once (not even all the way through), and don’t have the heart to
throw them out? Are you running out of room in your apartment for all the books
you’ve bought, or is the lack of space forcing you into e-books? Do you love
the convenience of e-books but miss the feeling of paper between your fingers?
Curious Codex is hoping to save you from all of the hassle
by creating a rental service that will make getting a print book convenient and
inexpensive. We are looking to revolutionize the book subscription
market by creating a cost-efficient, customer-focused book rental service that
will allow subscribers to choose from a variety of plans at various
price-points. All of these plans will allow you to rent an unlimited number of books
per month without consequence - if you only have the time to read one
book over the course of a month, or even two, it’ll still be affordable.
Don’t know what to read? Let us pick a book for you! With
our “Curated Plan,” we’ll pick a book based on your preferences that we think
you’ll enjoy reading. We won’t be charging you a premium for this plan; it’ll
actually be our most cost-efficient option. All we ask is that you be a little
bit curious!
As New Yorkers, founders Andy Cox and Kat Wood know how hard
it is to live in a small New York City apartment while maintaining an enormous
book collection. However, this problem is not limited to New York City or tiny apartments - homes can only accommodate so many bookshelves at once, if any! Visiting the library isn’t always a
convenience, considering there are often crowds, long lines, and visits can be quite time
consuming, and they usually don’t have the book you want and it can take several weeks to get it! While we are not
looking to compete with libraries in general – after all, they offer more
services than renting books - we are merely trying to
provide a service for people who don’t want to take time out of their day to
head to a library.
E-books are a fantastic alternative for city-dwellers and
suburbanites alike, but after staring at a computer screen at work all
day, who wants to stare at a tablet? And we can’t be the only ones who, when
readjusting ourselves while reading on a tablet, accidentally move several
pages from where we were – talk about losing the moment. There’s just something
about a book in your hands that brings reading to life in a way that tablets do
not. We get it, e-books are great (we own them!) but we are well aware that
some people prefer physical books to e-books. With the creation of Curious
Codex, we hope to bring the same convenience of e-books to print-lovers in a
different capacity.
Lastly, we understand the struggle that comes with finding a
quality book. We love recommending books to our friends and family, and we are
often praised for our suggestions. We understand what goes into connecting a
reader to a quality book – and we hope to pass this on to you!

How your money will be used:

BOOKS: In order for
us to provide this service, we need to purchase quite a few books. Books don’t
come cheap. After all, that is one of the many reasons we’re looking to provide
this service. In order for us to receive bulk pricing, we must buy books in
bulk; therefore, we need a significant amount of money. To purchase the initial
amount of books we expect to need at launch, we will need to spend roughly
$5,000 - $7,500. This amount will go up significantly if there is more demand
than we are expecting. If, for example, 5,000 people donate to this campaign
with the intention of using our service once we have launch, we will need over
5,000 books, which would cost us roughly $50,000 - $75,000, at the very bare
minimum! Since we are renting and reusing books, our long-term cost for books
will go down significantly, but the initial cost, as you can
see, is very high.
PACKAGING: In
order to provide an efficient service, we need to create packaging that will
prevent the books from being damaged, possesses the ability to fit in mailboxes
of various sizes, and it must serve as a means of returning the book when done
reading. As this is a task we cannot personally accomplish, we not only need to
have someone else design the packaging with our creative input, but we must
also make it possible for the packaging to be created and printed in bulk. We
already have several potential designs in mind, and have a good idea of how we
want the packaging to work with the primary goal being user-friendly packaging

with a professional to execute our plan, develop a means of creating the
packaging in a cost-efficient manner, and buying enough to have ready for our
launch date. Between the design, creation, and procurement of packaging, we
expect this to be roughly $10,000 - $15,000, if not more, if more people use
our service than expected at launch.
WEBSITE: While our
website will be simple for the initial launch, it will eventually need to be
able to support a vast database of books. The website needs to be
user-friendly, visually pleasing, but most of all, we want it to be an
enjoyable experience. While we have envisioned our dream website, we do not
have the technical knowledge or expertise to accomplish this (if you’ve headed
over to our current temporary website put together by Andy, our website
capabilities are extremely limited). We will have to find a web professional to
not only assist us in building the ultimate website, but to also help us
maintain the website as we grow. Website creation and maintenance can vary in
price, and we want to provide a unique, memorable, and painless experience. We
do not have a solid price point for our website, as it will be an ongoing cost
that will continue to increase in price. For our initial launch, which will
revolve around our Curated Plan, a simple website with a subscription-based
payment option would be easy to set up, would cost very little, and we would
only need to create an area within each user's profile for you to notify us of
your preferences. However, this isn’t the goal. We want a website where you
will lose yourself in a world of books and be able to explore books just like
getting lost in a library. Any “extra” money after books and packaging will
essentially be allocated into our website with the intention of achieving our
dream website sooner than later.

New York City, so we do not possess the space necessary to store a handful of

renting a storage unit to act as our warehouse, where all of our books and
packaging will be neatly organized. While we are first starting out, this will
cost us up to $50/month. We will also need a PO Box to initially gather all
return shipments. As we expand our collection, we will require more space,
which means we will need a larger, more expensive storage unit. Depending on how many
people use this service initially, we might just need a large office space that
doubles as a library right from the start. This will cost anywhere from $50 to
$3,000 per month.
MORE BOOKS: If we
are somehow able to exceed our $50,000 goal, are able to allocate extra funds

still manage to have an excess, all of that money will be invested into more
books! This will allow us to have a wider selection and we would then be able
expedite the release our “Chosen Plan” sooner than planned (pending the
completion of our website).

Club will be less about the packaging and items, and more about getting a
fantastic read without having to pay for the extras. This book club will be
curated, meaning we will pick your monthly book based on your preferences, and
there will be an option for used, paperback, or hardcover books. Prices have
not yet been finalized, but we expect them to be just around market value for
paperback and hardcover, and far less for used books. We expect this service to
become available shortly after launch.

Our Mission:
Curious Codex’s mission is to provide an inclusive,
reasonably priced online book rental service that will allow subscribers to
access and explore books that we believe are exceptional, and that we truly believe
subscribers will enjoy. We hope to exceed expectations, to provide an
outstanding relationship between the company and its customers, to build a safe
and environmentally responsible culture, to be respectful at all times, and
most importantly, to display honesty and integrity in everything we do.
Ultimately, we hope to create a convenient and inexpensive service that will
motivate past readers to pick up and explore a book again.
Risks:
We are aware and fully understand the likelihood that we
will send you a book you don’t like or have already read. If you aren’t a fan
of the book we’ve sent you, we will be providing an outlet for you to let us
know! While we will be unable to accommodate you for not liking the book, that
information will allow us to better understand your preferences and increase the probability of finding a book you’ll truly love. If we’ve sent you a book
you’ve already read and have no interest in rereading it, send it back and shoot
us an email, and we’ll prorate your account the amount of days it took the
book to leave our facility and get back (meaning, if for example, there were 7
days of travel time between the book getting to your home and back, we will
give you 7 additional days of the service for free).
The “Curated Plan” is not a service made exclusively for the
adventurous reader – it is about opening yourself up to reading new and
different books. It doesn’t even have to be a completely different genre! Every
writer is different, and every dystopian or mystery novel has a different kind of
story that all fall under a different category. We will be picking books
based on your preferences, so if you only want to read steampunk, you will
definitely only be reading steampunk – though some might be based in London,
others in South Africa, or in a very distant post-apocalyptic future, unless
you’re specifically looking for it to just be based in Paris, then we will do
our best to find as many books that fit this criteria. Don’t have any
preferences whatsoever? Then expect to be dazzled by some of the greatest, most
obscure works out there! Just want to read some literary classics? We’ve got
you covered. Our “Curated Plan” is NOT a random book sent to
you – a lot of thought will be put into it!
We will not only encourage you to provide feedback, but we
will also do our best to make various outlets available to do so. We want
Curious Codex to be about the customers and meeting their needs in order to
offer a great experience. We not only understand how important a good book is,
but also how important a good service is – and we are hoping to meld these two
things. Curious Codex is a new kind of service, and we are hoping you will help
us nurture it to help it grow into an exceptional service. 
The Impact: Our goal with Curious Codex is to build a new type of
service that will make books more easily accessible without paying a premium.
However, we don’t believe we are taking business away from libraries or book
stores. Libraries offer several other services and will provide other books
that we will not, such as cookbooks and technical books, and libraries act as
local archives and safe spaces. We also do not believe we are taking business
away from book stores. We’re letting you rent a book, but you will have to
return it at some point. If you enjoyed reading the book we’ve sent you, our
service will not stop you from going out and buying that book from your local
bookstore. This service is merely an alternative for those who cannot afford to be
constantly buying books, some of which they may end up not liking, or don’t have
the time or easy access to a library. We’re merely providing a convenient
service for everyone who wishes to read but does not have the necessary time or
effort that goes into finding a new book.
We believe reading is integral to society. It is a means of
passing along knowledge and conveying a story that differs from our own. We
read to remember the past and to think up the future. Without books, cultures
and societies would not exist or be remembered. Books help shape who we are as
individuals, and introduce us to experiences we would have otherwise never
experienced. Books are important but are often priced as a luxury, and Curious
Codex is hoping to change this by providing an alternative to the traditional
model.
Other ways you can help:
Help
us spread the word! We know that not everyone can
donate money, but if you are interested in this service and would like to see
our work come into fruition, you can help us spread the word about our service
and our Indiegogo. We are planning on having a raffle where the winners will receive the entire Founder’s Bundle.
All you have to do is share our campaign on any social media platform with the
hashtag #curiouscodex and we will randomly
select and announce a few people (based on how much money we raise) as winners
at the end of the campaign. By helping us spread the word, you will be
assisting us in reaching our goal, and we want to show our appreciation in some
way.
Donate
your used books! Since we need so many books for
our rental service, we are contemplating accepting legible, used books. While
we currently cannot afford to pay for every used book, we would be more than
willing to pay for shipping. If you would like to discuss sending your used
books to us, please email us at inquiries@curiouscodex.com.
Contact
us! If you have any questions or concerns,
are interested in helping us with our website or packaging design, or would
like to discuss being an ongoing investor, please feel free to email us at inquiries@curiouscodex.com.
Who we are:
Kat Wood recently
graduated with a Bachelor’s degree in English and World Literatures. Recently
released from the confinement of college and brought into the world of debt,
she spends most of her free time buying books online. She currently lives in
upper Manhattan with her roommate and Astrid the cat. Kat is the proud owner of
300 books (and counting!), but she struggles to find places for them in her
tiny apartment.
She loves everything about books, from the smell of the
paper to the way the spine cracks when you open a fresh book. She loves getting
lost in a new world, and she loves being able to escape from reality for a
short period of time. Kat sees reading a book as a sort of vacation. She is
also a huge proponent of encouraging everyone to read. Everyone should be able to experience getting lost in a different reality. She believes that
reading can be entertaining and educational.Andy Cox is
a sometimes-reader, sometimes-writer with a fixation on narratives starring
complex and oppressed characters. A recent college graduate, he splits his time
between being a researcher for a marketing agency, working on a dozen
“projects” (many of which will never be realized), and cuddling with his cat,
le dauphin Prince Henri. He sometimes forgets his love of reading due to
bothersome e-books (they hurt his eyes after a half hour!), the lack of time or
energy to peruse a local or online bookstore, and the cost of said books. He
feels strongly about Curious Codex, not because it was his idea or because he
would totally use it if it existed in the way he is envisioning it, but because
he believes it will reignite the 21st century’s 20th century
love affair with the ancient use of the tome. He’s also known for really bad
metaphors.
Questions & Answers – send them to us!
Question: Why are the perks for your subscription listed at $30/$60 for 3/6 months? Does that mean it will be $10 per month?
Answer: We are asking for $10 per month for the perk for various reasons. The obvious reason is because we need as much money as possible to launch, and since our service is not yet in business, it will be a while before we are running efficiently. We also haven’t solidified our pricing, so we don’t want to charge too little and not have enough money to provide the service. The few extra dollars will essentially allow us to guarantee that this service will be launched. Once your 3 or 6 months of free service is over, you will be charged the cost of the subscription we have settled on, which will most likely be less than $10 per month. As a reward for donating the few extra dollars, people who purchase the $30 or $60 subscription perks are guaranteed access to Curious Codex at launch – so if an innumerable amount of people want to use our service, you will be assured first access.

story:
Short Summary

Good day everyone, and thank you for stopping by and checking out our campaign. At Dagda Publishing we strive to bring you the best new writing talent, and it is to this end that we have started this campaign on Indiegogo. We are hoping to raise up to £2,500 for our upcoming novel "Conquest: Book 1 of the Angels of Chicago series" by UK author C.J. Somersby. Have a read of the synopsis below, and if this seems like the kind of book that would interest you as a reader, consider chucking a few quid towards the campaign!

Synopsis:

Samuel Black: Private Investigator. Misanthrope. Psychic. Blessed (or cursed, depending on your viewpoint) with the "gift" of second sight, Sam has found his talent to be a boon to his professional life, and a hindrance to his personal one. However, when a rogue angel named Alleam approaches him with a plan to stop the Apocalypse, all will be revealed about his past and his gift. 

Tasked with finding and stopping the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse from riding out and enacting Armageddon, Sam will have to face off against demons, angels, bikers and all manner of Biblical terrors. In a literally apocalyptic showdown, what will become of our protagonist and the whole of Humanity? 

Cover designed by Matt Davis

Pre-orders are already available on Amazon: http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00VTQOSVQ

What We Need & What You Get


So, how much do we need and what for? Well, we're looking at raising up to £2,500 to support the release of the novel, by providing cash for marketing and advertising. After the cost of perks, we figure we'll have about £2,000 to spend on our goals for the book.
We are looking to do the following: 
  • 2-3 adverts in popular online and print sci-fi and fantasy magazines around launch day and spread over the first 3 months of release.
  • Provide expenses for comicons and book launches. These expenses include booking tables, providing hard copies of books and POS advertising.
  • Fund online "booster" advertising campaigns on Twitter, Goodreads and on Google Adwords.
  • Use the services of online book-centred PR companies who can get our press releases out to the national and international press.
  • Book marketing newsletters - Bookbub, Bookgorilla, The Fussy Librarian, amongst others.
This will be our marketing campaign, and hopefully with a bit of work we will turn this into a bestseller. Now, even if we do not raise the full amount, we can certainly use a few of these options to great effect. Though, obviously we'd like to smash this target and do even more. 
So, what do you get in return for pledging money to this campaign? Shinies. Shinies are what you get. These shinies (Indiegogo call them "perks" but we think "shinies" is a better name) include signed and inscribed copies of Conquest, ebooks, personal thanks from the author via email and postcard, posters, and a one-of-a-kind-everything-we-have-and-more shiny. Check the perks out and grab one for yourself. Virtual high-fives included in every perk, and your name will be listed as a sponsor on the Dagda Publishing website.

The Impact

What's the impact? Simple. We are a small publishing company with limited resources, we certainly don't have the massive marketing budgets of the huge publishing companies. This is why crowdfunding makes such a huge difference to us at this stage in our business model. The publishing world is a fast-evolving industry, and there are exciting times ahead. We are part of those times.
We also know that this works, as we previously ran a campaign last year for one of our previous novels, which ended up being over our target amount of £1,500. With your help we can do the same and better this time around.

We believe in our authors, and that they are bringing something new and exciting to the world of fiction and literature. We hope you feel the same way and will consider investing in the future of these authors and their creations.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, there are always risks involved. We feel that they are calculated risks, however. We have been doing this for 2 years now, constantly learning our trade as we go. We have published over a dozen books in that time, each of which has garnered a small amount of attention, but we feel it is time to step things up a bit. This is where you come in. Please consider funding this campaign with whatever you can.
Be a part of our story.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, you can help us out immensely by giving it a share on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Blogs, using the Indiegogo share tools or even just by good old fashioned word of mouth!
