story:
HECK

A Print Magazine for the 21st Century from Some of the Best Writers and Artists of Today and the [Possibly Nonexistent] Future!


Q: What is Heck?
A: Heck is a new "print" quarterly for a 21st-century general-interest audience who leans literary and loves the arts, compelling ideas, good stories, innovation on the page, walking away from screens, and work that entertains and excites, amuses and surprises, and sometimes leaves you wondering what just happened—all in a magazine that works hard to evolve what a journal can do. Heck is a meeting ground for writers and artists. Many artists are going beyond the strictly visual and creating a lot of very literary work these days, and we want to put it out there. So call this a mashup, a remix, an evolution; all we know is we decided to make what we couldn't find on the newsstand and what isn't to be found anywhere online, ever.
¶ Speaking of, are you sick of feasting on hot air and empty calories as you chase deranged rabbits online? Are you allergic to bullshit? A good, wholesome magazine is what you need.
¶ Know that we're not only raising money for all the sundry costs and work involved; we're also raising money to pay our writers and artists, because writers and artists should be paid, even if that's initially a modest amount. Supporting us means rejecting the "free freelance" mindset.

Q: Who’s involved?
A: See here. Our video was out of date looong ago. Heck is people, a work in progress growing in diversity and dimension, busy being born.
¶ Contributing editors: Erika Wurth  | Wells Tower  | Jen Percy  |  Bob Shacochis  |  Dini Parayitam  |  Tom Bissell  |  Darcey Steinke  |  David Vann  |  Jamie Quatro  |  Evan Lavender-Smith  |  Rion Amilcar Scott  |  Jill Magid  |  Matthew Derby  |  Jack Handey  |  Janet Steen |  James Jung  |  Ngwah-Mbo Nana Nkweti  |  Patrick DeWitt  |  Robert Lopez  |  Laura van den Berg  |  Angus MacLachlan  |  Sonya Huber  |  William Wheeler  |  J.R. Helton  |  Bronwen Dickey  |  Kevin Barry  |  Joseph Ridgwell  |  Ansel Elkins  |  Bucky McMahon  |  Will Palmer  |  Nancy Lemann  |  Gideon Lewis-Kraus  |  D.T. Max  |  Janice Lee  |  Kyle Minor  |  Frank Bill  |  Patrick Symmes  |  Martha Anne Toll  |  Hal Espen  |  Will Boast  |  Rowan Jacobsen  |  Kristin Ohlson  |  Rob Rhee  |  Molly Antopol  |  Sequoia Nagamatsu  |  Lee Durkee  |  Molly Gaudry  |  Mike Sager  |  Chris Dixon  |  LaTanya McQueen  |  Chris Davis  |  Cari Luna  |  John Domini  |  David Shafer  |  Lily Hoang  |  Roy Kesey  |  George Singleton  |  Danielle Dutton  |  Abe Streep  |  Frank Bures  |  Masha Tupitsyn  |  Benjamin Percy  |  Tim Sohn  |  Amber Sparks  |  Evan Smith Rakoff  |  Kali Fajardo-Anstine  |  Jaed Coffin  |  Elizabeth Mitchell  |  Colin Fleming  |  Alissa Nutting  |  Jason Daley  |  Larkin Warren  |  Joshua Paul  |  Chris McCoy  |  Grace Krilanovich
¶ Design Directors: Marshall McKinney & John McCauley
¶ Executive Editor: Will Blythe
¶ Editor-in-Chief: Jeremy Keith Spencer

Q: When’s it “drop,” etc.?
A: Issue No. 1, Spring 2015. Four-color, perfect-bound, 8 x 10 7/8 in., matte cover, ~100 pgs., printed in the U.S.A.

Q: Why should I care?
A: Because it’s the right people at the right time with the right idea. The established, the fringe, the undersung and undiscovered—that's a heady cocktail, and they’ll all be represented. And it's print, glorious print! Touch it, smell it, consume it, love it, stockpile it in the bathroom. This is what we live to do, and we've been doing it a long time. Learn more at heckmagazine.com.

Q: Anything else?
A: Too many voices—wild, risky, fearless, funny, weird—are not being heard. We want to be their megaphone. And the audience is there. The evidence is everywhere. We all want powerful storytelling, whether it be the truth in essays, nonfiction, and the like or the kind of resonant, strange, surprising truth found in good fiction and poetry. As more and more magazines abandon or cut back on fiction, we consider it all the more crucial, an indispensable part of the story. Much fiction has been made milquetoast, much poetry robbed of its power, much nonfiction bent to formulae. Too much of it hobbled in some way. We’ll seek new voices and angles of pursuit to celebrate and reveal the inexhaustible strength of our infinitely malleable and ever-changing forms. There will always be some risk in the mix.
¶ In general, we’ve got no interest in the flavor of the nanosecond: we want to forgo timeliness, celebrity, and politics as bloodsport. Instead, we want to go for timelessness and art and the struggle—against ourselves, against the world, against injustice. But mostly we want to make a badass magazine you'll happily pay to appear in your mailbox every season, like frickin' magic, throbbing with delicious brain ooze.
¶ Brilliant takes on science and psychology and ethics rub shoulders with daring fiction and confessionals and a dash of poetry! Documentary and conceptual photography and dynamic art and illustration dovetail with wild humor and thrilling travel! Plus surprises.
¶ Please donate and tweet and share and e-blast and skywrite and donate and purchase subscriptions for the needy if you want this creature to live. #heckisgo
¶ Also: submissions are now open for all kinds of stuff. There's a contest, too.

Throw (or gently toss) money at us!

ISSUE NO. 1*

¶ Fiction by Kali Fajardo-Anstine, Will Boast, Matthew Derby, Ernst Haffner [R.I.P.], Evan Lavender-Smith, D.T. Max, Bob Shacochis, George Singleton, David Vann...
¶ Photographs from the Forbidden Zone by Joshua Paul
¶ Poesy by Ansel Elkins & Clovis Hawkins
¶ Essays, confessionals, humor, meta-investigations, reporting, creative nonfiction, reality experiments, etc. by Nancy Lemann, Jill Magid, Frank Bill, Chris Dixon, John Domini, Martha Anne Toll, Amelie Welden, J.R. Helton, Rowan Jacobsen, Adam Phillips, Rob Rhee, Mike Sager...


*NOTE: Some of this might change, but you get the idea. We're currently closing the issue and making final decisions. It's all very emotional.

ISSUES NOs. 2, 3 & 4: In the works as you read this. So much good stuff. But we're looking for more.

LETTERPRESS LIMITED EDITIONS: Certain Heckwork will be published as gorgeous, author-signed letterpress limited editions.

BOOKS: We'd love to dip into indie publishing, too, a toe at a time.
It's the [possibly nonexistent] future.

PROPAGANDA [PERKS]: Check it out here.

You! Yes, you!

>> Support writers and artists you love—and those you've yet to discover—and keep print alive and thriving. Help us bring Heck to life. Join us in rejecting the myopia of the status quo and opening the door wider for the riskier work of the established and celebrated as well as the unknown awaiting discovery.

>> Let's take the risks others retreat from, to get bold voices old and new out there, to slow things down more than a little bit, to print no news, just truth.

>> We have the opportunity, the talent, the team to bring a new kind of mashup magazine into the world. We're doing it, but—cliché alert—we can’t do it without you. Literally (not figuratively).

>> Give what you can, if you want. We've been working hard for more than a year to create something worth your time and, we hope, a place on your shelf for centuries to come, since, apparently, we might all live to be like 350 years old.

>> It's not advertisers but subscribers who give life and longevity to a print periodical. You, on that end, are both breath and bone, mind and voice. Subscribing and sharing are the most important things you can do—after throwing that all-important seed money at us, of course. If you don't want to throw it, you can also make it into paper airplanes. Hundreds work well.

$$$???: Just so you know: it takes a helluva lot of time and hard work and people and money to get one of these babies airborne and self-sustaining. It has been one of those Herculean Efforts. That's why we're asking for your help to the tune of 25 grand, though 50 grand is more like it. We hope to exceed 50 so we can really focus on bringing you great work. Sick of the status quo and the Reign of Digital "Content"? Join us. We are clearly crazy. Let's all be crazy together. Right here. Closer. We have stories to whisper into your ear...

WHATEVER YOU DO, WE BESEECH YOU TO BROADCAST OUR PITCH TO YOUR RESPECTIVE GALACTIC HIVE-MIND WEBOSPHERES.

RAISE HECK!

THANK YOU.

XOXO,

HECK & CO.

robbed of its power, much nonfiction bent to formulae. Too much of it hobbled in
some way. We’ll seek new voices and angles of pursuit to celebrate and
reveal the inexhaustible strength of our infinitely malleable and ever-changing
forms. There will always be some risk in the mix. ¶ In general, we’ve got no
interest in the flavor of the nanosecond: we want to forgo timeliness,
celebrity, and politics as bloodsport. Instead, we want to go for timelessness and
art and the struggle—against ourselves, against the world, against injustice. But mostly we want to make a badass magazine you'll happily pay to appear in your mailbox every season, like frickin' magic, throbbing with delicious brain ooze. ¶ 
Brilliant
takes on science and psychology and ethics rub shoulders with daring fiction
and confessionals and a dash of poetry! Documentary and conceptual photography and dynamic art and illustration dovetail
with wild humor and thrilling travel! Plus surprises.¶ Please donate and tweet and share and e-blast and skywrite and donate and purchase subscriptions for the needy if you want this creature to live. #heckisgo¶ Also: submissions are now open for all kinds of stuff. There's a contest, too.

Throw (or gently toss) money at us!

ISSUE NO. 1*¶ Fiction by Kali Fajardo-Anstine, Will Boast, Matthew Derby, Ernst Haffner [R.I.P.], Evan Lavender-Smith, D.T. Max, Bob Shacochis, George Singleton, David Vann...¶ Photographs from the Forbidden Zone by Joshua Paul¶ Poesy by Ansel Elkins & Clovis Hawkins¶ Essays, confessionals, humor, meta-investigations, reporting, creative nonfiction, reality experiments, etc. by Nancy Lemann, Jill Magid, Frank Bill, Chris Dixon, John Domini, Martha Anne Toll, Amelie Welden, J.R. Helton, Rowan Jacobsen, Adam Phillips, Rob Rhee, Mike Sager...
*NOTE: Some of this might change, but you get the idea. We're currently closing the issue and making final decisions. It's all very emotional.
ISSUES NOs. 2, 3 & 4: In the works as you read this. So much good stuff. But we're looking for more. LETTERPRESS LIMITED EDITIONS: Certain Heckwork will be published as gorgeous, author-signed letterpress limited editions.
BOOKS: We'd love to dip into indie publishing, too, a toe at a time. It's the [possibly nonexistent] future.
PROPAGANDA [PERKS]: Check it out here.

You! Yes, you!

>> Support writers and artists you love—and those you've yet to discover—and keep print alive and thriving. Help us bring Heck to life. Join us in rejecting the myopia of the status quo and opening the door wider for the riskier work of the established and celebrated as well as the unknown awaiting discovery. >> Let's take the risks others retreat from, to
get bold voices old and new out there, to
slow things down more than a little bit, to
print no news, just truth.

>> We have the opportunity, the talent, the team to bring 
a new kind of mashup magazine into the world. We're doing it, but—cliché alert—we can’t do it
without you. Literally (not figuratively).>> Give what you can,
if you want. We've been working hard for more than a year
to create something worth your
time and, we
hope, a place on your shelf for centuries to come, since, apparently, we might all live to be like 350 years old.>> It's not advertisers but subscribers who give life and longevity to a print periodical. You, on that end, are both breath and bone, mind and voice. Subscribing and sharing are the most important things you can do—after throwing that all-important seed money at us, of course. If you don't want to throw it, you can also make it into paper airplanes. Hundreds work well.$$$???: Just so you know: it takes a helluva lot of time and hard work and people and money to get one of these babies airborne and self-sustaining. It has been one of those Herculean Efforts. That's why we're asking for your help to the tune of 25 grand, though 50 grand is more like it. We hope to exceed 50 so we can really focus on bringing you great work. Sick of the status quo and the Reign of Digital "Content"? Join us. We are clearly crazy. Let's all be crazy together. Right here. Closer. We have stories to whisper into your ear...
WHATEVER YOU DO, WE BESEECH YOU TO BROADCAST OUR PITCH TO YOUR RESPECTIVE GALACTIC HIVE-MIND WEBOSPHERES. RAISE HECK!THANK YOU. XOXO, HECK & CO.

story:
Upgrade to V 2.0


We the Mardi Gras Krewe of Ingress need your assistance!

As a cross faction event we participated in the Krewe of Chewbaccus Mardi Gras parade as a last mine first year mini krewe. We had throws, we had players, we had a great time, we even had a 5'x5' bike float!

This campaign is to help raise awareness of the Ingress participation in the parade, letting people know you can come march with us and the funds go towards upgrading the float to what it truly needs to be.

If we upgrade this float to its full potential it wont just sit in a garage except once a year either, we will bring it out for every First Saturday and all cross faction events and meet ups. It'll draw peoples attention to how much fun all of us have playing.

The existing float v1.0 breakdown
  1. 5'x5'  Octagon trailer is an aluminum frame
  2. 1/2" plywood flooring
  3. 65ft of led strip lighting
  4. Awesome car stereo setup
  5. alot of zip ties
  6. 2 super heavy pirated car batteries
  7. 1  beat up cooler



What we need:
We need to turn the bike trailer into a bike itself:
  1. We need an adult tricycle $250
  2. Bigger off road tires $250
  3. Electric motor conversion kit $200
  4. Bigger sound system
  5. Better portal appearances/set up with a lot more lighting
  6. Dedicated rechargeable battery to power motor, sound AND lights $700
All modifications are ideas/mods taken from veteran floats already in the parade. It took them years of blood sweat and tears to get what they have. I'm ok with not learning the hard way.

Any left over money will be spent on ordering custom throws. Doubloons alone cost $.70 each to make. So if your walking a 4 mile parade route, you need at least 500 minimum. That's $350 just to literally throw away to the crowd for 1 person. Just regular beads are not allowed in this particular parade (permits).


A Good Effort:

As pictured, you don't really see a portal, but with the game sounds blaring and everyone staring down at their phones, some agents in the crowd figured it out and introduced themselves.

With better funding and more time our goal is for instant "That's an Ingress portal!" recognition. Something Niantic themselves would envy.



Risks & Challenges


This was our first year marching in the parade, we came up short on throws, the float had its issues, but we all learned a great deal.
Nothing says these modifications are going to work for the terrible New Orleans roads but we are very confident it'll be a lot easier on everyone with V2.0. The sooner we reach our funding the sooner we can build and field test to work out the kinks.


Who we are:

Wondering how all of this can even be pulled off yet?

I am a special effects artist & ex properties master. I use to work for a touring Ice Show company. One of my many duties was actually maintaining and repairing floats & princess carriages at location. I currently work in a fabrication shop with every tool in the world available for use, along with many other talents fabricators. It's how V1.0 was built so quickly, it looked like fun so they jumped in
Another member is a sound engineer
Others are computer repair experts
Others are... you get the idea

If its needed, someone probably does it for a living


Other Ways You Can Help


Just pass this along!
Getting word out is perfect

If you want to share knowledge of any of the above modification requests ie: brands to use or avoid, best bike tires for horrible terrain, best lighting options etc.

story:
La mia campagna è dettata soprattutto dal desiderio di espressione del mio ego. 

Molti potranno pensare ad un fatto personale e fine a se stesso. Non e' solo questo, sono onesto, si tratta di un'avventura, di cui ognuno puo' farne parte, di cui ognuno è un pò protagonista a modo proprio.

Avevo tutto dentro da molto tempo, improvviso e impetuoso è venuto fuori. All'inzio non pensavo di suscitare emozioni o smuovere qualcosa in chi leggeva, successivamente e dopo varie insistenze ho deciso l'approccio "pubblico".

La pubblicazione di una raccolta è un sogno, un sogno importante, per raggiungere piu' menti e più cuori possibili. Diffondere cio' che si ha dentro è importante per se stessi e per gli altri, 

Certo, per una pubblicazione occorrono fondi, tempo, persone, materiale didattico, da questo vorrei partire e con l'aiuto oltre che di Dio, anche di possibili finanziatori.

Occorre finanziare la stampa, previa impaginazione, produrre le copie, distribuirle attraverso diversi canali, in primis il passaparola, in secundis tramite i social network.

Per quest'ultimo è necessario pagare delle royalty, per il primo è importante scegliere materiali di copertina, rilegatura e pagine da stampare, nonchè numero di copie.

Il numero iniziale è di 250.

La diffusione avverrebbe tramite la distribuzione locale in librerie di lusso, a livello nazionale tramite un sito che si occupa solo di pubblicazione racconti e poesie, attivo da diversi anni sul mercato.

La parte da leone la farebbero i social, ormai strumento indispensabile per la capillarità di un progetto a livello nazionale.

Per troppo tempo ho tenuto tutto dentro: è giunto il momento di esplodere!

Per farlo, ho bisogno di aiuto, di supporto, di condivisione!

I momenti duri della vita a volte ci riservano, nascosti nei meandri, spicchi di felicità che bisogna ritagliare e incollare in nuove pagine della vita stessa.

Ho bisogno di aiuti e di persone, di sostegno e di partecipazione. 

A partire naturalmente dal denaro, venale ma fondamentale, di condivisione sui social e soprattutto tramite gli strumenti che indiegogo.com offre!

Chiunque mi aiuterà e mi sosterrà ( a qualsiasi livello e con qualsiasi donazione) non avrà aiutato soltanto la pubblicazione di una raccolta di racconti ma avrà aiutato un idea a diventare  reale, avrà aiutato la scrittura.

Grazie fin d'ora a chi mi sosterra'

story:
The Why

I believe that the smallest effort to help raise awareness, provide resources and END HUMAN TRAFFICKING is one of the greatest contributions to society a person can make. Planting seeds of selflessness and advocating freedom for all  at an early age is one way I aim to help abolish modern day slavery. With the help of a rare and beautiful bird, my hope is to make this horrific reality a thing of the past. 100% of the proceeds of each copy sold (once printed) will be donated to non-profits that rescue and restore survivors and to organizations that fight for the freedom of those still enslaved; in addition to that, a portion of the profits will go towards the distribution of free copies to lower income areas where trafficking may be more rampant.

The Need

I need help covering the initial printing expenses to get the book into the hands of as many children as possible...without it costing the child or their family one single cent.

 The Payoff

You get to be a part of a global effort to help rescue & restore survivors and fight for the freedom of victims. Not only that, but you will have played a part in preventing this from happening in the future.

 Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the book.
  • Share the video.
  • Pray.
  • #feathersforfreedom
  • #abooktoendslavery

story:
About Me:

Hello everyone! First, I want to thank you for stopping by page. I'm a new erotica author and really excited to publish my first book. I'm a sort of an introvert and spend a lot of time putting my imagination to paper. I've been writing erotica in many different scenarios and niches for years as a hobby but now I'm ready to launch my author platform. My first novel is an interracial erotica and I'm super stoked to get it published. Then I can work on getting my other works out there as well.

What I Need:

I'm a little embarrassed asking for help this one time. However, this is what I need:

  • $225 (Which is the cost for one book cover. However, the price is discounted when you order 3+ or more, and it goes to $150 per cover).
  • I would have only asked for $225, but Indeigogo requires you to start at $500. I am a very humble person and would never ask for more than I need. 
  • If I do meet $500, not only would I scream with happiness but then I can order 3 book covers. ($150 x 3 covers = $450)
  • The funds I earn from my book would of course cover future expenses for my others novels that are waiting to get published.

Where the funds would go:

  • Directly to my awesome graphic designer who I've been talking to for awhile but I keep saying, "I'll let you know when I can afford it." What I love about her and her work is she can really transform your vision into an amazing cover. I'm hoping my next e-mail to her will be, "I have the money now!" :)

Why I Need Your Help:

Editing and book covers are expensive! Luckily, I got the editing down but can't afford to pay the graphic designer. As you know, a book cover is worth a thousand words. It's the first image a reader looks at when deciding if they should read the book or not. I'm aware of services like Fiverr where I can pay $5 for a cheap cover design, but I want to be taken seriously. Therefore, I will feel more confident working with a professional graphic designer. The one I picked understands my passion, my vision, and can bring my story to life through a cover.

What You Get & Your Impact:

What you get:
  • You can choose from a virtual thank you, your name on my book's dedication page and/or a copy of my book in e-book format.
  • Since it is erotica, please be 18+ years or older if you choose the e-book perk. Thanks for understanding.
  • If you're not into interracial erotica, no worries! I have many other books to publish! I can send you something different once those get publish. :)
With your help, I'll be able to get a professionally designed book cover and finish the process of self-publishing my novel. Only with your generosity, I can finally  launch my author career. You don't realize how much gratitude I have for caring people who are willing to give a chance for a struggling author. I hope to be able to pay it forward and help other new authors with their expenses one day.

I truly appreciate your support to anyone that's reading this, and I hope you have a wonderful day!

story:
JULES VERNE'S

MIKHAIL STROGOFF 

translated by Stephanie Smee

published by Eagle Books

Discover a ‘new’ classic from the legendary master of adventure!

Hi, we're the team at Eagle Books, the new imprint of Christmas Press, and we're thrilled to be bringing back to English-speaking readers one of the best adventure novels of all time, written by one of the most popular writers of all time: Jules Verne's Mikhail Strogoff.

First published in French in 1876 as Michel Strogoff, it is a rip-roaring tale of adventure and suspense, painted with romance and humour and set in pre-revolutionary Russia. Suitable for both adult and young readers from 11 and up, it is a book that's inspired countless film and TV adaptations all over the world.

In France, it's never been out of print, with most people considering it to be Verne’s best novel, but it has dropped out of sight in English-speaking countries as the original English translation--published well over a century ago!--is rather stodgy and dated for modern tastes.

But in Stephanie Smee's perfectly-pitched, lively translation of the original 1876 French text, the first such translation in over a hundred years, English-speaking readers can discover for themselves just why this novel has such an enormous following not only in France but all over the world.

Stephanie is a Sydney-based translator who turned in a legal career to combine her true loves of literature and French. She is responsible for introducing the enormously successful works of much-loved French author, the Countess de Ségur, to a whole new generation of English-speaking children, and her translations of these have been bestsellers.

 We are thrilled that Stephanie's translation of Jules Verne's Mikhail Strogoff will be the launch title for Eagle Books in 2016 and to mark and celebrate this major publishing event, we are looking for your support to help fund the production of a beautiful limited edition of the novel, released in early 2016, well before general commercial publication.

This exclusive collectible edition will be limited to 750 hand-numbered copies, with internal pages of soft cream paper, and each chapter featuring a delicate black and white illustration by artist David Allan. The cover will feature a full colour illustration by David Allan, set into high-quality textured red hardback binding, and the book will feature other special elements, such as coloured end-papers, a satin bookmark, and gold foil detail on front, spine and on book block edges.
This beautiful book will be available to Australian and New Zealand contributors for a pledge of AUD $55, postage included, and to all other international supporters for AUD $75, postage included. There are also many other levels of support, from $10 to $1000, and some truly fantastic perks for contributors, from commemorative bookmarks to playing cards, limited edition prints of the illustrations, authentic 19th century prints featuring Russian scenes, and more. All prices are in Australian dollars. Currently(as at March 15) the Australian dollar is worth approx NZ $1.03; approx US 76 cents; approx 73 Euro cents; approx 51 GB pence.

We invite you to be a part of this exciting adventure with us and help to bring back a great classic to the readers of the English-speaking world!

Read more about Mikhail Strogoff, and translator Stephanie Smee, at our website, www.eaglebooksadventure.com

There are also many other levels of support, from $10 to $1000, and some truly fantastic perks for contributors, from commemorative bookmarks to playing cards, limited edition prints of the illustrations, authentic 19th century prints featuring Russian scenes, and more. All prices are in Australian dollars. Currently(as at March 15) the Australian dollar is worth approx NZ $1.03; approx US 76 cents; approx 73 Euro cents; approx 51 GB pence.We invite you to be a part of this exciting adventure with us and help to bring back a great classic to the readers of the English-speaking world!Read more about Mikhail Strogoff, and translator Stephanie Smee, at our website, www.eaglebooksadventure.com

story: AAC - Ancient Aramaic Church - is for translating the Scriptures from the Ancient Aramaic language, the language Eashoa Msheekha (Jesus the Messiah) spoke two thousand years ago. This language is related to all the language of the early cultures where monotheism grew. The purpose of the AAC is to reconcile all the religions with respect to the use of the same major names. The Scriptures are consistent with all the names used in the three monotheistic religions. This funding will help the AAC to cover its printing expenses, so the Scriptures can be disseminated to those people who want them with minimal charge for shipping and handling only.

story:
The first goal was to write a book- CHECK.  

Now, I want to re-write the book how I originally planned- with the proper experts.  The Vulgar Truth Diet: Fat Loss is a book to help people transform their lives by fixing the S.P.I.N.E. (Stress, Sleep, Sex, Psychology, Injuries, Nutrition, and Exercise).  By addressing these pillars, people can begin to maximize fat loss.  I presented the information in a comedic, tough love way, and I nailed it in my first edition.  Now for the second version, I need to freelance experts to write alongside me to solidify my anecdotes and client success stories (more before and after photos for the next version as well.)  In order to do this, people want money.  I want to pay a Psychologist, Registered Dietitian, Physical Therapist, and Sex Therapist to give their expert opinions to make my original claims even stronger.  I also need to consult with a lawyer to make sure I don't get sued for the addition of 30+ pages lambasting "fitness professionals" in the industry.  It's time to put a stop to the toxicity in the fitness industry and actually help people in a truthful manner.  Today, egos get in the way of helping people.  I'm putting my ego aside and seeking out credentialed individuals in their respected field to help with this nations obesity problems.  

Amazon.com has plenty of reviews to support these claims:

http://www.amazon.com/The-Vulgar-Truth-Diet-Loss/dp/0615940706


Risks & Challenges

The most challenging aspect is finding the proper expert who feels comfortable with the material inside the book. The name says it all, "Vulgar Truth," and the material within the book is vulgar with crass imagery.  The imagery is to try and make people laugh.  Yes there are penis's in this book.  You've been warned.  I also know that you'll be LAUGHING OUT LOUD while learning how to fix your S.P.I.N.E. Some of the experts people may not feel comfortable being associated with the material. This challenge has been presented and will continue to be an issue, but being persistence and continuing to believe in what I've spent countess hours on assembling, will eventually pay off. If someone is offended, I'll find someone else who believes in the product as I have. I've already found 2 experts who'll back me; they're out there!

story:
I am Laura Levine Gumina--I live now in a senior apartment building.... a healthy and active sixty-five year old, living independently with a fulfilling life. 

This healthy lifestyle had certainly not always been the case.  This recovery only began after close to three years with the treatment E.M.D.R.  (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing)

After  35 years battling a bipolar disorder enduring twenty-three psych ward visits, ten ECT treatments, (Electra-Convulsive-Therapy) Known on the street as "shock treatments"...

Life in group homes...prescription drug addiction, unusual sexual behavior, severe depression with suicide attempts compounded the failure to cope and function.

 This film  brings Laura to the age of 65. She is in excellent health.  She is free of symptoms- and no longer in therapy.
 Laura undergoes E.M.D.R. therapy- for over two years- and begins recovery towards a peaceful, contented and even joyful life. Yes. Success!

I wish to raise the funds needed to to endorse EMDR therapy- bring it into the public consciousness EM.D.R. sessions.

This is a vitally important and successful therapy for PTSD, Bipolar disorder, anxiety, depression and other related psychiatric difficulties.
It is endorsed by the World Health Organization, the Veterans Administration, The American Psychiatric Association, The Defense Department,  and many other respected authorities- as well as hundreds of thousands of clinicians and over two million clients. Many irrefutable studies have proven the efficacy of this method of therapy.

We just want to edit this film-it is only the first draft, onsult artistically with the filmmaker about his concept  and continue filming to make this a vital and powerful promotional movie.  EMDR- needs to become mainstream.  People are suffering as I did.

We could then enter the completed film into festivals and to public venues of distribution ( which does cost money in most cases)  This is my dream.

Thank-you for your support.


For further instruction, please refer to the following short EMDR report from the television show 20/20 below-

It is excellent!:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTLLfdcJE0Q

Thank-you very much,

-Laura

story:
What is Wordier Than Thou?

As a literary arts organization our mission statement can be summed up in two words: literary nonsense.

Since 2012, we’ve supported local authors by organizing outside-the-box events throughout the state. Our goal is two-fold: to foster the literary arts community and to create a new fan base for writers.

We eschew the notion of typical, “stuffy” readings and seek to engage individuals who wouldn’t typically attend a literary event, while at the same time catering to authors and academics. Basically, we make literature fun and accessible. In fact, our proudest moments are when someone attends an event because it’s interesting, and has no idea they’re at an event considered to be “literary.” Also, we always make sure alcohol is available. That probably helps.

Over the past several years, our calendar has included: storytelling and prose open mics; literary pub crawls; our Critical Drinking book group; Florida Bookstore Day; the Tampa Bay Book Fair; a Banned Books Burlesque Show; Broad Comedy, a celebration of funny women writers; Teenage Wasteland, established authors reading from their teen diaries, letters and poetry; Camp Wordier Than Thou, a summer writing camp for adults; adult spelling bees; literary salons and more.


What’s in Store for Wordier Than Thou?

So, we’re writers and, therefore, ideas people, and boy do we have a lot of ideas. The two big ones are to open a bookstore and to launch a small press. We’ll focus mainly on authors living in Florida with both endeavors. We just launched our first chapbook contest for poetry and fiction/nonfiction.

We’ve been granted a live/work space for a small business/artist in Pinellas Park. The city has been actively growing its arts district along Park Boulevard for the past two years. It’s also centrally located – which is an ideal spot for a literary arts gallery unifying the arts community – making it easy for those visiting from throughout the county as well as from the greater Tampa Bay area. It’s also a quick ride north from St. Petersburg.

Costs associated with this bookstore include: monthly rent, utilities and insurance; books; bookshelves and other fixtures; moving costs; furniture; and marketing.

We also plan to obtain our 501(c)3 and to operate as a non-profit organization moving forward. This will allow us to accomplish so much more.

Every little bit donated to us helps defray the costs of this move and we appreciate the community’s support!


What We’ve Accomplished Already

· Our monthly storytelling open mics have been held in St. Petersburg, Clearwater, Dunedin, Tampa, Sarasota, Orlando and Gainesville. We’ve also been invited to bring several of our events out of state. We’re also bringing our Banned Books Burlesque show to book festivals and venues nationwide.

· Invited to produce an event for the Miami Book Fair and created the concept of a statewide traveling series called “Saved by the Sunshine State,” where writers talk about how they came to Florida. This will be the theme of our first anthology.

· Founded Florida Bookstore Day in 2014. More than 50 bookstores throughout the state held in-store events under the Florida Bookstore Day umbrella. Won an Awesome Tampa Bay grant to fund marketing for the project. Received proclamations from several cities and counties commending the project as well as a letter of recognition from the governor.

· Raised thousands of dollars for local nonprofit organizations (including Girls Inc., the Literacy Council of St. Pete, Project: Shattered Silence, CASA and more) through special themed events.

· Collaborations with numerous local authors, literary arts organizers and community organizations.

· Winner of a 2014 micro-funding event held by Creative Pinellas.

· Led a panel on community building at the 2015 Other Words Conference in St. Augustine.


The Impact

We anticipate the Wordier Than Thou Writers Project will have an impact beyond the literary community.

We’ll naturally host a number of our own events in the space. Plans include a literary salon, themed readings, a storytelling and prose open mic, book swaps, book groups and more.

But we’re also looking to create a collaborative space and plan to invite artists from other mediums to share their work – from film and theater to the visual arts and music.

It will also be a general community space, meaning non-profits and other organizations can use it to convey their messages to the people who need to hear it the most. We’ll also host a monthly free store and produce giveaway.

We want to be a resource for the entire community, not just local writers and readers.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, that’s ok! There are other ways to help the Wordier Than Thou Writers Project. You can:

·  Share this with all the booklovers you know! And they don’t have to live in Florida to support this project.

·  Like our Facebook page at facebook.com/wordierthanthou.

·  Donate used books, book cases or other furniture to the project.

·  Attend our events!

story:
Summary

When no one else cared…They had each other.

The past is a strange and beautiful thing. Some people run from it, some try to relive it, some try to recreate it and some try to pretend that it didn’t exist… yet the path builds and defines us all. For Alan, the past is a living, breathing thing that has chased him from the streets of Summerfield to present day, where it drags him back to his roots for a funeral that never should have had to happen.

Fifteen years ago, Alan was just a kid taking care of himself – and all those around him. The neighborhood kids looked up to him and relied on him, partly because they had no one else, and partly because he seemed to have a knack for the downtrodden. Fast forward and Alan feels the warm summer breeze against his skin and hears voices he hasn’t heard in a long, long time. Summerfield welcomes him like an old friend – a friend with history, knowledge and secrets that could change everything for Alan.

After The Long Wait...

Hello. Most of you who already know me, need no introduction. I am Albert J. Allie, a writer/director and all around filmmaker. So what am I campaigning?

     Finally after much pressure from friends, I have decided to write a book. But not just any book. I decided that I would write a book to talk about things that I have never told most people. Although I have fictionalized a portion of the story 97% of this book is based on actual events that have taken place in my life. I have changed names and certain facts to protect other people's privacy. 

     I have always been someone who has believed that our past molds and shapes us into who we become. It's just a matter of how resilient we are. How much we can take without breaking. My story, though a lot of it sad, has molded me into the boyfriend, husband, parent, grandparent and all around person I have become. What got me through my tough times are my friends. And this story is about just that. Friendships. four friends who need each other, when their own families do not even care. I have always thought this story should be told, but needed a way to tell it without compromising other people. And here it is. Inspired by my life, as well as those whom I credit as being the best group of friends I have ever had.

     Set in the early 1980's, these four 13 to 14 yr old friends see each other through rape, drug abuse, bullying (and that's just from their own families).

A Professional finish is What The Book Needs 

In order to get some pros on the book, this is what it will take and here is what it needs...

Copy Editing is important. I need a professional copy editor to go through the manuscript with a fine toothed comb, checking for for spelling, grammatical and formatting errors.

Cover design is another important area. Although I tried my hand at making one, I am not a graphic designer and a great book cover is important to catch the eye of someone so that they will stop and buy.

Advertising will be done in a few ways. I will utilize Facebook's advertising. I will also use amazon advertising (Yes they charge to push your book to their cover page and on the top of searches). Fliers, cards and small local newspaper ads as well.

Physical Copies of the book are essential for live readings and book signings. This is a great promotional tool. Live advertising so to speak. 

Misc is for any mailings, Postage, extra copies or fees.

The Impact

This story has some heavy parts of my life put into print. Things I have never talked about before with anyone. I was lost and felt alone. I dealt with things that no child should have to deal with.  I want to be able to have young adults connect with it AS WELL as adults. I want them to know that they are not alone and should never feel they have no choices in life. Irregardless of your age, you ALWAYS have a say so about being free and safe from harm, even if it is from your own family. There are other alternatives aside from that which many young people take. Suicide. You can live and be happy! This is a story that has always needed to be told. I just needed to find a way to tell it, So here it is!

Risks & Challenges

In life there are risks and challenges to EVERYTHING we do. Walking out of the house is a risk and challenge in itself, but we do it. The challenge here, is to get this story out to everyone. The advertising, book readings, as well as Social media, word of mouth, book lending, etc will help do just that. I can reach a larger audience than just those on a Facebook page.

Other Ways You Can Help

Have a business? Book Store? I can come and do a reading there for you. Schedule me and I will show up and read from the book. Any ideas that you may have, please feel free to share with me. Any other ways you want to help, or feel that this can help some how boost your own business.

story:
Abused: Where the Cycle of SELF Starts tells the story of my personal struggles with same sex child molestation. It refutes the adage that " time heals all wounds."  You will delve into parts of my life that I fought to keep secret; you will explore the hardships of self forgiveness; and prayerfully by the end you willl challenge yourself to open dialogue on a topic the has for generations been ignored. 

The Self- Evaluation Diary: Breaking the Cycle of SELF is a diary that encourages you to journal where you are and provokes transformation through self reflections of who you are and who God says you are.

   My hope is that my story will encourage others to be courageous.

story:
An Opportunity to Support a Cause~Together we can help end domestic violence and abuse!  

Release Date October 2016

Help Publish books & supplies to make Bracelets for a cause.


"This is a strong and important story.  I hope many will read and benefit by it. You may even save a few lives here." ~Author of "How to Be A Great Coach"


A powerful, rare view into the dark world of coercive control that also glitters with faith, courage, and resilience. Thank you for telling your story!  Mary S.

You Asked, How Can You Help?

Thank you for your compassion, support and taking a look at Love Doesn't Have To Hurt Book & Bracelets and I Love ME children book Campaign! 

We need your help to get the word out to raise awareness to end domestic violence and sexual abuse.  You can contact me at faithlovedoesnthurt@gmail.com 

If you feel motivated to also contribute with a donation to help get the books published and supplies for the bracelets that will be very much appreciated! 

The book "Love Doesn't Have to Hurt" Help by raising a generation that supports non-violence and abuse by recognizing the signs of abuse.  Which makes happier people for a better society.  Also to empower and get the tools needed to understand why domestic violence and sexual abuse is not making a healthier society.  And you will get the strength, the tools and the resources to heal from trauma.




Did you know that 1 out of 3 Georgia Teens is Impacted by Dating Violence.  

1 in 4 women experience violence from a spouse or boyfriend? Also 7 millions Children live in homes with severe partner violence and abuse.  

And 500 women are raped or sexually assaulted each day in the United States. 1 out of 3 Georgia Teens get abused.  


Who Am I

My name is Denise Hardnett, a survivor of sexual abuse and domestic violence.  For many years I lived in silence.  It affected my children and myself greatly. I suffered with depression, loneliness and fear.  

This book was inspired by God, my children and Women who lost their lives to domestic violence.  My children asked the hard questions: Why did you accept it?  Why did they hurt you? What's happening with daddy?  Why are we staying?  How do we leave?  One of the hardest things to do, is leave an abusive relationship because you must find the strength and courage to leave,   deal with the emotional side effects and have a safe place to go.


Why I am doing it

After experiencing more than a decade of domestic violence and abuse we're free. In the two years of being free, I had a need and desire to write a book about my personal experience to inspire others, give them the tools and educate them on domestic violence and healing.  If I could help one, not experience what I went through.  I want to send the message that you are loved and are very special so you don't have to live in silence any more.  I am apart of online organization known as Verbal Abuse Journals.  As a Mentor to other ladies or men experiencing domestic violence or survivors of domestic violence. 

 I love photography and making & designing jewelry.  I would love to give women in domestic violence shelters one book and (2) bracelet for free.  I Love ME interactive book for teachers, counselors and parents to help identify child sexual abuse.

Inspiration to Women & girls!


Get Love Doesn't Have to Hurt  published in hardcover, paperback and ebook into the hands of many parents, teens, shelters, schools and a children's book I Love Me to bring awareness to prevent sexual abuse.  With your contribution we can make that happen.   The Books will be ready to print after editor review it.


Breakdown of Funds!

  • $3,000 Publishing package, ISBN, Barcode, e books and website
  • $3,500 First bulk of books and shipping
  • $1,000 Marketing, Advertising expenses, transportation and book events 
  • $700  materials for beads, crystals, Faith charms, crown spacers, glue and stretchy cords for 300 bracelets ranging from 5 inches to 8 inches.
  • Indiegogo fees and Paypal fees


Okay, great Perks just for You

Each contributor will get an email thanking them for their donation. Please don't forget to leave your emails.  

  • $10 donation for 15% off purchase of Love Doesn't Have To Hurt book.
  • $25 donation  You will get an eBook of Love Doesn't Have To Hurt and t-shirt. 
  • $50  donation You will get a pair of earrings from Sky Custom Designs, signed printed book  & eBook.
  • $75  donation You will get a signed hardcover of Love Doesn't Have To Hurt, a bracelet from Sky Custom Designs. 
  • $100 donation You will get a note and signed hardcover of Love Doesn't Have To Hurt and I Love ME children's book series, a bracelet from Sky Custom Designs, and playing cards with the book cover design.  
  • $200 donation You get signed hardcover & softcover of Love Doesn't Have To Hurt and (1) I Love ME, adult and child's bracelets from Sky Custom Designs, and reusable shopping bag designed from the book cover and one book donated to anyone you want.
  • $500 or more  donation You get signed (2) hardcover of Love Doesn't Have To Hurt, I Love ME, a bracelet from Sky Custom Designs, and your name/organization on my sponsors page in the book saying Thank You, and one book donated to anyone you want.


The Impact

"Together We Can End Domestic Violence and sexual abuse"


The  book will inspire, educate, empower, prevent, heal and encourage you to know that Love doesn't have to hurt.


If you are a survivor or currently in a domestic violence.  Please call 800-799-7233 National Domestic Violence hotline.  

Atlanta area Women's Resources Center

 404-688-9436                         

PADV 404-870-9600



Risks & Challenges

I am confident in delivering books on time for domestic violence and sexual abuse month.  Without your contributions the printing and Illustration of these books and bracelets will not be possible.  By supporting the campaign you will not only get a book, but we're aiming to help every child.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about Love Doesn't Have to Hurt and I Love ME Campaign to your family and friends on your social media!  Use #LoveDoesntHavetoHurt.

No amount too small.  Thank you in advance for your Faithful Support of Love Doesn't Have to Hurt.

story:
Le 20 novembre dernier, Geneviève Néron et sa mère Francine Néron partent pour Haïtï, aider la Soeur Fleura et ces 71 enfants. Soeur Flora Blanchette, infirmière d’origine québécoise est arrivée en Haïti en 1979. Elle a fondé en 1981 un orphelinat pour les enfants abandonnés, deux écoles et un dispensaire dans lequel elle diagnostique et soigne ses patients.

Le 14 décembre, à l'approche de Noël, Geneviève remettra vos dons en main propre à Sœur Flora qui pourra acheter de la nourriture, des couches, des médicaments pour ses 71 petits. À chaque jour, elle vous présentera les enfants, courageux et attachants qui vivent à l'orphelinat. Voir le Facebook. 

Il n'y a pas de petit don, chaque dollar se transformera en nourriture, couches ou médicaments. 

Partagez la levée de fond et donnez généreusement. 

Plusieurs organismes travaillent actuellement avec Soeur Fleura à l'élaboration d'une stratégie d'aide à long terme. Ces partenariats sont long à s'établir et laisse les enfants dans le besoin en ce moment. Pour ceux qui voudraient contribuer à long terme et également obtenir un reçu d'impôt pour leur don, vous pouvez donner à la fondation Gérin-Lajoie. http://fondationpgl.ca/accueil/faire-un-don/

story:
Evan's Fiction... 

...we are in need of donors so that we might eventually donate, as well.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

This is our difference: our non-profit literary journal will donate fixed percentages of its fiscal year's revenue to literacy programs in and around Chicago. 

This campaign is grounded in our need for initial finances so that we can begin promoting awareness more effectively, afford a useful website, begin copyediting submissions, and finally: printing our first issue. 

$2,000 should cover most of these initial steps towards production. We are trying to be as frugal as possible in the preliminary stages.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Importantly, our mission is to devote ourselves to supporting all levels of writing. 

We do not desire giving any writer a cold shoulder. Fictions that are deemed as lacking in certain areas will be offered the opportunity to be included on our website for the purpose of promoting their effort while also fostering a sense of achievement; those still learning the craft need support, not rejection.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

The obvious challenges we foresee and are working with now are mainly logistical. 

They are as follows: 

-Achieving tax-exemptions from the state of Illinois for the sake of maximizing our ability to donate.

-Developing a distribution-proposal that strives towards a non-consigned product license for buyers.

-Formulating a productive policy in regards to financing potential literacy programs within Chicago.

-Promoting awareness of our mission among writers in Chicago--both student and otherwise--who would potentially be willing to submit their work under a non-binding contract.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

If you feel this is something you are ready to get behind, please consider supporting us with any amount possible. We are beyond grateful to our patrons and audience.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

If you are unable to help us financially please spread the word! In its fruition, I feel this will be a positive effort towards promoting young learners and writers alike in and around Chicago. Our Facebook page is @ facebook.com/EvansFiction

Thank you so much for your support and consideration! We couldn't dream without you.

story:
Summary

Thay Phap Dang and Dat Phan have been working on a translation of his book on mindfulness for young adults. They are a series of poetic and pratical wisdom on the spirit of mindfulness practice presented at Plum Village.

This book is essentiel for young adults who are treading on the mindful path. Thay Phap Dang's gentleness, strength, and experience will touch many positive seeds in the reader, as he shares through his life and practice.

Many books have been written on mindfulness but this one sheds light on young adulthood, which is a special time when many transformations can take place, to help create a peaceful future and happy life.

Objective

1500 euros is our objective to offer Thay Phap Dang's book to the Plum Village Bookshops in France and the USA. Our aim is to have a short-run of 300 books.

Impact

There are many great teachers in the Plum Village tradition that reflect the compassion and wisdom of their teacher, Thich Nhat Hanh. Thay Phap Dang is a wonderful continuation and his voice deserves to be heard as his writing may help young people who are at a crossroad or who wish to deepen their practice.

story:
Brother and Sisters In Christ Greetings to you all In the name of Our Precious Lord Jesus Christ.

Short Summary

  • Donations will be helping orphans, widows, food, shelter, education for the upcoming leaders in their congregations.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have set the goal of this campaign to $7,000 US dollars.                                       $500 will go to helping orphans in regards to food, education, and shelter.           $300 will go to supporting the old aged, widows and congregation people on Sunday's because right they have a very poor living environment.                            $1,200 will be going to having a bible classes and an event once a month to gather all 25 pastors from all of the congregations, from all different villages and tribal areas, together under one roof. This would also go towards food and providing travel expanses to make this an event once a month.                                    $2,000 to add 3 water bores in the surrounding villages and congregations for lifelong clean drinking water.                                                                                                     $3,000 to provide sewing machines to young widows, Goats or Buffaloes to Handicapped People and Providing  a Medicines to Hiv Aids Patients. They are Unable to do work and if we do this then they will be able to feed their own self.

Past projects and our planned future

  • In the past we have raised $1,000 for a water bore to be built so that 300 people could receive healthy clean drinking water. We also have pictures to prove the work was completed. The project was a huge success. Since, we achieved that project we are now asking generous people to donate more to help God's work and His people in India.  
  • I can guarantee you that your money will impact many lives and help grow the kingdom of God. All we ask is you pray and see how and what God would like you to do in regards to supporting these people in India financially.  

Risks & Challenges

  • The risks we are taking right now is that we have set the bar really high.
  • However, we know our God is powerful and mighty and will provide. However, if we do not meet our goal that's okay. We will try our best and see what God does for us. Like Peter who walked out of the boat and walked on water you have to take risks in order to walk on water. When and if we fail at least a merciful and loving God will take our hand and pull us back up. We will use every dollar we receive to the best of ability. After all we must be good stewards of the resources God provides us even if it is not the whole goal. We will try our best because our God is with us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Most important of all, If you can't support financially. Please pray! We need all the prayer warriors supporting us in this campaign.
  • Please share this with any who are interested in helping us in India to make an impact. 
  • God bless and thank you for taking a look at what God is and wanting to achieve in India.

story: ROMANIA IN CONTACT este unica revista romano-engleza independenta despre romanii de succes care traiesc in afara granitelor Romaniei. In anul 2010 am lansat un proiect-pilot in Italia care a avut un raspuns foarte bun din partea publicului si asta ne-a incurajat sa mergem mai departe. In anul 2013 am decis sa ne mutam redactia la Londra. Revista si-a propus, in cele 120 de pagini, sa puna in lumina reflectoarelor romanii de valoare si sa promoveze Romania prin tot ce are ea mai frumos. Este un proiect lung si anevoios, insa unul in care cred. Dorim sa schimbam perceptia printr-o presa de calitate, pozitiva, inspirationala, unde valoarea si oamenii inteligenti sunt cei care isi gasesc loc in paginile ziarelor si revistelor, nicidecum non-valorile si ambalajele fara continut!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Evita Giron and I am an aspiring children's book author. I am currently pursuing a second master's degree in Religion and Religious Education from Fordham University. Previously a Program Associate for a foundation, I happily traded in my 9-to-5 gig for a rewarding career as a children's author. The best part: working from my home office, I get to spend more time with my own girl with "magical curls."

This campaign is important to me because it will allow for all curly girls and children in general to love themselves, and appreciate the uniqueness and differences of each person in this world. Someone said to me the other day, "I can't wait to read your book to my daughter. We need more curly girls as super heroes, to look up to." I was humbled by the statement as it made me feel that I am making a difference in the lives of curly girls and girls around the world.

The Girl With The Magical Curls is about a little girl named Tatiana who develops magical hair powers while it gets caught in her neighbor’s ivies. Tatiana goes around town saving lives and aiding others using her hair. From saving the life of the neighborhood kitty; to saving the lives of carnival goers at a local amusement park, Tatiana learns the importance of helping others.  The inspiration for my book, The Girl With The Magic Curls came from my daughter Tatiana. As a multiracial family and coming from a diverse background, I thought it would be a good idea to have a child super hero with a unique special power. In love with my daughter’s curly hair and my curly hair, I thought why not create a character with curly hair that has amazing super power abilities using her hair? The messages in this story are relatable, loving your hair, girl empowerment, and being of service to all humankind. 


What We Need 

Since deciding to self-publish their are some rather pricey fees involved. Below is the breakdown and description of why $5,000 is my target fundraising goal. 

  • Copyeditor/Developmental Edits-$200, making sure my book is grammar free, sentence structure is on point as well as reading appropriate for my target age group. I want my book to be a professional piece of art before it goes to print. 
  • Illustrator - $3,000, There are so many great illustrators out there who do awesome work! Their efforts should most definitely be rewarded from character development to creating the book cover page to the rest of the illustrations it's only fair to reward them for their hard work. 
  • Book layout and formatting and printing -$1,000, I'm using a platform called CreateSpace through Amazon to layout, format and print my book. Amazon is a great platform that can provide many copies of your book for a great price, especially printing on demand. Short Summary

Hello! My name is Evita Giron and I am an aspiring children's book author. I am currently pursuing a second master's degree in Religion and Religious Education from Fordham University. Previously a Program Associate for a foundation, I happily traded in my 9-to-5 gig for a rewarding career as a children's author. The best part: working from my home office, I get to spend more time with my own girl with "magical curls."

This campaign is important to me because it will allow for all curly girls and children in general to love themselves, and appreciate the uniqueness and differences of each person in this world. Someone said to me the other day, "I can't wait to read your book to my daughter. We need more curly girls as super heroes, to look up to." I was humbled by the statement as it made me feel that I am making a difference in the lives of curly girls and girls around the world.

The Girl With The Magical Curls is about a little girl named Tatiana who develops magical hair powers while it gets caught in her neighbor’s ivies. Tatiana goes around town saving lives and aiding others using her hair. From saving the life of the neighborhood kitty; to saving the lives of carnival goers at a local amusement park, Tatiana learns the importance of helping others.  The inspiration for my book, The Girl With The Magic Curls came from my daughter Tatiana. As a multiracial family and coming from a diverse background, I thought it would be a good idea to have a child super hero with a unique special power. In love with my daughter’s curly hair and my curly hair, I thought why not create a character with curly hair that has amazing super power abilities using her hair? The messages in this story are relatable, loving your hair, girl empowerment, and being of service to all humankind.

story:
What is PublicThinks? 

Currently news articles are very biased and prolonged. Readers of news articles look for concise, crucial and entertaining information brought to the point. In some cases, a reader feels the need to share his/her opinion. Comments and polls are a great way to satisfy these users, simultaneously keep them entertained. But, taking popular news-platforms as an example, more than 95% of users choose not to comment, as comments are put to the background on most sites. In contrast to that, PublicThinks provides users the opportunity to start controversial conversations. Leading off to these elements, users are able to build their own, unique vantage point.

How is PublicThinks unique? 

PublicThinks differs from other news sites because of its concise, crucial and interesting content. PublicThinks doesn't just offer that, it offers and encourages users to debate about the news and interpret the news. This offers even more interesting content, and not to forget this factor makes reading more entertaining. 

What We Need & Why 

  • To expand, grow, and to improve our activity we need money. 
  • We will spend the money on advertising and hiring new editors to improve our activity. 
  • The money will also be spent on buying merchandise, to spread the word about PublicThinks. 
  • Obviously reaching our goal and above would be great, but if we wouldn't we would do the exact same things we planned, except we couldn't hire as many employees.

Why use PublicThinks

  • PublicThinks will entertain you, inform you in a brief way. 
  • Nevertheless, the quality of the text is at a high quality. 
  • We only would and are hiring qualified people for the job, that have a great understanding and education in writing.

story:
RE, ACORDES DE ESPERANZA

Un proyecto social, una travesía que le apuesta a la paz. RE es un sueño hecho REalidad que entrega instrumentos musicales a algunas de las regiones más afectadas por el conflicto armado en Colombia. 

En la primera temporada 2015 se recogieron más de 100 instrumentos musicales que colombianos y extranjeros REGALARON, estos fueron llevados por todo el país por César López y como resultado se emitió la serie documental: RE CUANDO LA MÚSICA NOS HABLA,  una coproducción de Canal TR3CE y Negrita Films.

Ahora en 2016 el reto continúa, y queremos componer contigo LOS ACORDES DE LA ESPERANZA,  llegado a más comunidades,  aportando más instrumentos que escriban las notas de la paz. AHORA NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA PARA ALCANZAR LA META y comprar la dotación especifica para diferentes regiones del país.Desde todos los lugares del mundo trabajamos por lograr la paz en Colombia, y este es tu momento para hacer parte de esta causa. 

RE, CHORDS OF HOPE

A social project, a journey committed to peace. RE is a dream made into REality that brings musical instruments to some of the regions most affected by the armed conflict in Colombia.

In the first part of 2015, the project collected over 100 instruments from donations within Colombia and abroad; these were distributed all over the country by César López, and as a result led to the documentary series: RE, CUANDO LA MÚSICA NOS HABLA / RE, WHEN THE MUSIC SPEAKS, a coproduction of Canal TR3CE and Negrita Films.

Now in 2016 the dream continues, and we want to compose with you THE CHORDS OF HOPE, reaching more communities, supporting more instruments that play notes of peace. WE NEED YOU TO REACH OUR GOAL and provide the best instruments for different regions of the country. This is your chance to support peace in Colombia.

 

¿Qué necesitamos?

Esta campaña busca recaudar 5000 dólares para hacer la compra de instrumentos como acordeones, tiples, requintos, marimbas, saxofones, bajos, bandolas, gaitas, clarinetes, trompetas, chelos,  y muchos más. Cada donación cuenta.

Si apoyas esta campaña te ofrecemos la mejor de las recompensas: Aportar a la Paz de Colombia a través de la música, apoyando a las comunidades que fueron víctimas de la guerra.

Sabemos que con tu apoyo lograremos la meta, pero de no lograrlo igual invertiremos cada donación en la compra de instrumentos musicales y continuaremos buscando recursos económicos para llegar a la meta.

What do we need?

This campaign looks to collect $5,000 to provide instruments such as accordions, tiples, requintos, marimbas, saxophones, bass guitars, bandolas, gaitas, clarinets, trumpets, cellos, and many more. Every donation counts.

If you support this project we offer the best reward: contribute to peace in Colombia through music, supporting the communities that were victims of war.

We know that with your support we will reach the goal of $5,000, but no matter how much money is raised it will all be used to purchase musical instruments, and we will continue to look for economic resources to reach our goal.

 

El impacto

Tu podrás escribir con nosotros LOS ACORDES DE ESPERANZA, aportando a gente real que durante muchos años ha vivido la guerra. Ahora niños y jóvenes podrán cambiar sus armas por música. 

En la primera temporada de RE logramos llevar más de 100 instrumento musicales en 12 regiones de país, cambiando la vida de niños y jóvenes.

Visita nuestra web www.regalauninstrumento.com y conoce nuestra historia y el trabajo que hemos realizado, en redes sociales también nos encuentras Twitter: @REbandaPaz Instagram: regalauninstrumento y Facebook: Regalauninstrumento

The impact

You will be able to write with us the CHORDS OF HOPE, contributing to real people who for many years have lived through war. Now kids and young people can exchange their weapons for music.

In the first phase of RE, we succeeded in bringing more than 100 musical instruments to 12 regions of the country, changing lives of children and young people.

Visit our web page at www.regalauninstrumento.com and get to know our history and the work we have completed. On social networks you can find us at: Twitter @REbandaPaz, Instagram: regalauninstrumento and Facebook: Regalauninstrumento.

 

Riesgos y desafíos 

Nuestro mayor desafío es llegar a tantos donantes como sea posible, sabemos que no es fácil, pero este proyecto nos llena el corazón y sabemos que podemos lograrlo con tu ayuda.

  • Hacemos difusión en medios de comunicación: Radio, Prensa, Televisión, medios digitales y redes sociales.
  • Hacemos seguimiento a los aportantes mostrando lo que va sucediendo con los instrumentos, desde su compra hasta cuando son entregados.
  • Hacemos una investigación reconociendo las regiones y grupos que más necesitan ayuda.
  • Hacemos parte de los eventos donde se promueve la paz.
  • Hacemos alianzas con artistas para masificar los mensajes y llegar a más personas.  

Risks and challenges

Our biggest challenge is reaching as many donors as possible. We know that it isn’t easy, but this project is very important to us.

  • We share our ongoing progress in various networks: radio, press, television, digital media, and social networks.
  • We follow through with contributors, showing where the instruments have gone, from when they are purchased until they reach their final destination.
  • We do research to identify the regions and groups that most need help.
  • We are part of events that promote peace.
  • We partner with artists to spread the message to more people.
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

No siempre es fácil aportar, por eso te invitamos a que compartas esta campaña, y el increíble trabajo que hace Indiegogo para permitirnos llegar a ti. Escribamos juntos esta nueva historia, de LOS ACORDES DE ESPERANZA

Si tienes un instrumento musical y quieres hacerlo llegar también es bienvenido, puedes contactarnos a regalauninstrumento@gmail.com 

Que la música traiga las notas de la Paz.

Other ways you can help

It is not always easy to contribute, which is why we invite you to share this campaign, and the incredible work that Indiegogo does to enable us to connect with you. Together we will write this new story, THE CHORDS OF HOPE.

If you have a musical instrument that you want to donate, your contribution is welcome. You can contact us at regalauninstrumento@gmail.com

Creating notes of peace through music.

story:
VISTA HERMOSA
DESDE SUS OJOS

 

Al menos 362 personas han sido afectadas desde 1990 por minas antipersona en el municipio de Vista Hermosa, Meta, convirtiéndolo en el lugar con el mayor número de víctimas por este artefacto en Colombia.

Pese al temor que acompañó a Vista Hermosa durante décadas, ahora sus habitantes quieren contar la historia desde sus ojos y compartir su memoria como un método de superación para las futuras generaciones. ¿Y a usted también le gustaría escucharlas?

Con el proyecto Vista Hermosa desde sus ojos, Rutas del Conflicto quiere crear un puente entre las historias de los pobladores de Vista Hermosa y el resto del mundo. Como parte del proyecto, buscamos empoderar a los jóvenes del municipio para que narren los hechos, vivencias y anécdotas sin intermediarios y puedan difundir la información en una plataforma periodística.

La imagen de Vista Hermosa se construyó como la de un lugar violento y peligroso. Este ha sido un municipio donde el tira y afloje de diferentes actores armados ha puesto en peligro la vida de sus habitantes. La disputa entre paramilitares de las Autodefensas Unidas de Colombia (AUC), las Autodefensas Campesinas de Casanare, guerrilleros de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Colombia (FARC), y miembros de la fuerza pública provocó desapariciones, muertes y el desplazamiento de cientos de vistahermoseños.

Las minas antipersona han dejado huellas físicas visibles, pero también otras que invisibles han quedado en la memoria de sus pobladores. Estas historias, al igual que muchas minas, permanecen enterradas en el olvido.

Queremos que hagas parte de este intento por acercar las historias de los sobrevivientes a aquellos con distintas miradas del conflicto para promover un diálogo de paz.

"El rol de las historias que queremos contar, no es para quejarnos o recordar dolorosamente. Más bien, vamos a demostrar la superación que hemos tenido a través del tiempo, sin pensar en las barreras que nos han impuesto la guerra o la violencia, sufrida por algunos jóvenes aquí en el municipio": David Ballén, líder Grupo Unión de Pensamiento Joven. 

 

 ¿Por qué donar? El proyecto en 5 razones

  1. Vista Hermosa es el municipio con más víctimas de minas antipersona en Colombia. Este proyecto brindará información sobre las afectaciones causadas por los artefactos y la manera cómo la población ha logrado sobreponerse a las secuelas.
  2. Para algunos vistahermoseños, hablar sobre el tema de minas es una manera de “quitar la amargura”, construir memoria, y sobretodo, evitar que muchas situaciones queden impunes.
  3. Queremos darle otra mirada al conflicto que ha sufrido en Vista Hermosa, desde el punto de vista de quienes han sufrido la guerra durante 30 años, sin revictimizar.
  4. Buscamos unir las historias con un espacio para contarlas. Son pocos los jóvenes que tienen acceso a recursos de narración audiovisual, y sin embargo, buscan por iniciativa propia herramientas para comunicar los sucesos de Vista Hermosa de la mejor forma posible. Rutas del Conflicto busca compartir las técnicas periodísticas con municipios afectados. ¡Hagamos ese puente!
  5. Por último, la reconstrucción de la memoria de los vistahermoseños será un insumo valioso tanto para investigadores del tema y cualquiera que quiera entender la realidad colombiana. Además, este será un nuevo paso en el proceso de construcción de paz en la región.

 

¿Cómo será la plataforma?

El portal periodístico que queremos construir con su apoyo será un lugar de retroalimentación contínua, donde se muestre información sobre el conflicto de Vista Hermosa, el impacto de las minas antipersona y cómo sus habitantes se han empoderado para sobreponerse a las consecuencias de la guerra. A través de las vivencias de sus habitantes, crearemos un espacio para visibilizar la manera cómo han reconstruido sus vidas.

Hechos que permitan hacer una reconstrucción del conflicto en el lugar, incluyendo testimonios de sobrevivientes de manera escrita o audiovisual y cifras relacionadas con el desplazamiento, el proceso de desminado, asesinatos y finalmente sobre el posible panorama de posconflicto en el municipio.

La participación de la comunidad es la parte fundamental del proyecto. Queremos capacitar a jóvenes y adultos para que adquieran herramientas periodísticas básicas que les permitan escribir crónicas, perfiles y reportajes que sean publicados en el portal.​

"Yo digo sí, nosotros somos normales. Quien nos pone límites a una discapacidad es la persona que nos observa": Luz Dary Pineda, líder y sobreviviente de minas antipersona.
 

Más sobre Rutas del Conflicto

¿Quién sabe de la guerra en Colombia? ¿Los ciudadanos, la justicia, los medios de comunicación o los grupos armados? La realidad es que la información está dispersa y es inexacta. Por eso creamos Rutas del Conflicto, un medio de comunicación que reúne información del conflicto armado en Colombia, a partir de una extensa base de datos periodística y contenido narrativo y de investigación.

Nuestra plataforma permite visualizar los datos a través de mapas y líneas de tiempo que explican el contexto histórico y geográfico de la guerra; especiales periodísticos con la reconstrucción histórica del conflicto armado en distintas regiones de Colombia  y testimonios de sobrevivientes a la guerra.

Rutas del Conflicto surgió de la necesidad de visibilizar los hechos del conflicto armado colombiano que no habían sido narrados ni resaltados por los medios de comunicación y el mismo Estado, convirtiéndose en la primera base de datos periodística que ha documentando 728 masacres perpetradas entre 1982 hasta la fecha.  

En 2015, creamos el proyecto Yo Sobreviví, un ejercicio de periodismo transmedia donde involucramos a las comunidades no solo como fuentes de información sino también en la producción y verificación de contenidos.

Somos un proyecto que busca ser una fuente de consulta para centros de enseñanza, investigadores, medios de comunicación, organizaciones de víctimas y ciudadanos del común.

¿Tienes preguntas? Contáctanos al correo rutasdelconflicto@gmail.com y estaremos pendientes de contestarte.

 

¿Cómo más puedes ayudar?
