Visita nuestra página y suscríbete al boletín para mantenerte informado.

Síguenos en Facebook, Twitter y nuestra cuenta de Instagram.

 

(English translation)

Vista Hermosa from their eyes

 

At least 362 people have been affected by landmines in the city of Vista Hermosa, in the Colombian state of Meta, since 1990. It makes it the place with the highest number of victims caused by landmines in Colombia.   

Despite the fear that has lived in Vista Hermosa for decades, nowadays its inhabitants want to tell and reveal the story from their own eyes and share their memories. As described by David Ballén, a regional youth leader, it would be “an overcoming method for future generations”. And how about you? Would you like to listen to those stories?

With the project Vista Hermosa from its eyes, the Colombian journalistic media Rutas del Conflicto wants to create a bridge between the stories from the people of Vista Hermosa and those who want to know it. As an important part of this project, we work for the empowerment of the municipality’s youth, in order to help them narrate facts, experiences and anecdotes without intermediaries and distribute all this information through a journalistic online platform.

People perceive Vista Hermosa as a dangerous and violent place. The action by several armed actors has affected the municipality and endangered its inhabitants. The conflict, which included the presence of paramilitaries, as Autodefensas Unidas de Colombia and Autodefensas Campesinas de Casanare, the FARC insurgent group (Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Colombia), and Colombian legal armed forces caused disappearances, deaths and displacement of hundreds of Vista Hermosa’s inhabitants.

The explosions have left not only physical and visible traces, but also other marks, psychological ones, which have remained invisible in the memory of survivors. These stories, like many landmines, are still buried in people’s lack of awareness.       

We want you to be part of this project, in an attempt to bring the survivors’ stories closer to those with different views of Colombian conflict and to promote a peace dialogue.

“The role of stories that we want to tell, it’s” not to complain or remember it painfully. Moreover, we will show the overcoming we have had through time, without thinking in the obstacles imposed by war or violence, suffered by some young people from the municipality”: David Ballén, a youth organization’s leader.

 

Why donate? 5 reasons why you should donate

  1. Vista Hermosa is the municipality with the higher number of landmine victims in Colombia. This project will provide information on the consequences caused by these artifacts and on the way survivors have managed to overcome incidents.
  2. For some inhabitants of the city, telling their stories is a way to overcome the  bitterness caused by bad experiences, to share memory and to fight against non-punishment.
  3. We want to give a new glance at the conflict in Vista Hermosa, from the point of view of whom have experienced war for 30 years, without re-victimizing them.
  4. We want to unite the stories with a space made to tell them. Few young people in Vista Hermosa have access to resources of audiovisual narrative, and, even so, a group works on its own initiative in order to seek better tools to communicate the events of the city. Rutas del Conflicto wants to share journalistic techniques with them and help them make a website. Let's build this bridge!
  5. Finally, the memory’s reconstruction of the inhabitants will be a valuable input for academic researchers and for other interested readers. Besides, it will be a new step in the process of peacebuilding in the region.

 

How will the platform be?

The news website we want to build with your support will be a place of continuous feedback, where information about Vista Hermosa will be shared, including stories about the impact of landmines and how its inhabitants have empowered themselves to overcome war consequences. Through the experiences of people, we will create a space to make visible the way they have rebuilt their lives.

This work will include facts which allow a reconstruction of the conflict in Vista Hermosa, including declarations of survivors through different supports, as the written or the audiovisual forms, numbers related to displacement, the process of removing of mines, murders, and finally, the possible post-conflict atmosphere in the municipality.

It also involves community participation: we want to enable young people and adults to acquire basic journalistic tools to write stories, profiles and reports to be published in the website.

“I say yes, we are normal. Who establish limits to a person with a disability is the person who observes us”: Luz Dary Pineda, regional leader and survivor of landmines.


More about Rutas del Conflicto

Who knows about the war in Colombia ? Citizens, justice institutions, media or armed groups? Up to this date, information on this topic is scattered and inaccurate. This is the reason why we created the project "Rutas del Conflicto", a journalistic website which gathers information about Colombia's internal conflict, including a database and a investigative and narrative content.

Our platform offers data organized in maps and timelines which explains the war’s historical and geographic content, special coverage with the reconstrucción of historical memory in different Colombians regions and stories told by survivors,

Rutas del Conflicto (Routes of Conflict) is the first journalist database with info about Colombia internal conflict. Through maps and timelines that explain and help visualize the historical and geographical context of war, this platform reveals facts previously untold by mass media and the Colombian state itself; invisible facts that need to be let out in the open. Victims, academics, researchers and journalists alike can supply information to keep building this database.

Rutas del Conflicto was founded because of the necessity of telling invisible facts about Colombian internal conflict, which were untold by mass media or the Colombian state itself. Thus, the project became the first journalist database with information about 728 massacres occurred since 1982.

In 2015, we created the project “Yo Sobreviví”, with transmedia storytelling, in which we involve survivors of the conflict not only as sources of information, but also in the production and verification of contents.  

This project aims for the the use of published information by schools, researchers, media, victims' organizations and ordinary citizens. Do you have any question? Contact rutasdelconflicto@gmail.com and we will answer as soon as we can.


Other ways you can help: spread the voice!

If you can't donate, help us by telling the world about our campaign, the project and what we want to do for our country. Share this campaign through your social networks or e-mail contacts using the hashtag #VistaHermosaCuenta.

Visit our website and subscribe to our newsletter to keep informed.

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. and if you want to share this campaign, you  can use the @RutasConflicto tag.
 

(Tradução em português)

Vista Hermosa através dos seus olhos

 

Pelo menos 362 pessoas foram afetadas desde 1990 por minas terrestres antipessoais no município de Vista Hermosa, no estado colombiano de Meta, transformando a cidade no lugar com o maior número de vítimas por esse artefato na Colômbia.

Apesar do medo que acompanhou Vista Hermosa de perto durante décadas, agora seus habitantes querem contar a história desde seus próprios olhos, e compartilhar sua memória, como um método de superação da dor para as gerações futuras. Você também se interessa por escutar essas histórias?

Com o projeto Vista Hermosa através dos seus olhos, o meio jornalístico colombiano Rutas del Conflicto quer criar uma ponte entre as histórias dos moradores da cidade e o resto do mundo. Como parte do projeto, buscamos empoderar jovens do município, para que narrem os acontecimentos, vivências e anedotas sem intermediários, e possam difundir a informação em uma plataforma jornalística online.

A imagem de Vista Hermosa se construiu como a de um lugar violento e perigoso. O município tem sido um lugar onde o cabo de guerra entre diferentes atores armados colocou em perigo a vida dos habitantes. A disputa entre paramilitares das Autodefensas Unidas de Colombia (AUC) e das Autodefensas Campesinas de Casanare, de guerrilheiros das Farc (Forças Armadas Revolucionárias da Colômbia) e de membros das forças públicas de segurança provocou desaparecimentos, mortes e o deslocamento de centenas de pessoas.

As minas terrestres antipessoais deixaram cicatrizes físicas visíveis, mas também outras que, invisíveis, ficaram na memória dos moradores. Essas histórias, da mesma maneira que muitas minas, permanecem enterradas no esquecimento.

Queremos que você faça parte de esta tentativa de aproximar as histórias dos sobreviventes a pessoas com diferentes olhares sobre o conflito, para promover um diálogo de paz.

“O papel das histórias que queremos contar, não é para nos queixarmos ou lembrarmos dolorosamente. Na verdade, vamos demonstrar a superação que tivemos através do tempo, sem pensar nas barreiras impostas pela guerra ou pela violência, sofrida por alguns jovens aqui do município”: David Ballén, líder do Grupo Unión de Pensamiento Joven, de Vista Hermosa.

 

Por que doar? O projeto em 5 razões

  1. Vista Hermosa é o município com mais vítimas de minas antipessoais em Colômbia. Este projeto trará informações úteis sobre as consequências causadas pela explosão dos artefatos, e sobre a maneira em que a população conseguiu se sobrepor às sequelas.
  2. Para alguns moradores de Vista Hermosa, falar sobre o tema é uma forma de “tirar a amargura”, de construir memoria e, sobretudo, evitar que muitas das situações vividas permaneçam impunes.
  3. Queremos dar outro olhar ao conflito sofrido pelo município, a partir do ponto de vista de quem esteve presente na guerra que já dura 30 anos, mas sem revitimizá-los.
  4. Buscamos unir as histórias a um espaço para contá-las. Apesar do pouco acesso a recursos de narração audiovisual, um grupo de Vista Hermosa busca por iniciativa própria novas ferramentas para comunicar os acontecimentos do município da melhor forma possível. Rutas del Conflicto busca compartilhar técnicas jornalísticas com municipios afetados pelo conflito. Façamos essa ponte!
  5. Por último, a reconstrução da memória dos habitantes de Vista Hermosa será um insumo informativo valioso tanto para investigadores sobre o tema como para qualquer pessoa que queira entender a realidade colombiana. Além disso, este será um novo passo no processo de construção de paz na região.

 

Como será a plataforma?

O portal jornalístico que queremos construir com o seu apoio será um lugar de contínua alimentação com informações sobre Vista Hermosa, incluindo temas como o impacto das minas terrestres e como seus habitantes se empoderaram para superar as consequências da guerra. Através das experiências dos moradores, criaremos um espaço que torne visível a forma como eles reconstruíram suas vidas.

Serão relatados eventos que permitam uma reconstrução do conflito no local, incluindo declarações de sobreviventes de forma escrita ou audiovisual, números relacionados ao deslocamento, ao processo de desminado e a assassinatos e, finalmente, qual será o possível cenário de um pós-conflito no município.

O projeto inclui a participação da comunidade: queremos formar jovens e adultos para que adquiram ferramentas jornalísticas básicas que permitam que escrevam histórias, perfis e reportagens que serão publicados no portal.

“Eu digo sim, nós somos normais. Quem nos coloca limites a uma deficiência é a pessoa que nos observa”: Luz Dary Pineda, líder regional e sobrevivente de um acidente com minas.

 

Saiba mais sobre Rutas del Conflicto

Quem sabe sobre a guerra na Colômbia? Os cidadãos, a justiça, a mídia ou os grupos armados? A verdade é que as informações são dispersas e imprecisas. Por isso, criamos Rutas del Conflicto, uma meio online que reúne informações sobre o conflito armado na Colômbia, a partir de uma extensa base de dados e de conteúdos de jornalismo narrativo e investigativo.

Nossa plataforma permite a visualização de dados por meio de mapas e linhas do tempo, que explicam o contexto histórico e geográfico da guerra, além de realizar coberturas especiais que formam uma reconstrução histórica do conflito armado em diferentes regiões da Colômbia e de publicar depoimentos de sobreviventes da guerra.

Rutas del Conflicto surgiu da necessidade de tornar visíveis fatos do conflito armado colombiano que não tinham sido narrados pela mídia ou pelo governo do país. Publicamos, então, a primeira base de dados jornalística, que documentou 728 massacres perpetrados desde 1982.

Em 2015, criamos o projeto Yo Sobreviví, um exercício de jornalismo transmídia que envolve as comunidades que viveram a guerra de perto não só como fontes de informação, mas também na produção e verificação do conteúdo produzido.

Somos um projeto que pretende ser uma fonte de consulta para escolas, pesquisadores, meios de comunicação, organizações de vítimas e demais leitores interessados. Você tem perguntas? Contate rutasdelconflicto@gmail.com e nós ficaremos atentos para responder.

 

De que outra forma você pode ajudar?

Se você não pode doar, ajude-nos compartilhando a campanha com sua rede de contatos, e conte ao mundo o que queremos fazer pelo nosso país. Compartilhe o link via redes sociais ou e-mail, usando a hashtag #VistaHermosaCuenta.

Visite nosso site e se inscreva ao boletim, para se manter informado.

Siga Rutas del Conflicto por Facebook, Twitter e Instagram.

Queremos dar outro olhar ao conflito sofrido pelo município, a partir do ponto de vista de quem esteve presente na guerra que já dura 30 anos, mas sem revitimizá-los.
Buscamos unir as histórias a um espaço para contá-las. Apesar do pouco acesso a recursos de narração audiovisual, um grupo de Vista Hermosa busca por iniciativa própria novas ferramentas para comunicar os acontecimentos do município da melhor forma possível. Rutas del Conflicto busca compartilhar técnicas jornalísticas com municipios afetados pelo conflito. Façamos essa ponte!
Por último, a reconstrução da memória dos habitantes de Vista Hermosa será um insumo informativo valioso tanto para investigadores sobre o tema como para qualquer pessoa que queira entender a realidade colombiana. Além disso, este será um novo passo no processo de construção de paz na região.
 Como será a plataforma?O portal jornalístico que queremos construir com o seu apoio será um lugar de contínua alimentação com informações sobre Vista Hermosa, incluindo temas como o impacto das minas terrestres e como seus habitantes se empoderaram para superar as consequências da guerra. Através das experiências dos moradores, criaremos um espaço que torne visível a forma como eles reconstruíram suas vidas.Serão relatados eventos que permitam uma reconstrução do conflito no local, incluindo declarações de sobreviventes de forma escrita ou audiovisual, números relacionados ao deslocamento, ao processo de desminado e a assassinatos e, finalmente, qual será o possível cenário de um pós-conflito no município.O projeto inclui a participação da comunidade: queremos formar jovens e adultos para que adquiram ferramentas jornalísticas básicas que permitam que escrevam histórias, perfis e reportagens que serão publicados no portal.“Eu digo sim, nós somos normais. Quem nos coloca limites a uma deficiência é a pessoa que nos observa”: Luz Dary Pineda, líder regional e sobrevivente de um acidente com minas. Saiba mais sobre Rutas del ConflictoQuem sabe sobre a guerra na Colômbia? Os cidadãos, a justiça, a mídia ou os grupos armados? A verdade é que as informações são dispersas e imprecisas. Por isso, criamos Rutas del Conflicto, uma meio online que reúne informações sobre o conflito armado na Colômbia, a partir de uma extensa base de dados e de conteúdos de jornalismo narrativo e investigativo.Nossa plataforma permite a visualização de dados por meio de mapas e linhas do tempo, que explicam o contexto histórico e geográfico da guerra, além de realizar coberturas especiais que formam uma reconstrução histórica do conflito armado em diferentes regiões da Colômbia e de publicar depoimentos de sobreviventes da guerra.Rutas del Conflicto surgiu da necessidade de tornar visíveis fatos do conflito armado colombiano que não tinham sido narrados pela mídia ou pelo governo do país. Publicamos, então, a primeira base de dados jornalística, que documentou 728 massacres perpetrados desde 1982.Em 2015, criamos o projeto Yo Sobreviví, um exercício de jornalismo transmídia que envolve as comunidades que viveram a guerra de perto não só como fontes de informação, mas também na produção e verificação do conteúdo produzido.Somos um projeto que pretende ser uma fonte de consulta para escolas, pesquisadores, meios de comunicação, organizações de vítimas e demais leitores interessados. Você tem perguntas? Contate rutasdelconflicto@gmail.com e nós ficaremos atentos para responder. De que outra forma você pode ajudar?Se você não pode doar, ajude-nos compartilhando a campanha com sua rede de contatos, e conte ao mundo o que queremos fazer pelo nosso país. Compartilhe o link via redes sociais ou e-mail, usando a hashtag #VistaHermosaCuenta.Visite nosso site e se inscreva ao boletim, para se manter informado.Siga Rutas del Conflicto por Facebook, Twitter e Instagram.

story:
It has taken me ten years to write down my story. Now I am raising funds for financial support in translating it into English. "An Unlikely Rebellion" is my true story.

Hi, my name is Franciska von Koch and I was born and raised in Sweden. When I was seventeen I hitchhiked all the way through Europe to Pakistan, where I fell madly in love with a young handsome man from the Pashtun people. 

"Shahid was the son of a wealthy landowner – and was already engaged when he fell head over heels for Magdalena. In his honor-bound culture, their whirlwind romance and impromptu marriage were an affront to his fiancée’s family, a crime worthy of death." 

"Franciska von Koch paints a moving portrait of her alter ego Magdalena’s trials in the Swat Valley of northern Pakistan, the beauty of the countryside, the love of her husband and his welcoming family and the eventual collapse of their dream. Brought up in the heady laissez-faire world of the 1960s free-love era, 17-year-old Magdalena was a spiritual seeker, easily influenced by those who inspired her. Following on the coattails of the Beatles, she and a friend hitchhiked from Stockholm in 1971 in search of a guru to teach them. The goal was India, but Magdalena never got that far. In the borderlands of Northern Pakistan, she fell madly in love with a young Pashtun man, a turn of events that took both of their lives onto a whole new path..."

In the book you will find authentic letters and photographs and get insight into what a life could look like behind the walls of a conservative Muslim family, a life where women live secluded from the world. Its not a black and white story, but rather a heartfelt description of a family in an old fashioned Patriarchal system and how difficult it is to fall in love outside your own culture.

http://Read excerpts from the book: https://franciskavonkoch.com/an-unlikely-rebellion/

I feel an urgency in that as many people as possible can get to read my story. Our world today needs more understanding and perspective to know how cultural differences hinders the flow of the open heart. If I can have it translated into English, many more people can get to read it. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need 4500 USD in order for having it translated into English by a professional. In addition 500 USD will cover the expenses for the crowdfunding and the publishing of the book digitally. I will be able to present it to several international Publishers and hopefully get it published. If less funds come in I intend to find other means, maybe a loan to cover whats missing. I do intend to make this happen. 

You will get a digital copy of the book sent to you as soon as it is translated. In addition I have some gifts in mind that I like to post to you if you give me your adress.

This story has not ben told before, its unique, its true and its important, because the world we live in today is meeting many challenges concerning the confrontations of Western and Eastern cultures.

You will contribute to a greater understanding of whats happening in the world today. We live in a time when many people from honour-bound cultures and Patriarchal societies move to the Western world. Clashes are inevitable and we need greater understanding from both sides.

Risks & Challenges

I am the owner of my book so I don't need any permission for it to be translated. I am depending on the translator though, that she does the work in time. If I stumble over some technical problems, I will seek out help to overcome them. it may take a little longer to actually get the paperback in print then what I estimate, but I hope not.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still support:

  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools

"I am looking very much forward to this book, knowing Kali I know it will be interesting and a lot of fun to read." A backers comment, UK

"I am fully confident that her book will be very exciting, as she is a very alive and open person, full of multi-facetted experiences, wisdom and also... she has a good sense of humour. A backers comment, France

story:
This is necessary technology.

Are you passionate about politics, but lack the time and tools to get involved? The Activist App is for you. 

Like a dating app, The Activist App allows its users to build political profiles which are used to calculate compatibility ratings with local and federal legislators, pieces of legislation, nonprofit organizations, petitions, and protests. Users receive notifications on bills they care about and can contact their legislators directly from the app. 

The Activist App Project is a budding nonprofit organization headquartered in Baltimore, MD aimed at encouraging and empowering the public to take a more active, informed role in local and federal legislation. 

Find out more at www.activistapp.com


The Impact

A 2014 Princeton study found that "the preferences of the average American appear to have only a minuscule, near-zero, statistically non-significant impact upon public policy.” This is outrageous. This lack of influence is largely due to the steady decrease in the public's involvement in politics which, according to a 2006 Pew Research Center study, is mostly attributed to a lack of political knowledge. 

There are dozens of publicly accessible legislation databases. The trouble, though, is that very few people taking the time to look at them. Staying politically engaged is important, but it's a hassle; we understand. It's time-consuming. It can be really confusing. And it's boring. 

The Activist App Project is changing all that by: 

  • Tailoring legislative data to the interest of our users
  • Offering compatibility ratings to politicians, bills, nonprofits, petitions, and protests based on user-created political profiles 
  • Offering summaries and non-legalese translations of bills 
  • Notifying our users of new bills, updates to bills, upcoming elections, petitions, and protests 
  • Deploying this all in an easy-to-navigate mobile application 
  • Allowing our users to contact their legislators directly from the app

We have been disconnected from our legislators for far too long. But with this technology, there is no excuse. 

For more details, visit www.activistapp.com/how


What We Need & What You Get

With this, our first fundraising campaign, we are asking for $30,000. This will cover administrative and programming costs to get an MVP produced by April of 2016. 

To thank all of our wonderful donors, we're offering a series of perks:

  • $5 - Thank You! - You'll get our sincerest gratitude and a personalized Thank You note from the Activist App Team. You'll be invited to test the beta version of the app. And we'll pass you some good karma points as well.

  • $25 - T-Shirt! - You’ll get everything at the previous level, plus an Activist App T-Shirt and a shout-out on our Social Media pages!

  • $50 - Supporter! - You'll get everything at the previous levels, plus your name and link to your personal website or blog on the Supporters page of our Website and App!

  • $100 - Puppet Shout Out! - You'll get everything at the previous levels, plus a personalized video of our puppets thanking you!

  • $300 - Business Supporter! - You'll get everything at the previous levels, plus your logo and a link to your business or project’s website on the Supporters page of our Website and App!

  • $1,500 An Actual Puppet! - You’ll get everything at the previous levels, plus your choice of any of the actual puppets featured in our campaign video!

  • $3,000 Producer! - You'll get to be part of the ride. Be a part of making the Activist App - review design mockups, help brand the site, and shape the message. Be one of the first to see it when it's ready to be released and forever feel our thanks.

If we surpass our goal of $30,000, we will have the funds to more quickly grow our team, more quickly launch the app, and more quickly spread the app to all 50 states. If we are unable to meet our goal, we will use the money collected here to cover administrative costs while applying for grants. 


Other Ways You Can Help

At this stage of the game, there are 3 other BIG ways you can help:

  1. Share. Help spread the word on social media about what we're doing and the kinds of support we need. 
  2. Volunteer. Help us reach out out to the public about our project. 
  3. Suggest. Don't keep those great ideas to yourself! We really appreciate your thoughts.
Find out more at www.activistapp.com/ways-to-help

story:
Note: The main subject of this project is similar to those that might offend some readers. If you have conservative views or disagree with alternative lifestyles, we recommend you do not continue reading.


Children book´s specifics:

Languages: English  

                        Spanish

Pages: 

Approximately 200 - 300 (pending proof reading, editing and illustrations).

What is Embracing Xolo?

Embracing Xolo is a children´s book where the main story is of a border collie mix called Joe who discovers, through a series of adventures and interactions, that he just has more in common with pigs. This causes him to have a crisis that forces everyone to re-think what it is to be born one way and feel like you should have been born differently.

How is this done?

When Joe grows up he starts having difficulty as he is always hot and wishes he was born furless. He begins to enjoy mud-pits, potatoes, and other non doggy things. Various characters will find themselves torn between what they consider appropriate, as well as not wanting to see their loved one struggling in deep unhappiness.

Illustration draft:


Chapters:

Types of books: 

                                  Electronic book  

                                  Soft cover 

                                  Hard cover

Number of illustrations: Estimate is 20 to 30.

People involved in project (at the moment):

                                   Writing team 3 (writer, proof reader and editor)

                                   Design team 2 (illustrator and interior designer)

Fund distribution:

Why create Embracing Xolo?

The book is multi-layered to promote dog rescue and adoption, as well as solidarity, friendship, tolerance and love. This is a stepping stone book. That means that it helps children ages 8 to 12, understand how being different can be very painful and why sometimes needing to change is essential in order to live happy, healthy lives. 

In a few words: Why a wonderful doggy finds himself struggling to try to be like others, and liked by others.

This book wishes to assist in clearing up misunderstandings of what it is to want to be different, and how hard it is for others to understand the journey some have to follow.  Most importantly, children who are themselves questioning aspects of their own identity, need to find someone who also has gone through this path.

Why is your contribution necessary?

The book´s story has already been written. However, due to the sensitive nature of the central premise, we need to go outside normal financing as many don´t want to be associated with a project that might not be considered politically correct.

Funding will be used mostly for interior design, illustrations and book distribution.

Previous works done by team:

Book release date (premier): November 16th, 2016.

Challenges to overcome.

Previous book projects had two main challenges. 

  1. Layout. After created a final version of Fancy Furever,  we discovered that it was un-compatible when converting it to a digital form to upload to various platforms, so with Xolo the layout will be designed from the beginning to be able to upload well, and to easily print at the publishers that use a predesign machinery. Also the layout will be more compatible with various distribution standards so there are more options regarding distribution channels.
  1. Marketing is important based on conveying a message. As the story of Embracing Xolo is already written, from the start we can make sure the material sends a positive correct message and communicates well with the audience it was written for.

Risks:

Any original work is a risk. That is why people chose just to recycle previous work.

This topic might backfire as people think children are too susceptible or need to be protected from  certain subjects. But in our time, with large groups of people changing and becoming who they were meant to be, this book begins conversation and understanding about the changes in our world.

Rewards:

Producing original work.

Creating work for creative and artistic individuals. 

Getting around the constant no´s people always give to risky, non PC artistic projects.

Audience (children´s ages): 8-12

Book measurements: 200 mm by 130 mm.

Copy-right licence (country): Canada

Approved sales outlets:

                                   Amazon (soft copies)

                                   Itunes (electronic copies)

                                   Kindle (electronic copies)

story:
Burning Alexandria by A.P. Runke

Tagline: Alexandria burned. Salem burned. Dahlia will burn.

Excerpt: A deep black smoke starts to fill the crystal ball and Dahlia wonders where Madame Gordenia hid the switch and how the smoke doesn’t stain the orb. Soon the crystal is filled, an opaque black and the surface is a weird matte, Dahlia cannot even see her reflection. Confused she looks away from it, blinks a few times in relief, before looking up to ask Madam Gordenia if that was supposed to happen. The words, however, die in her throat.

  Upon making eye contact with Madame Gordenia Dahlia’s breath freezes in her chest. Madame Gordenia’s eyes are glazed over white. Dahlia cannot make out even her irises let alone her pupils. Still the eyes seem to be rolling in their sockets as if watching a tennis match in zero gravity. Dahlia gulps, finding her voice.

  “Madame Gordenia?” It’s barely a squeak in the room. Madame Gordenia’s eyes stop roving and seem fixated on Dahlia’s face. Dahlia bangs her head on the back of her chair as she jumps in surprise. Madame Gordenia speaks. Her voice is low and grinds like tires on gravel.

  “Alexandria burned.” She moans. She takes a deep breath.

  “Salem burned!” It’s a shout and Dahlia is frozen in her seat. Madame Gordenia lifts her hand pointing at the crystal ball.

  “Dahlia will burn.” It’s a whisper. Before Dahlia can say a thing her eyes are drawn to the ball. In the smoke a face appears, the smoke coloring their eyes and pouring from their mouth. Suddenly the small flickering candles burst forth in flames, reaching the cloth draped ceiling. Dahlia screams throwing her arms above her head. The face in the ball yells, the sentence echoing in the now burning room.

I am A.P. Runke and I write. I have characters that live inside my head and I want you to read about them and breathe life into them. That is why I am doing this. I am publishing my first book and I need your help to do it. Through this process I am depending on the power of the internet to create a readership for my YA/Supernatural/Historical novel. I've seen fandoms form from thin air, help me create one and make my book a best seller.

What I Need & What You Get

The grand total to Indie Publish this book and so well will be about $3,000:

  • $1000 will go towards editing services, $1665 goes toward making the book something physical in your hands or on your e-reader, the rest goes to paying for marketing to get the book noticed through ads, selling tables at pop culture conventions, and printing and shipping of promo materials.
  • For just about every donation amount there is a perk for you! From $1 to $100, at the very least your name is in my book as a contributor to making this a reality, at the most a hardcover book signed by me sits in your hands along with a free e-reader copy, an extra signed paperback for you or a friend, and a journal done in the style of the mysterious Grimoire in the book! Handmade by me, the author!
  • If I don't get the full funds for my goal what I do have will go towards editing and sending converting to e-reader format only for the book. At the end of the day no matter what I make you get Burning Alexandria in your hands.

Why Support Burning Alexandria?

Because book lovers rock the world. I should know I am one. I live by the idea of writing the book you want to read. By supporting this campaign you have helped another book be released into the world, helped characters become real, this campaign brings about the best thing an author can give a reader, a story. Why not give a buck or two?

Rocks and Hard Places

The biggest challenge to attaining this goal is money. Such is the fate of us all right? But with even the tiniest help from you I can make this book a reality.

Beyond just supporting my campaign to get this book into the hands of readers I will need word of mouth. Or in this case your Facebook feeds, your blog posts, your twitter feeds, dashboards, Goodreads you name it. I want Burning Alexandria to be a book people put on their wishlists. This will be a group effort. I will be giving it my all but Rome wasn't built in a day or by one man!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Use social media to share my campaign! Like my Facebook page and follow my author blog for book deals and more! I'm a reader like you bringing you love of all that is or could be between the covers of a book!

story:
In 2016, I lost the great love of my life. That was the genesis for this Back From the Dead book project. In the deep pain of this loss, as I tried to deal and heal, I started writing my story. Along the way, I met others who had also lost great loves and had suffered mightily, were still hurting. I told each of them about my project. I invited them to add their voices and make it our project by sharing their stories in the book as well. Most of them said "Yes." We all saw that sharing our own stories might bring us some healing and help others in the same boat. It was cathartic for all of us, but in the end, it was illuminating and healing.

It's our sincere hope that our stories will inspire, comfort, reassure, encourage and guide others going through similar troubles. We hope they'll even bring a few laughs, along with the tears. 

Short Summary

Okay, who am I, what's this project all about, why do we need help, and why should you care?

  • David Nyro is the name, as in "pen name." (Todd, to my family and friends.) I am a father, brother, writer, musician, artist, and an incurable romantic who has made a career out of choosing the wrong partners. I'm also no box of chocolates myself. HA! My background is in broadcasting, marketing, music, nonprofit fundraising, and love.
  • What is Back From the Dead? It's a book, with stories from real folks, observations on life, ideas and solutions for relationships, being single, how no dog should ever be smaller than a squirrel, and re-imagining society. Oh, yeah. That. It's also a graphic novel in parts, with art by well-known British artist, Dylan Riley. This is a classic D.I.Y. (Do It Yourself) project.
  • The IndieGoGo Back From the Dead campaign seeks to raise $10,000 from lovely patron saints, like you, to pay our artist, Dylan, pay for a professional editor - absolutely essential for any author -  and help underwrite the book's production and marketing, and my efforts to bring this unique book to the marketplace.
  • Why feel, why care, why invest? If you've ever loved and lost, you have something very much in common with this book, the people in this book, and the very reason it was created. And the reason we're putting it out in the world: to help people, and to help society. Our dream and goal is to have a very real impact on people's lives, both in the moment and long-term. We passionately believe that our stories of love, loss, grief, anger, fear, recovery, redemption, grace, and more, will resonate with pretty much everyone, and, we hope, help them in a myriad of ways, from comforting them to inspiring them. Here are some of the topics, followed in parentheses by some of the chapter/section titles:
  • There's tested, real-world guidance on how to be a little wiser when it comes to choosing a partner (Red Flags, Red Herrings, and Red Questions, Our Roman Ways, Entrance Strategies, Fool Me Once, On the Spectrum, Golden Dancers) 
  • Ground Truths (True love has no past tense, What Love is Not, Ego=Perception=Reality, Gateway Love, The Bald Truth, Partner with a Parakeet, Rwanda and Forgiveness, Not So Great, Expectations, Timing, Luck, Genes, and Control, Just dropped in to see what condition my Unconditional was in, The Currency of Conditional Love)
  • Getting through a break-up (Zombie or Not Zombie, The Year of Crying Dangerously, When your ex-lover literally gives you curtains as a parting gift, The "Throw People Away" Years, Schwinn vs Millennium Falcon, The Stranger Beside You)
  • Being Single in a Couple Society (Atom Bomb vs Equal Rights, Married to Myself, 47, and counting, Benefits of Being Single, Alone doesn't mean Lonely, Liberated, Single Mindfulness)
  • A Love Supreme (We teach Fear, why not Love? Einstein Knew a Few Things, Change the World)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise $10,000 to bring this book to the world. Here's the breakdown:
  • $4,000 - $5,000 for the art
  • $2,000 - $3,000 for a professional editor
  • $4,000 - $5,000+ for website, book production, marketing, pr, book tour, etc.
  • We project this project, when all is said and done, will cost more than $10,000, but $10,000 gets us out the door, and down the road quite a ways. It might even be enough, but we also know that things invariably almost always cost more, and take longer, than one thinks.

What You Get, if you invest:

  • $1,000, and up, you get a limited edition, numbered and hand-signed, original artwork of the cover by UK artist, Dylan Riley. (See Dylan's art, above.) You'll also get two special BFTD T-shirts, featuring Dylan's haunting zombiedacious art and a special quote from our book, like "Love has no past tense." You'll wear it proudly, true believer! A copy of our book, autographed by the author and the artist, and, unless you want to be anonymous, you'll be thanked, by name, in the book. Other special perks to be announced. Our eternal gratitude, of course!
  • $500 to $999, You'll also get two special BFTD T-shirts, featuring Dylan's haunting zombiedacious art and a special quote from our book, like "Love has no past tense." You'll wear it proudly, true believer! A copy of our book, autographed by the author and the artist, and, unless you want to be anonymous, you'll be thanked, by name, in the book. Other special perks to be announced. Our eternal gratitude, of course!
  • $200 to $499, a copy of our transforming tome, autographed by the author and the artist, and, unless you want to be anonymous, you'll be thanked, by name, in the book. Other special perks to be announced. Our eternal gratitude, of course!
  • $25 to $199, you will be thanked by name in the book, unless you wish to remain anonymous. Our eternal gratitude, of course!

Your Impact

  • You absolutely WILL have an impact on this project. Your dollars (and word-of-mouth) WILL help get it to the marketplace. I can't promise a specific impact, or the breadth of the impact, on that marketplace. It will all depend on who reads it, and how many. (Oh, Oprah?) This book has the potential to make people feel better, lift their spirits, help them heal, ask better questions, make better choices and decisions about love, partners, work, career, life. It might literally change some lives, for the better. If the Love SupreME part takes root and grows wings, legs and fins, and becomes the reality I envision, we could literally change an entire generation, and future generations, when it comes to identity, consciousness, love, relationships, and our very society. Paradigm shift. Yes, this is tremendously bold and ambitious, but it's something that's actually possible. That's the Big Picture possibility. It's not world peace and curing cancer, but it might be as significant. And, who knows, maybe there'll be a movie! :-) 

Risks & Challenges

  • What are the risks? The biggest risk is the book will never be finished. I might be hit by a beer truck. The love of my life might return and necessitate the shelving of this book. However, I have a greater chance of winning the lottery. As we all know, and as is touched on in my book, lovers rarely, if ever, return. But I mention in the interest of transparency. I might also be taken out by a meteorite. Another risk for me is that the book will do a big belly flop. It'll still be created, and your investment will have done its job, but we won't have the outcome we all hope for. My personal sales goal for the book is 5 million copies sold. I have that in writing on my giant post-it pad. Gotta dream BIG, right? 
  • Challenges for me will be staying focused, disciplined, and in pursuit. Writing a book is a marathon. And finishing it is only half of that marathon, albeit the most important part. I work on the book every single day, seven days a week. I write at least an hour a day, and some days, up to five hours. A word of advice: never write a book! HA! But it's going to be great when it's all done! Other challenges: finding, and funding, a professional editor to edit the book. (Your support will make this possible.) Finding a literary agent (luckily, good, reputable literary agents do not charge writers; they are paid when they secure a publishing deal) to pitch the book to a publisher; finding a publisher, marketing the book, which will include finding, and funding, a good pr firm to help promote the book.  The good news is that I actually enjoy, even get a kick from, marketing, promotion, etc. I know, I'm weird that way. Most people like creating, but not marketing, or vice versa. So, this is an advantage for me, and for all of us. 
  • FYI: I do have a business plan, which includes a marketing plan, for our book. I have created several business plans and marketing plans over the years, including my ten plus years as the prime fundraiser at the hunger relief nonprofit I worked at, Northwest Harvest. I also do all the marketing and promotion for my music career. Did the same for my band in the 90's. I have extensive experience in marketing, communications/media, public relations, promotions, events, writing, journalism, etc.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • As I mention in our video, helping us spread the word is invaluable. Maybe you know Jeff Bezos? Hee hee. Sharing this opportunity with your friends, family, co-workers, in person or via social media, is incredibly valuable, desired, needed, appreciated, effective, etc. One never knows where it might lead, what it might trigger. 
  • IndieGoGo has algorithms! That means, their little bots are watching all these IndieGoGo campaigns. Depending on how many folks come to my little zombie soiree, and/or donate, our campaign might end up being one of their featured campaigns. If that happens, then thousands of eyeballs will see it, and that could mean more dollars for our book!!! Many hands make light work, right?

story:
Mein Name ist Houssam Hamade. Ich bin Journalist, Sozialwissenschaftler und Türsteher. Beim Schreiben meines ersten Buches „Sich Prügeln – 18 Geschichten aus dem Leben“ war es mir wichtig, möglichst viel Freiheit zu haben. Darum veröffentliche ich bei Books on Demand. Das heißt, ich mache alles selbst, gemeinsam mit Freunden. Zusätzlich brauche ich Eure Unterstützung.

Mein Ziel ist es 800 Euro zu sammeln. Damit kann ich Onlinewerbung schalten, Plakate drucken und den ersten Satz Bücher bezahlen. Als Perks bekommt ihr signierte Exemplare, Webinare und persönliche Lesungen. Außerdem werdet ihr in der Ruhmeshalle auf meiner Homepage genannt.

Ein Buch wie dieses gibt es bisher noch nicht. Wer mir das Gegenteil beweist, bekommt eins der Bücher geschenkt. Es ist eine Fundgrube für alle, die sich dafür interessieren, was uns als Menschen ticken lässt. Außerdem ist es sehr unterhaltsam. Mit eurer Unterstützung kann ich damit Erfolg haben und weitere Bücher dieser Art schreiben. Die geplante Reihe heißt „Geschichten aus dem Leben“. Darin erzählen Interviewte ihre Extremerlebnisse. Das Nächste Buch soll „Arschloch“ heißen, und von Augenblicken erzählen, in der die Interviewten sich entschieden haben, sehr egoistisch zu sein.

Das größte Hindernis für den Erfolg des Buches ist die fehlende Reichweite. Hinter mir steht kein großer Verlag. Darum brauche ich euch.  Ihr könnt mit einer Spende helfen, aber auch, indem ihr mir auf Facebook folgt, Freunden davon erzählt oder indem ihr meine Beiträge teilt.

Hier findet Ihr mich online: 
https://houssamhamade.net/
https://www.facebook.com/Hamadehoussam

Beim Schreiben meines ersten Buches „Sich Prügeln – 18 Geschichten aus dem Leben“ war es mir wichtig, möglichst viel Freiheit zu haben. Darum veröffentliche ich bei Books on Demand. Das heißt, ich mache alles selbst, gemeinsam mit Freunden. Zusätzlich brauche ich Eure Unterstützung.Mein Ziel ist es 800 Euro zu sammeln. Damit kann ich Onlinewerbung schalten, Plakate drucken und den ersten Satz Bücher bezahlen. Als Perks bekommt ihr signierte Exemplare, Webinare und persönliche Lesungen. Außerdem werdet ihr in der Ruhmeshalle auf meiner Homepage genannt.Ein Buch wie dieses gibt es bisher noch nicht. Wer mir das Gegenteil beweist, bekommt eins der Bücher geschenkt. Es ist eine Fundgrube für alle, die sich dafür interessieren, was uns als Menschen ticken lässt. Außerdem ist es sehr unterhaltsam. Mit eurer Unterstützung kann ich damit Erfolg haben und weitere Bücher dieser Art schreiben. Die geplante Reihe heißt „Geschichten aus dem Leben“. Darin erzählen Interviewte ihre Extremerlebnisse. Das Nächste Buch soll „Arschloch“ heißen, und von Augenblicken erzählen, in der die Interviewten sich entschieden haben, sehr egoistisch zu sein.Das größte Hindernis für den Erfolg des Buches ist die fehlende Reichweite. Hinter mir steht kein großer Verlag. Darum brauche ich euch.  Ihr könnt mit einer Spende helfen, aber auch, indem ihr mir auf Facebook folgt, Freunden davon erzählt oder indem ihr meine Beiträge teilt.Hier findet Ihr mich online: https://houssamhamade.net/https://www.facebook.com/Hamadehoussam

story:
'Watercolours in a Second' by Ian Macdonald-Smith

Ian has been a professional photographer since 1987 and this is his 10th book. He has also been an active environmentalist on his home island of Bermuda, co-founding three NGOs: protecting Bermuda's reef fish; saving its open spaces; and creating an umbrella environmental organization. Surrounded by ocean, the only fresh water available for centuries was by collected rainfall so his awareness of the vital importance of this precious resource, and the delicate balance required to maintain it, is acute and also reflected in this book.

‘Watercolours in a Second’ is a book of 250 abstract photographs of water reflections all taken at 1/250 of a second to create one second of exposure time. Taken over 25 years from 1987-2012, this book is a chronological journey through 22 countries starting and ending with Bermuda.

‘Watercolours in a Second’ also introduces a new genre of art called Self-Expressionism; inviting viewers to share their genuine subconscious and conscious interpretation of the shapes, faces, forms and patterns in each photograph. The photographs are not manipulated and are reality so each interpretation has validity, revealing multiple levels in each image. Self-Expressionism becomes a fun way to explore abstract imagery.

Quotes about art and creativity accompany each photograph, from the ancient Greeks through to present day; providing perspectives about art from different ages and temperaments.

Link to the 250 photographs: https://imacsmith.smugmug.com/Books/WATERCOLOUR...

Link to photographs of the actual editions: https://imacsmith.smugmug.com/Books/Watercolour...

Size:             370mm x 297mm (14.5” x 11.7”) 286 pages

Weight:        3.7kg

Limited Editions: Gold Edition: 250 books, each with a 20"x30" archival photograph

                                  Silver Edition: 500 books, each with a 11"x14" archival photograph

                                  Bronze Edition: 1000 books, each with a 8"x10" archival photograph                    

'Watercolours in a Second has been printed and is being shipped now so there is no risk for any contributor. The delivery to customers is expected to be by the latter part of November.

Top quality printing was vital and this has been achieved with great success - the books are beautifully printed and bound.

In addition, the photographs that come with each of the Gold, Silver and Bronze Editions are printed with archival ink on Hahnemühle's Nature Line paper. Hahnemūhle is the oldest paper manufacturer in the world and also the most environmentally conscious - all of the water they use goes back to the same source as uncontaminated as it comes in.

Any contribution keeps Ian's creativity flowing. The book is fully funded already and this campaign offers an opportunity to get one of the special editions for a significant discount - the prints alone retail higher.

This book is also an appropriate way to introduce Self-Expressionism and now that so many of us have smartphones anyone can actively practice. Please help make this book a ripple effect of active participation in Self-Expressionism.

*First Edition shipping is 25 pounds

story:
The Story of my Book

When I was a child, I used to have a repeated dream: I was walking around a castle. I could open any door. I had my own room. I knew I lived there. I saw members of my family. I had an unhappy childhood and I was raised by a mother with a difficult character. Despite my hard life, every evening I would go to bed hoping to dream of that beautiful place. Over the years, the castle stopped coming into my dreams. But the memory of it remained with me. I lived through a lot and I learnt a lot. I was not allowed to dream, my life was supposed to follow other people’s unrealised dreams. Years later, I managed to catch up with my own hopes. Journalism and teaching gave me a sense of self-importance. I interwove my life with my characters’ lives and I think I managed to write a good story for my readers; a story that tells a lot. According to history, everyone is given a chance if they want it. History gives everyone the opportunity to think whether they feel happy where they are and whether it is time for them to fly away. History searches through the soul and takes out embarrassing moments when we have made mistakes or we have been embarrassed. I collected souls and personages from my life-time adventure. As weird as this book is, it is real too, because all of us allow a bit of unreality into our lives, one way or the other. As long as it comes with a dose of happiness. Who would not open their door to happiness? Right?

I know that almost all of us promise a lot of things at the end of each year. Some say that next year they will be a new person. Others make big promises to shed bad habits. But when the time comes to actually do it, we stay the same. It is true that we spend the first few days of the New Year saying good-bye to our old selves but, the following week, we are back to our old routines and comforts.  So we go round in circles making the same or bigger promises. But how could we actually fulfil them? Is change possible or are we going to remain the ‘I will’ person for the rest of our lives? This book is the beginning. It is the first of a series which will give us the opportunity to think about how to make a successful change. Some of my characters managed this, others stubbornly refused, believing in their rightness and perfection or in the fact that others always make mistakes.

 

You would like to read this book:

-if you like romantic stories;

-if you like travel stories;

-if you wish a change about yourself;

Everyone would like to bring back some part of their past. This is usually that part which is irretrievably lost, which makes us sad and is part of an unreasonable past of mischiefs. We have often heard the moralising words: ‘Don’t look back! There is no way back!’ But only if… Then we would be able to say, ‘Hello, my yesterday’s tomorrow!’ This book teaches us to travel fearlessly on the bridge connecting the past and the future, to value the past and to grab the present with both hands.

About the Author

I was born in Bulgaria; a country with four seasons, a sea and the big Danube River. My childhood was spent there. It was the time of cheap lemonade, outdoor games and 1-channel TV. I had the good fortune to become a teacher. I got in touch with many children’s souls. I was a teacher, a counsellor and a pacifier – everything I did not get in my childhood. Then I spent long years seeking justice and good. My work as a journalist taught me, first-hand, that no good deed goes unpunished. Now they call me an emigrant writer. And I am not just an ordinary emigrant. My heart emigrated years ago and when my wounded soul did the same, my body had no other choice but follow.

Two years ago, I arrived in the magical German town of Lindau, just to spend a month. It was supposed to be a creative holiday. I finished one of my novels then. I am sure that everyone who comes here for the first time feels like they are in a fairy tale. Gradually, I realised that I could let this fairy tale into my life. This has been the case since then, as I stayed here.

 

What do I need and what you will receive?

I need money for:

-To translate a book from Bulgarian to English;

-Editor and design;

-Print and promotional campaign;

-An e-book execution;

 

Exclusive prizes:

-Autograph and a letter by the author;

-You will be the first to read my reviews book giving the opportunity to send a feedback to me;

-Your feedback and comments could make a change in the way how the events in the next book will happen;

-A real medallion, like the one, turning the story of my heroes around;

-Pocket book - self-teacher of positivism and success.

-Handmade gifts (unique ones), personally made by me and a message.

 

Risks & Challenges

If 60% of the amount is collected, only an e-book will be published. If the full amount is collected, the book will also be published on paper.

 

Other ways to help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.

 

Thank you so much for all of your support!

Olga O’Bret

The Intellectualist and other publishers are creating a new online platform focused on current events and community.  We need your help to finish it though.

We are you asking you to donate at least $2 (USD) so we can finish developing the platform.  The platform being developed will be called 'the Bright Network'.

The Bright Network will focus on community and discussion of current events, particularly politics and science.  Members will eventually earn rewards for engaging with the platform.

Without your help, finishing this platform could take more than a year.  However, with your contribution, we can finish developing the Bright Network by the holiday season.

Please help us on this journey by donating.

story:
Womby’s School for Wayward Witches—In Audiobook format!

Hi, I’m Sarina Dorie, fantasy and science fiction author—but I can also add mystery, romance and humor to that list. I am both a traditional and self-published author. I’ve sold over 150 short stories, 40 novels, and I love stories. A few of my favorite things include: gluten-free brownies (not necessarily glutton-free), Star Trek, steampunk aesthetics, fairies, Severus Snape, Captain Jack Sparrow, and Mr. Darcy.

By day, I’m a public school art teacher, artist, belly dance performer and instructor, copy editor, fashion designer, event organizer and probably a few other things. By night, I write. As you might imagine, this leaves little time for sleep.

The last fundraiser I remember taking part of was the school jog-a-thon in sixth grade. I now am about to ask for assistance with another, though one of my own making.

Here are a few reasons I am enthusiastic about producing an audiobook of my not-so-cozy witch mystery series and why I think it is important.

  • Witch-loving readers who enjoy a magical experience will have an opportunity to listen to a series about a magical boarding school through a teacher’s perspective in audio format.
  • The vision impaired can listen to these fun witchy mysteries.
  • Like many of my readers, I love listening to audiobooks. People have busy lives and often we wouldn’t be able to squeeze in our passion for reading if we couldn’t listen to books in the car, while exercising, washing the dishes, waiting in a long line at the DMV, and while doing a quiet activity like using a jackhammer on concrete. (Just kidding! I was just checking to see if you were still reading.) This is a medium for storytelling that I passionately believe in and want to make available to others.
  • You will be helping me plant seeds in the minds of the masses what it is like to be an art teacher in a public-school setting. (Did you really think those scenes of Clarissa teaching in overcrowded classrooms, budget cuts, or teachers who used her to babysit her students were really fictional?)

What You Get Out of This

Let’s talk about some things you get out of funding this project a.k.a. the fun part of this fundraiser.

  • I have some unique perks (which I think of as thank-you presents) that will be appreciated by fans of the series! I have an e-book available only through this fundraiser called: Ghoulish Charms, the first book in the Vega Bloodmire Cozy Witch Mystery Series (which I managed to make PG-rated and completely free of sex and swear words while keeping Vega’s snark intact), original artwork from the book covers that I designed myself, and some fun witchy gifts.
  • Also, I would like to offer the first book or books produced as a free gift to contributors prior to being published on Audible.
  • I have perks I only offer to fans who are already on my newsletter as additional incentives that are not open to the public, so stay tuned on those details. If you aren't signed up, see the link below.
  • Rest assured, if I do not meet the benchmark of being able to produce one book in the series, I will hold onto the proceeds until I gather enough proceeds for the first book.

 

Details and Reasons Funding is Needed

Here are some details about the project so you understand the need for fundraising.

  • If I can raise $2000, I can produce the first book in the series. This will take 2-4 months for the narrator to record, edit, for me to listen to and make changes, then for those changes to be implemented, and for the digital packaging and distribution onto Audible or another retailer.
  •  If I raise $5000, that will help me produce the first and second book in the series. Those are the shortest books in the series.
  • The third book requires a narrator who can handle all the accents—and there are a lot. Also, it has to be someone willing to read my weird Red affinity magic scenes. I’ve already been told that tattoo scene is waaaaay too risqué for some. I have an actress in mind and have been in discussion with her, but I’m a lot like Vega Bloodmire; I have champagne tastes on a school-teacher salary. The narrator will cost $5000 for that book alone. She is very much worth it.

That means I need to raise $10,000 for the first three books.

  •  My tax accountant told me to reality check myself before I wreck myself.  I'm not a non-profit. I have to pay taxes on this income earned. So she reminded me to keep that in mind when making plans, and when collecting and spending funds.
  • Producing an audiobook is costly and all that money is needed upfront. Royalties accumulate slowly. I have a day job as a school teacher. There is no way I can afford to produce an eighteen-book series of audiobooks. That means I need assistance making this dream a reality, one book at a time. In order to do so, I need help getting started with the first books.
  • People have been asking me for over a year, “Do you have an audiobook of this series?” or “When are you going to make an audiobook?” or the worst question, “If it is too expensive, why don’t you just purchase the sound equipment, learn to edit audio files, practice all the accents in your spare time, and narrate it yourself?”

Ugh! Just because I can imagine Felix Thatch’s voice in my head, doesn’t mean I can speak with a received pronunciation British accent. And I’ve been told that my French accent sounds Russian. Let’s not get started on my luddite skills and unwillingness to part with my precious writing time to learn a new skill. And have I ever mentioned I am very much like Clarissa? Sometimes my computer stops working when I am near, but it works perfectly fine for my husband who doesn’t believe in magic (because he is a Morty). I don’t want to accidentally blow up all that expensive sound equipment.

 

 

The Impact

With your contribution, I am going to be able to do the following:

  • I will produce audiobooks and enrich the lives of others through literacy. Or at the very least, entertain them with fun witchy reads.
  • Many people depend on audiobooks for their source of literature due to preference, literacy level, or vision impairment. Your contribution will help support that.
  • Tardy Bells and Witches' Spells, the first book in the series has sold over 10,000 copies and has been an Amazon bestseller. Though success in Kindle format doesn’t guarantee audiobook success, it does mean there is a good chance that it will be listened to.
  • I have a track record for working hard and being professional in my goals. On average, I have put out one book a month for over a year. Some of them were 30,000 words and some were 120,000 words but a book a month.
  • Help me make a living doing what I love—art and writing. The picture below sums up my life effectively on average.

Risks & Challenges

Though listening to audiobooks is my preferred method of reading, this is the first time I have created an audiobook. One of my friends who is an author produced an audiobook a year ago and has remarked that making an audiobook killed his soul. That’s my biggest risk. I would like to avoid that.

For you as a reader, your biggest risk is investing in a project and then hating a narrator’s voice and not wanting to listen to the book. As an audiobook listener myself, I know how that is. There are times I have listened to a book and the female voices are too high and shrill or the male voices sound forced and dopey. The accents might be horrible or there might be other problems that make a listener cringe.

 

Here are somethings I have in place to help me finish this project and alleviate those worries.

  • I recently attended a workshop by an audiobook actor about what to look for when hiring audiobook narrators so that I don’t fall into newbie producer/author mistakes.
  • I am carefully auditioning narrators. I want to make sure I have someone who has a calming voice with and even pitch, can do male and female voices, is able to capture Clarissa’s voice, Felix Thatch’s received pronunciation accent, and all the other numerous accents.
  • I am going to be working with professionals who have made audio recordings before, who I select based on skill and competency. Because these actors are sought-after professionals, they might have other projects in line ahead of me or it might take a while to edit, but I know it will be worth it. I have champagne tastes, remember?
  • I will make sure my narrator can pronounce the important words that are genre specific (such as glamour), regionally specific to the character’s dialect (Clarissa is from Oregon, therefore she doesn’t say Ory-gone; she says Ory-gun), and specific to my story and world (like the word Womby’s).
  • I put out a newsletter 2-4 times a month to keep readers updated, so you will always know where the project is at developmentally.
  • Summer vacation. I’m a school teacher. If life gets crazy September through June and this project is taking a long time, I do have two and a half months of semi-uninterrupted time to devote to this project—if it takes that long to produce.

Some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Other ways you can get involved in supporting the Womby’s series:

  • Order a book or e-book on Amazon.
  • Get a free book if you are enrolled in Kindle Unlimited. Authors get paid for every page read in KU.
  • Leave an honest review on Amazon. This helps create author credibility, boosts ranking, and tells readers what to expect.
  • Share the books with a friend, book club, or on social media.
  • Sign up for my mailing list. That way I can keep you up to date on my progress, new releases, and when I have giveaways: http://eepurl.com/dEd4oL
  • Share on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sarina.dorie1/videos/2...

If I can raise $2000, I can produce the first book in the series. This will take 2-4 months for the narrator to record, edit, for me to listen to and make changes, then for those changes to be implemented, and for the digital packaging and distribution onto Audible or another retailer.
 If I raise $5000, that will help me produce the first and second book in the series. Those are the shortest books in the series.
The third book requires a narrator who can handle all the accents—and there are a lot. Also, it has to be someone willing to read my weird Red affinity magic scenes. I’ve already been told that tattoo scene is waaaaay too risqué for some. I have an actress in mind and have been in discussion with her, but I’m a lot like Vega Bloodmire; I have champagne tastes on a school-teacher salary. The narrator will cost $5000 for that book alone. She is very much worth it.
That means I need to raise $10,000 for the first three books.
 My tax accountant told me to reality check myself before I wreck myself.  I'm not a non-profit. I have to pay taxes on this income earned. So she reminded me to keep that in mind when making plans, and when collecting and spending funds.
Producing an audiobook is costly and all that money is needed upfront. Royalties accumulate slowly. I have a day job as a school teacher. There is no way I can afford to produce an eighteen-book series of audiobooks. That means I need assistance making this dream a reality, one book at a time. In order to do so, I need help getting started with the first books.
People have been asking me for over a year, “Do you have an audiobook of this series?” or “When are you going to make an audiobook?” or the worst question, “If it is too expensive, why don’t you just purchase the sound equipment, learn to edit audio files, practice all the accents in your spare time, and narrate it yourself?”
Ugh! Just because I can imagine Felix Thatch’s voice in my head, doesn’t mean I can speak with a received pronunciation British accent. And I’ve been told that my French accent sounds Russian. Let’s not get started on my luddite skills and unwillingness to part with my precious writing time to learn a new skill. And have I ever mentioned I am very much like Clarissa? Sometimes my computer stops working when I am near, but it works perfectly fine for my husband who doesn’t believe in magic (because he is a Morty). I don’t want to accidentally blow up all that expensive sound equipment. 

 
The ImpactWith your contribution, I am going to be able to do the following:
I will produce audiobooks and enrich the lives of others through literacy. Or at the very least, entertain them with fun witchy reads.
Many people depend on audiobooks for their source of literature due to preference, literacy level, or vision impairment. Your contribution will help support that.

Tardy Bells and Witches' Spells, the first book in the series has sold over 10,000 copies and has been an Amazon bestseller. Though success in Kindle format doesn’t guarantee audiobook success, it does mean there is a good chance that it will be listened to.
I have a track record for working hard and being professional in my goals. On average, I have put out one book a month for over a year. Some of them were 30,000 words and some were 120,000 words but a book a month.
Help me make a living doing what I love—art and writing. The picture below sums up my life effectively on average.
Risks & ChallengesThough listening to audiobooks is my preferred method of reading, this is the first time I have created an audiobook. One of my friends who is an author produced an audiobook a year ago and has remarked that making an audiobook killed his soul. That’s my biggest risk. I would like to avoid that.For you as a reader, your biggest risk is investing in a project and then hating a narrator’s voice and not wanting to listen to the book. As an audiobook listener myself, I know how that is. There are times I have listened to a book and the female voices are too high and shrill or the male voices sound forced and dopey. The accents might be horrible or there might be other problems that make a listener cringe. Here are somethings I have in place to help me finish this project and alleviate those worries.
I recently attended a workshop by an audiobook actor about what to look for when hiring audiobook narrators so that I don’t fall into newbie producer/author mistakes.
I am carefully auditioning narrators. I want to make sure I have someone who has a calming voice with and even pitch, can do male and female voices, is able to capture Clarissa’s voice, Felix Thatch’s received pronunciation accent, and all the other numerous accents.
I am going to be working with professionals who have made audio recordings before, who I select based on skill and competency. Because these actors are sought-after professionals, they might have other projects in line ahead of me or it might take a while to edit, but I know it will be worth it. I have champagne tastes, remember?
I will make sure my narrator can pronounce the important words that are genre specific (such as glamour), regionally specific to the character’s dialect (Clarissa is from Oregon, therefore she doesn’t say Ory-gone; she says Ory-gun), and specific to my story and world (like the word Womby’s).
I put out a newsletter 2-4 times a month to keep readers updated, so you will always know where the project is at developmentally.
Summer vacation. I’m a school teacher. If life gets crazy September through June and this project is taking a long time, I do have two and a half months of semi-uninterrupted time to devote to this project—if it takes that long to produce.
Some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Other ways you can get involved in supporting the Womby’s series:
Order a book or e-book on Amazon.
Get a free book if you are enrolled in Kindle Unlimited. Authors get paid for every page read in KU.
Leave an honest review on Amazon. This helps create author credibility, boosts ranking, and tells readers what to expect.
Share the books with a friend, book club, or on social media.
Sign up for my mailing list. That way I can keep you up to date on my progress, new releases, and when I have giveaways: http://eepurl.com/dEd4oL

Share on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sarina.dorie1/videos/2...

story:
When will Franz Rivoira write a book about watches?
This is the question A LOT of my readers on Quora have been posing me. So much that I have decided to finally give an answer to this question.

Well, to all of my horology comrades, this time is now.

I am writing a book about watches

During these years of writing, and over 14 million views by all of my readers, I have seen a great participation and interest about watches, and more specifically, about how I explain watches and watchmaking. A lot of you, in your comments, have asked me to collect all of the material I publish and create a handy, compact guide out of it.

Well, here it is.

This is the book I would have loved to read when I started out in watches!

Its name is “The Watch Manual”, and I have already registered the domain name, so when everything will be ready, you will find a brand new website built around it, where you could buy and download your soft copy.

This is a book for everyone interested in watches

Looking around the watch publishing landscape, I have not found a simple, straightforward manual about watches dedicated to everyone who is not an expert, and would like to become, if not a true expert, at least a more informed reader.

So, the manual I am writing is organized around short, focused chapters made to be quickly readable and easy to understand, using the same no-nonsense language I am using to explain the craft of horology to my readers.

Quick, easy, simple to understand, yet precise. Perfect to get to know about watches and all the world that surrounds them: how to find them, to buy them, to check them, to wear them, to sell them (and get a profit).

The goal is to make it available in soft and hard copy. First in English, and then, translated in other languages.

It will be a thorough primer of horology!

This will be the index, so you could check just how detailed it is going to be.
It is full of practical advice - over 600 pages of content that you could use immediately.
