story:
Short Summary

 

This campaign is intended to fund the writing and production of a book: The Cognitive Continuum (The CC). This book is based on intellectual work by Dr. John Vervaeke and Daniel Greig. We will draw on content from John’s webseries, Awakening the Meaning Crisis, as the foundation for the CC. 

 

For more details, listen to Daniel Greig on Psychedelics Today

+

Watch the conversation between Dr. Vervaeke & Daniel about the book.

 

What is this book about?

 

In the CC, we propose a theoretical framework for enlightenment based on the idea of optimal grip, which has its roots in the philosophical tradition of phenomenology. Enlightenment is all about optimal and ethical relationships between self, world, and other. The "cognitive continuum" refers to a set of neurocognitive functions, starting in insight, and culminating in the experience of mystical union. We argue that the optimal grip on reality that is characteristic of enlightenment is cultivated by using a set of practices that train this continuum of functions. The result of this training is a flexible and dynamic state of being infused with a sense of meaningfulness and connection. We will weave together the teachings of the world’s traditions of religion and philosophy with research based cognitive science to create this framework. This book will feature three parts:

 

Part I: Heaven - Illuminates the philosophy behind enlightenment

Part 2: Earth - Illuminates the science behind enlightenment

Part 3: The Way - Provides personal and social guidelines for the cultivation of enlightenment

 

Prints of Cosmic Dance, which will be featured in Part 1: Heaven, is available as a perk! If you would like to know more about these ideas before contributing, click here to listen to Daniel discuss the book on Psychedelics Today.

 

Timeline

 

Our goal is to have a draft finished by April 30th, work on the publishing process throughout the summer, and to publish the book by September 2020.

 

Cosmic Dance by Thadea Decora is available as a poster as part of this campaign!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

What We Need

 

Our goal is $20,000 CAD

 

Here’s a breakdown:

 

  • $5,000 for graphic design and promotion
    • Book layout and cover design ($1,750)
    • Art commissions ($1,000)
    • graphic design for figures and charts ($1,750)
    • Promotion/Video Production ($500)
  • $6,000 for perk production
    • Printing Posters
    • Artist Royalties
    • Printing costs of The Cognitive Continuum
  • $2,000 Indiegogo fees
    • Indiegogo charges 5% of the overall amount, and for each transaction they take 2.9% + $0.30 - if we meet our goal, we’re looking at upwards of $2,000 in fees paid to Indiegogo.
  • $7,000 in wages for Daniel
    • This breaks down to 280 hours at $25 CAD/hour. Daniel is author, project manager, and art director for this book. Daniel expects to work at least 540 hours between January and September (approx. 15 hours/week).

 

If we exceed our goal:

 

  1. We will be able to finish this book before our April 30th deadline! Daniel will quit his job to work on this full time. 

  2. We will increase our budget for art, illustration and graphic design to ensure that this book is truly a masterpiece! Ideally we would commission 7 art pieces to communicate the perspectives articulated in The CC. The budget outlined above only accounts for the 4 most essential.

 

What You Get

 

  • For $7, you will receive early access to the PDF

  • For $12, you will receive early PDF access + an audiobook

  • For $20, you will receive a PDF of Scale-Invariant Mutual Modelling (SIMM), an unpublished essay about consciousness by Dr. Vervaeke et al.

  • For $35, you will receive a PDF, audiobook, and an 18x24 poster of cosmic dance, an art commission from the book by Thadea Decora

  • For $60, you will receive a copy of the Illuminated Manuscript edition

  • For $80, you will receive a copy of the Illuminated Manuscript Edition + a poster print of Dancing Deities, an art commission from the book by Thadea Decora

  • For $100, you will receive all of the perks discussed thus far.

  • For $130, you will receive all of the perks discussed thus far, and for going the extra mile, we will also give you personal thanks in the book.

  • For $200, you can participate in the editing and review process through the Beta-Reading Network. You will also receive thanks in the book, a copy of the Illuminated Manuscript edition and an 18x24 poster of Cosmic Dance.

  • For $300, you will receive a one hour lecture or skype call from Daniel. You will also qualify for the beta-reading network, receive thanks in the book, a copy of the Illuminated Manuscript Edition, and a poster print.

  • For $1,200, you will receive a one hour lecture at a location of your choosing (within reasonable travel distance), or a skype call from Dr. Vervaeke. You will also qualify for the beta-reading network, receive thanks in the book, a copy of the Illuminated Manuscript Edition, a poster print and a copy of SIMM.

 

The Impact

 

The Writing Process

 The most immediate impact you’ll make is on the life and well-being of Daniel throughout the writing and publishing process. Daniel is balancing university classes, part time work, other volunteer engagements and more. By reaching our goal, Daniel will be able to fully dedicate his time to this project and finish it on time!

 

The Book

By contributing to this campaign, you will help to make this book the masterpiece it has the potential to be. In addition to artistic communication, there are many graphics, charts, and models that go into any piece of scientific literature. With the funds raised from this campaign, we will be able to ensure that these resources are as effective and engaging as possible, and that the book is aesthetically pleasing. As Platonists have long claimed, beauty is a tool for transcendence, and we wish to apply this tool in the creation of this book! 

 

The Future

The framework in this book will enable John and Daniel to work towards what we think is the most robust solution to “The Meaning Crisis”: an educational system that can reliably train people in the skills that come along with enlightenment. In order to accomplish this, we need to first have a solid understanding of what exactly enlightenment is, and how to get there. That is the project of this book. Following this book, efforts can be made to build the kind of educational system that we want to see in the world.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The major risk in this project is finishing on time. If I’m unable to receive compensation for time worked, this project will take months, perhaps even years, longer than it has to. My solution to this was to create this campaign.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Share this campaign! The more people hear about it, the more potential contributors we may find. Indiegogo has a number of share tools that you can use through the platform.

  • Watch John’s series Awakening from the Meaning Crisis, and share the videos! Education is the first step in solving any problem.

  • Recommend John or Daniel as an interviewee to your favourite podcast or online platform! This will help us extend our reach, and the success of the campaign.

story:
• Our history

In a year, we have managed to consolidate a team of journalists who work with sensibility and passion in the search for truth, with courage to communicate events both to Venezuelans and to those who live outside the country.

EC’s strategy is based on a community-driven newsroom. It seamlessly integrates social networks into the reporting process by using Twitter, Facebook and WhatsApp communities to generate story ideas and keep the audience up to date on breaking news. This structure is the inspiration for the name Efecto Cocuyo, which in English means “Firefly Effect.” We are  the product of thousands  of tiny sparks, which together can illuminate an entire nation.

/

  • Nuestra historia

Efecto Cocuyo es un medio y es una causa. Somos un grupo de periodistas venezolanas que asumimos en enero de 2015 el riesgo de emprender una plataforma de información e investigación independiente en un entorno caracterizado por el hostigamiento, el amedrentamiento y los obstáculos al libre ejercicio del periodismo. 

En un año hemos logrado consolidar un equipo de periodistas que trabaja con sensibilidad y pasión por la búsqueda de la verdad, para comunicar los hechos que desde el poder pretenden ocultar. Nuestra cobertura de la escasez de medicamentos en Venezuela y su impacto en los más vulnerables, los niños venezolanos, nos hizo finalistas del Premio Gabriel García Márquez 2016.

  • Our 2016 crowdfunding: Fearless coverage

This campaign is supported on your sensibility and in the belief that we can shine brighter together.  In order to achieve our goals, and in the knowledge of how essential free, responsible and quality press is for democracy, we need resources to sustain and continue Efecto Cocuyo.

The most inspiring thing is that everybody who support free press and democratic values, can be a Cocuyo. You are invited to join us.
A large scale citizen micro-financing plan was our first source of support in 2015 with more that $26,000 collected. These funds allowed us, among other things, to innovate in Venezuela’s media system, with initiatives that integrate users and journalists through the use of social networks and tools such as WhatsApp, which we use as a channel for crowdsourcing and distribution of information. For 2016-2017, we want to get to more people and support our country’s transformation through journalism, fighting for spaces to provide visibility to citizens and their needs.

  • Nuestra campaña 2016: ¿Quién dijo miedo? 

Somos un medio de comunicación libre e independiente, que usa todas sus plataformas para el libre ejercicio del periodismo y el acceso a la información.  Dejamos el miedo a un lado cuando investigamos, abordamos y desarrollamos los temas que interesan y preocupan a las personas. Le damos la voz a los protagonistas, a la gente.

Esta campaña se apoya en tu sensibilidad y en la creencia de que juntos podemos alumbrar más. Por ello tu donación es importante para garantizar la independencia de un medio emergente en una sociedad en la cual el Estado ejerce una hegemonía comunicacional.

Conscientes de lo fundamental que es para una democracia el periodismo libre, responsable y de calidad, requerimos recursos para darle sostenibilidad y continuidad a Efecto Cocuyo. 

  • How will you impact journalism in Venezuela 

Each and every one of your contributions will allow Efecto Cocuyo to shine brighter, solidifying the use of audiovisual platforms with which we’ll be able to explore the new transmedia storytelling, an approach to investigation that will focus on matters of sensibility and social impact; a fact-checking unit; the second edition of the school for young journalists, and also a Journalism and Participation program which seeks to increase interaction with our audiences and practice journalism with a social impact.

 

We need to collect at least $40,000 to be able to finance for a year, the operation of our site, composed by 14 young journalists, as well as starting projects to allow us to consolidate our own sources of income. Venezuela faces an economic crisis marked by inflation estimated to peak over 700% by the end of the year. These figures threaten small companies like ours, which was created only a year ago, and that’s why your support is vital to guarantee our operation in the short and medium term.

  • Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

La contribución de cada uno de ustedes permitirá que Efecto Cocuyo ilumine más, fortaleciendo: una plataforma audiovisual para explorar nuevas narrativas transmedias, un eje de investigación que pondrá el acento en temas de sensibilidad e impacto social, la segunda edición de la escuela para jóvenes periodistas, un programa de periodismo y participación para aumentar la interacción con nuestras audiencias y hacer periodismo de la mano de la gente, así como el mantenimiento y funcionamiento de nuestra plataforma tecnológica.

Necesitamos recaudar al menos 40 mil dólares para poder financiar durante un año la operatividad de nuestra redacción, integrada por 15 jóvenes periodistas, así como definir un modelo financiero que nos permitan consolidar la generación de ingresos propios. Venezuela enfrenta una crisis económica marcada por una inflación cuyas estimaciones superan el 700% para el cierre de año, cifra que aún siendo conversadora constituye una amenaza para pequeñas empresas como la nuestra que apenas tiene un año de constituida, de allí que tu apoyo sea vital para garantizar nuestro funcionamiento a corto y mediano plazo.

  • Cómo invertiremos el dinero

Necesitamos dinero y muchos recursos más para garantizar nuestra sostenibilidad y cumplir con los proyectos que nos hemos planteado. Los fondos que obtengamos gracias a tu contribución se utilizarán de la siguiente manera:

  • Plataforma audiovisual. Exploración de nuevas narrativas transmedias. 15% de lo recaudado
  • Coberturas especial electoral 2016-2017. 20% de lo recaudado
  • 2da Escuela Cocuyo. Formación de jóvenes periodistas. 10% de lo recaudado
  • Programa de mejoramiento profesional para Cocuyos.  30% de lo recaudado
  • Programa de Periodismo y Participación. Comunidad, redes. 15% de lo recaudado
  • Funcionamiento y soporte tecnológico. 10% de los recaudado.

El impacto

  •  Lo que hicimos en 2015-2016 en Efecto Cocuyo

Publicamos informaciones meticulosamente verificadas y reportajes que permiten comprender lo que ocurre en Venezuela.

Participamos en proyectos de investigación de largo alcance como PanamaPapers, día a día contamos las historias que reflejan la crisis venezolana y que han llamado a la acción ciudadana, especialmente frente a la carencia de medicamentos.

Fuimos el sitio más confiable e imparcial en la cobertura del proceso electoral del 6 de diciembre de 2015, de acuerdo con un monitoreo realizado por una organización independiente.

Realizamos una serie de reportajes sobre la escasez de medicamentos en Venezuela con los cuales ayudamos a salvar vidas. Este esfuerzo editorial fue reconocido por la Fundación para un Nuevo Periodismo Iberoamericano al escogernos entre los finalistas del Premio Gabriel García Márquez.

Realizamos la primera edición de la Escuela Cocuyo que permitió el adiestramiento de 25 jóvenes periodistas de Caracas y del interior de Venezuela en el manejo de dispositivos móviles para coberturas en tiempo real.

Emprendimos un programa de periodismo y participación que nos ha permitido conectarnos con audiencias de diferentes regiones de Venezuela y fuera del país, recogiendo propuestas para mejorar nuestros enfoques,

 Riesgos y desafíos

  •  Un problema

En Venezuela han ido desapareciendo  los espacios profesionales para el libre ejercicio del periodismo.  Los periodistas  han sido blanco de acciones directas de intimidación y agresión. También han sido afectados de manera colectiva mediante de la compra agresiva y sistemática de medios de comunicación. Los nuevos propietarios de la mayoría de la estructura de medios que eran independientes han impuesto un clima de censura y autocensura. Es uno de los momentos más oscuros del periodismo, y sin embargo en medio de la crisis hay una oportunidad.

  • Una solución

También es un momento de luz en Venezuela. Asumimos el periodismo libre e independiente como una causa, por la cual vale la pena luchar. Creamos Efecto Cocuyo, un sitio que en menos de 12 meses  se posicionó como un medio confiable, responsable y con una alta conexión con sus usuarios.

Tenemos un equipo para enfrentar, sin miedo, los obstáculos al acceso a la información y luchar por una sociedad transformadora. Trabajamos en la exploración de nuevos productos editoriales y propuestas que nos pongan en sintonía con las audiencias. Queremos innovar, crear, iluminar, y para ello necesitamos de tu apoyo al donar a nuestra causa o compartir esta información para que se multiplique y logremos alcanzar nuestra meta. Tu pones tu ayuda y nosotros tenemos:

  • Somos un equipo multidisciplinario liderado por mujeres con experiencia en el periodismo y reporterismo, preparadas para gerenciar un medio y transmitir este conocimiento a las nuevas generaciones.
  • Un equipo de jóvenes comprometidos, con gran sensibilidad social, que conoce los obstáculos y con valentía los supera.
  • Creemos en la planificación como piedra angular para emprender.
  • Enfrentamos los cambios y surfeamos las olas, sin dejar a un lado nuestros principios.
  • Creemos en el trabajo colectivo, en la pluralidad y en el periodismo que se hace con la gente.
  • Creemos en Venezuela y en sus potencialidades.
  • Nuestra pasión es el periodismo.

 ​

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Puedes ayudarnos a multiplicar este mensaje y hacer que el Cocuyo alumbre más.

Invita a tus amigos, conocidos y redes nuestra campaña e invítalos a donar. Divulga nuestro video de promoción en tus redes sociales, a tus listas de correos electrónicos.

Entra en la plataforma de Indiegogo y comparte desde allí nuestra campaña y nuestra experiencia.

Si hablas de Efecto Cocuyo y de la importancia de apoyarnos estarás contribuyendo con el periodismo independiente en Venezuela.

Apoya desde twitter y facebook la etiqueta #QuiendijomiedoApoyaEfectoCocuyo

#index

/about

Listen, listen, for now the truth is revealed to you.

I am His Word.

I am speaking of the entire team.

With me is our screenwriter. With me is our cutter. And performer of us.

Here we start our long journey.

There is a girl. Her name is Lynn and she was the courier that delivers snow in summer. These things her last job and the last will. She was instructed to spread the special parcel for very special addressees.  Rain washed away her footprints as wash away bloodflowers on the asphalt. Every level - it is a link. The specific link for the special history of a soul. Our screenwriter tell the truth of them in the future. Be prepared and stand by. Elegant psycho. The phantom of 80s. The one who has grown old in the soul. The sage with a tail. And your humble servant. And many others. We harbored this scenario for a long time and now we want to give it to you. For a modest fee in the name of Acorns. Some green paper for the best staging from the worst freakshow. The first book in a long row of books and the first unit of the content in a long line of content. 

What will happen next? This is the right question from your side.

Many fates. Broken fates. All pass through White Room, waiting for the best, but can only fill up the sea of maggots. Come what may. Totally next will be the Winter in damned city. 

/faq

All of your money that we get, let us in the publication. We are strongly engaged in distribution and promotion of this product, and the Creation of the next. The witnesses will be interviewed, the documents will be received. We spend money on translation into human language, because our standards are far from ordinary. We will create artbook and illustrations. We will write broken hymns for all floors, all maggots and all acorns. More, and more, and more, and more. Because this is more than the book.

/dowloads

Right now we have a special presentation for you. You can go to the lower levels and get everything at once. Or you can go the usual way, to obtain a standard pack.

/share

Even if you have no money, you can help us. Carry the Lord's word in your social accounts and you will be rewarded. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much.

Amen.

story:
Short Summary and Introduction;

Hi, my name is Mark Whoachickie, I’m a father and friend, that lives in Guelph, Ontario, Canada. Most recently I've become the storyteller of my first children’s book, Playing Amongst Summer Mountains. In summary the books in this series depict the 4 day adventures of a father and his two children amongst a summer and winter mountain setting. As an avid outdoorsman, I hope that those who read this series will be inspired to enjoy our wonderful surroundings with their family and friends.

Hi, I’m Sam Phippen, I’m a 15 year old artist and illustrator from Guelph, Ontario.  I’m the latest in four generations of artists in my family, and the illustrations in “Playing Amongst Summer Mountains” is my first professional artistic opportunity and the beginning of my creative career.

Brief description of the campaign and why it's important;

This campaign is important to for 2 reasons – one is because we love the occasional thing done for us.  Who doesn’t? One of those things is being read to, especially, simple, short stories with vibrant drawings.  When this happens we feel relaxed so we can imagine and dream. So publishing the Playing Amongst Mountains Series is to help you and the children you care about feel the same way.

Second, because we believe in protecting and preserving the parks and wilderness around us for today and generations to come. Therefore a portion of the sales of these books will be donated to the Canadian Parks and Wilderness Society or C-PAWS.

The magnitude;

The magnitude of funding this book series is awesome! Firstly, it helps us read to children, and them read to us. Secondly, it helps us plan and imagine what we can do together outside. And lastly your assistance with funding these books helps support C-PAWS. CPAWS is one of the only nationwide charities to focus exclusively on conserving public lands, waters, and keeping Canada great!

What We Need & What You Get;

For this 60 day campaign we have a $10,000 goal for both books. The funds raised will pay for illustrations, editing, publishing, printing, marketing and this video short.

Here are our unique perks!

Folded Mountains for $30 – you receive a signed copy of either Playing Amongst the Summer or Winter Mountains.

Block Mountains for $75 – you get a signed copy of both Playing Amongst the Summer and Winter Mountains.

Dome Mountains for $150 – you receive a customized copy of both Playing Amongst the Summer and Winter Mountains. Meaning your chosen name will be printed in the “This book belongs to…….” Page.

Volcanic Mountains $500 –  you get 10 signed books, 5 of summer and 5 of winter Mountains.

Plateau Mountains for $1000 -  you receive 30 signed books, 15 of summer and 15 of winter Mountains

Where the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal;

If we don’t we reach our goal, the funds will help subsidize parts of what is needed to publish these books.

The Impact;

This project is exceptionally valuable to you because it helps allocate time with the children you care about by reading, dreaming and planning outdoor activities. As well, your support goes to preserving Canada's national parks, wildlife, and keeping it looking great!

My successful track record with projects like this;

This is the first time I’m self-publishing books so I’m learning plenty along the way from other self-published authors like Garth Laidlaw and Jorey Tessier. I do have a solid successful background in business, managing my home, and raising my family. Put all this together with my goal to share these books with you during my 50th year on this planet will help in the trust between me and you to invest in a successful campaign.

Risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goal;  

One of my key attributes is my honesty with others. So to be honest, this campaign is supporting a new hobby that I am very passionate about.  Hurdles that I may face are ones that maybe out of my control. So, to solve this I bring my strategic business acumen to ensure commitment from those I work with to meet deadlines so you can enjoy the Playing Amongst Mountains book series as planned.

My plan for solving challenges;

My plan to solve any roadblocks is to anticipate them early, communicate effectively, and have a B plan. The great thing about self-publishing is there are many reasonable options available to invest in when one does not pan out.

Other Ways You Can Help;

Some of you just can't contribute and that’s cool. If you’re not able to fiscally donate then you can help by liking our social media channels;

Our website; http://playingamongstmountains.wordpress.com

Facebook; https://www.facebook.com/Whoachickie/

Instagram; http://www.instagram.com/Whoachickie

Twitter; http://twitter.com/wojcickimark

And of course, use the Indiegogo share tools.  

Please help Sam and I make noise about the Playing Amongst Mountains crowdfunding campaign with others that you know would invest their time and/or funding to boost its success.  And lastly, read to each, other and go outside and enjoy your surroundings.

Thank you in advance for your support of the Playing Amongst Mountains Children’s Book Series.

Firstly, it helps us read to children, and them read to us. Secondly, it helps us plan and imagine what we can do together outside. And lastly your assistance with funding these books helps support C-PAWS. CPAWS is one of the only nationwide charities to focus exclusively on conserving public lands, waters, and keeping Canada great!What We Need & What You Get; For this 60 day campaign we have a $10,000 goal for both books. The funds raised will pay for illustrations, editing, publishing, printing, marketing and this video short.Here are our unique perks!Folded Mountains for $30 – you receive a signed copy of either Playing Amongst the Summer or Winter Mountains.Block Mountains for $75 – you get a signed copy of both Playing Amongst the Summer and Winter Mountains.Dome Mountains for $150 – you receive a customized copy of both Playing Amongst the Summer and Winter Mountains. Meaning your chosen name will be printed in the “This book belongs to…….” Page.Volcanic Mountains $500 –  you get 10 signed books, 5 of summer and 5 of winter Mountains.Plateau Mountains for $1000 -  you receive 30 signed books, 15 of summer and 15 of winter MountainsWhere the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal;If we don’t we reach our goal, the funds will help subsidize parts of what is needed to publish these books.The Impact;This project is exceptionally valuable to you because it helps allocate time with the children you care about by reading, dreaming and planning outdoor activities. As well, your support goes to preserving Canada's national parks, wildlife, and keeping it looking great!My successful track record with projects like this;This is the first time I’m self-publishing books so I’m learning plenty along the way from other self-published authors like Garth Laidlaw and Jorey Tessier. I do have a solid successful background in business, managing my home, and raising my family. Put all this together with my goal to share these books with you during my 50th year on this planet will help in the trust between me and you to invest in a successful campaign.Risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goal;  One of my key attributes is my honesty with others. So to be honest, this campaign is supporting a new hobby that I am very passionate about.  Hurdles that I may face are ones that maybe out of my control. So, to solve this I bring my strategic business acumen to ensure commitment from those I work with to meet deadlines so you can enjoy the Playing Amongst Mountains book series as planned.My plan for solving challenges;My plan to solve any roadblocks is to anticipate them early, communicate effectively, and have a B plan. The great thing about self-publishing is there are many reasonable options available to invest in when one does not pan out.Other Ways You Can Help;Some of you just can't contribute and that’s cool. If you’re not able to fiscally donate then you can help by liking our social media channels;Our website; http://playingamongstmountains.wordpress.comFacebook; https://www.facebook.com/Whoachickie/Instagram; http://www.instagram.com/WhoachickieTwitter; http://twitter.com/wojcickimarkAnd of course, use the Indiegogo share tools.  Please help Sam and I make noise about the Playing Amongst Mountains crowdfunding campaign with others that you know would invest their time and/or funding to boost its success.  And lastly, read to each, other and go outside and enjoy your surroundings.Thank you in advance for your support of the Playing Amongst Mountains Children’s Book Series.

story:
Missed the crowdfund? Here's how you can still help.

You can support The Colour of Madness by donating through our PayPal - info@stirlingpublishing.co.uk. If you donate over £10, you will receive a free ebook edition of the anthology and your name included among our list of supporters at the back of the book! 

***

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. What is The Colour of Madness?

2. Who are you?

3. What are the perks?

4. How will the money be used?

5. I have no money, how can I help?

6. Can submit work to the anthology?

 

1. WHAT IS THE COLOUR OF MADNESS?

 

 

The Colour of Madness is a seminal anthology, comprised of poetry, fiction, essays, memoirs and art submitted by BAME writers, academics, mental health workers, artists and those who are still navigating life with mental health problems.  

BAME mental health is seriously underfunded and largely ignored by the community.  Our mission is to raise awareness about the serious issues surrounding BAME mental health all the way to Number 10 and start some robust dialogue that will change the way marginalised sectors of society with mental health issues are treated.  

 

2. WHO ARE YOU?

 

The Editor: Samara Linton

Samara Linton is a final-year medical student at University College London and a University of Cambridge graduate. She has published research on mental health stigma and frequently writes about gender, race and health for various online publications. In 2016, she was awarded Best New Journalist at the Ending Violence Against Women Media Awards for her work on the mental health of black women and the experiences of migrant women in UK detention centres. 

Samara is particularly interested in the role of communities in tackling oppression, and March 2016 saw the Parliamentary launch of the report she co-edited for the Africa All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Ebola crisis and the role of communities in strengthening health systems. Samara welcomes the opportunity to create a platform for people from BAME communities to shape conversations about mental health in the UK. 

 Samara will be reviewing and editing the submissions to be included in the anthology.

The Associate Editor: Rianna Walcott

Rianna Walcott is a PhD candidate at Kings College London, where she is researching how women of colour form communities in digital spaces, following an English literature undergraduate and masters degree at Edinburgh University. She is passionate about decolonising curricula and promoting diversity in academia, and co-founded projectmyopia.com in pursuit of that goal: a website that crowdsources recommendations and reviews of diverse materials for inclusion in curricula.

As a black woman who suffers from poor mental health, and who was turned away by a white mental healthcare professional in a time of need, Rianna is adamant about the need for more BAME healthcare professionals who are sensitive to contemporary BAME needs and issues, and who are able to recognise that trauma may look different on a non-white face.

The Publisher: Stirling Publishing

When Tabatha Stirling (Stirling Publishing) approached Rianna Walcott about an idea for an anthology about BAME mental health issues at a Creative Edinburgh conference day, The Colour Of Madness was born.

Tabatha Stirling is a writer and poet living in Edinburgh and founder of Stirling Publishing.  Her publishing credits include Spelk fiction, Camroc Fiction Press, Literary Orphans, Mslexia, Feminine Collective, Sick Lit Mag, Twisted Sister, Bright Sleep Magazine, The Magnolia Review and her novel, Blood On The Banana Leaf, exploring maid abuses in Singapore was signed by Unbound in 2016.  Tabatha is Bipolar Type II and has experienced mental health suffering from both patient and therapist viewpoints, and from the multiple stays in psychiatric facilities during her 20's and 30's.

Laura Maria Grierson is the editorial assistant at Stirling Publishing. After finishing her BA in English Studies with Creative Writing with a First, Laura completed her MA in Creative Writing with a distinction. During her time at Teesside University, she had three poems published in The Teesside Literary Society Inaugural Anthology (2016). 

 

3. WHAT ARE THE PERKS?

 

Perks are our way of saying thank you for supporting our campaign! During the crowdfund, our perks included:

  • Having your name listed on OUR SUPPORTERS page at the back of the book, making you part of literary history!
  • Copies of the anthology: ebook, paperback and hardback
  • Skype meetings with the publisher to discuss what makes us tick and answer all your publishing questions
  • Free editorial reviews of your manuscript
  • Tickets to the launch party.

AND 

  • Some VERY special 'secret' perks!

 

Now that the crowdfund has closed, if you donate £10 or more via Paypal (info@stirlingpublishing.co.uk) you will receive a free ebook edition of the anthology and have your name listed in 'Our Supporters' at the back of the book.

 

4. WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

 

We have chosen to crowdfund this anthology as it allows us to interact with and grow our audience organically. It also means that our supporters become part of the anthology's adventure and are directly involved with its publication. It becomes a much more personal journey for everybody involved.

The funds raised will go towards the production process of the anthology. This will include initial print runs, book cover design, editorial work, typesetting, distribution costs, publicity, and marketing.

Any surplus funds will be donated to Kindred Minds, a service-user led BAME mental health charity.

All the writers/artists who have had work selected for The Colour of Madness will graciously forfeit their royalties which will also be forwarded to Kindred Minds.

 

5.  I HAVE NO MONEY, HOW CAN I HELP?

 

We acknowledge that not everyone is able to financially support us at this time, however, there is still a lot you can do to help!

Please retweet and like our posts, make #colourofmadness trend on twitter and help build momentum for the campaign.  Talk about it with your friends, your class, your teachers, your family.  

You can also submit work to The Colour of Madness (see below).

 

6. CAN I SUBMIT WORK TO THE ANTHOLOGY?

 

  1. Find out how to submit your work for consideration here. Deadline: 18th February 2018, 11.59pm
  2. Enter our cover art design competition here. Deadline: 31st January 2018, 11.59pm 

 

-

IT IS WAY PAST TIME that BAME mental health sufferers are treated equally. Young Black men are dying in police custody, there is overwhelmingly negative media coverage of BAME psychosis sufferers who offend while ill, and a lack of research funding to explore BAME mental health on a clinical level.

These are all issues that need to be addressed and taken seriously by the government, the General Medical Council, mental health organisations and the media.                                                  

And you can help make these changes by contributing to and/or supporting The Colour of Madness campaign.

THANK YOU

story:
“My name is Rudolf & I used to own & operate a whole bunch of nightclubs in New York during its glory days, roughly from 1978 to 1990. I was at the helm of Studio 54, Danceteria, Tunnel & Palladium, amongst others, & I certainly have a lot of stories to tell. Here are just a few. Times were pretty crazy back then. Bob [Robert Carrithers] used to be a regular in all my clubs & witnessed a lot of the goings on. If you don’t believe what you read, just ask him! He even has some photos to show you!”

 

Rudolf Piper, New York club owner & entrepreneur

 

Help collect 5200$ for CITY PRIMEVAL: NEW YORK, BERLIN, PRAGUE! This book is a personal journey through time in each city, told by 69 contemporary writers, musicians, designers, filmmakers, photographers, painters and performers from within the New York, Berlin and Prague underground scenes from the late 1960s to the present; from New York Post-Punk and No Wave, to the fall of the Berlin Wall and Reunification, to the Velvet Revolution and the Prague Renaissance. The stories and photographs were meticulously curated by photographer Robert Carrithers and  Louis Armand, writer and critical theorist.

With the book release events, the City Primeval team strives to bring the stories visually into life in all the cities of their creation. In cooperation with culturally significant galleries and institutions, we are preparing book releases in New York, Berlin and Prague by the end of 2017.

In 2018, City Primeval will return to the three cities as a living exhibition as well. Contributing artists (along with other connected artists) will be featured in exhibitions taking place in all of the three cities. This way, we can further expose and promote the work of artists who contributed their work to create this unique constellation of art and culture.

Your contribution will support the production of these one-of-a-kind launch events and exhibitions as well as the promotion of the book itself. Photographer-curator Robert Carrithers took a year's sabbatical leave to realize this ambitious book project, which includes the work of 69 participating artists.

We need the final push to get the book and its accompanying events from the ground. We will thank you for your generous contribution with attractive rewards: original artwork signed by the artists, including photographs by Bethany Jacobson and Jackie Baier, watercolours by Carola Goellner, paintings by Dávid Kurňavka, poster by Miron Zownir and many others - see the full catalogue of rewards below.

Book release events this campaign will cover:

November 10th   Howl Gallery, NYC   https://www.howlarts.org     

November 30th Neurotitan Gallery, Berlin  http://www.neurotitan.de

December 7th Chemistry Gallery,Prague http://www.thechemistry.cz

 

Why did we do it? Find Robert Carrithers’ story about the origin of the City Primeval story and his life in the three cities here: http://bit.ly/2x30izc

Who is involved? Find the full list of contributors to the CITY PRIMEVAL book here:   http://bit.ly/2gC3St2

How can you be involved? Browse between the artworks offered as perks & choose your favourite! To get a closer look of the artworks, see the rewards catalogue here: http://bit.ly/2xV9d26​

 

Shipping fee for artworks is extra.

story:
THE STORY & THE MAKING OF "KID WONDER"


“Kid Wonder” is the story of a man during the last days of his life. Surrounded by the thoughts of his childhood in the shape of an invisible super-hero cape, he reconciles with his past understanding and accepts his inevitable death.

Book characteristics:

  • 250 books. Limited edition. Numbered & signed.
  • Digitally printed, 600dpi scans from original prnits. The book has the same size of a 12" vinyl, containing a digital printed booklet of:
  1. 12" full colour stapled booklet of 20 pages, (color, CMYK) 150gsm in a gloss art paper.
  2. Inserted in a 12" gatefold sleeve (color, CMYK) 350gsm white gloss, machine varnished.
  • Includes a digital download code of the song "Kid Wonder", by the Scottish songwriter Marcus Doo.

In the making of the book, Sara puts herself in the shoes of an adult that sees the world through the eyes of a child. Accomplishing each page of the book without previous sketches, drawing from memory, just like a kid would do. This gives a wild sense of order to the prints. To obtain the mark making of a child, Sara uses lithography (biro pen on reclaimed polyester plate) and collagraph, making plates out of egg-boxes and found cardboard.



 

Sara Alonso
b. 1981, Spain, lives and works in Glasgow

With a background in Communications and Design, Sara completed her MLitt in Fine Art Practice - Print Media in the Glasgow School of Art, 2015. The same year she joined the Glasgow Print Studio where she continues her practice in printmaking.



Not to be labelled as a master of a single technique, but a continuous apprentice of all, Sara takes every body of work as a new opportunity to learn traditional print processes and experiment with new methods, technologies and materials in mark making. Her methodology is now focused on breaking the two-dimensionality of the paper and its relation with the wall, to serve as a visual expression of a given narrative.

Marcus Doo
b. 1979, Scotland, lives and works in Glasgow


Listen to “Kid Wonder” by Marcus Doo:
https://www.marcusdoo.com/music/


 

 

HOW MUCH DO WE NEED TO PUBLISH THE BOOK

 

To be honest, we are not going to get rich with this book. As a matter of fact, the amount of craft that was put into the creation of the book would make its price way more expensive. But we want to make this book happen, and we'd love to see it in any house, either in a shelf next to your books or in your collection of vinyls. And why not, this could be the first of an edition of illustrated songs.

In order to produce 250 books (this is the minimum run of units for this kind of order at our -very trusted- printing house in Scotland) we have recieved a quote of £2,122.44

  • Per sold unit we'll be making a £8 profit, but only after we have sold 107 books:

  • You can pre-order your book and also you could add your name on it.
  • £125 (5% of £2500) IndieGoGo fees.
  • £25 Bank transfers
  • Margin of error £228 (returns, free samples for awards etc, ...)
 

THE FIRST OF MANY

 

This book could be the first of a series of books created by Sara Alonso as self-publisher/artist.
Her artist book "The Peep Show of Hearts" gained her a Distinction on her Masters of Letters at the Glasgow School of Art in 2105. This book is hidden in a drawer, willing to see the light:
http://saraalonsoart.com/The-Peep-Show-of-Hearts/Book

Her next idea is to make a book inspired by the song "Lazarus" by David Bowie.
With your purchase you would be helping to make this and other art projects real.
Feed the artist!!

Maybe, you cannot afford now to help with money, but remember that sharing this link within your contacts would also be a great help. Who knows! Maybe together we can reach to a great patron!!
 
THANK YOU PATRONS!!

story:
Guinea Hogs Lost and Found: A Recent History

Synopsis

This is the very first book ever written on the subject of a rare, heritage livestock hog - the Guinea Hog. It is a documentation of the breed's recent history, how it almost died out within the last 15 years, and how dedicated breeders have saved it, promoted it, and worked to keep it viable for future generations. This is a research project based on first person interviews and recovery and review of archival data, along with personal experiences and observations. Please support this work!

Who I am

My name is Cathy Payne. After spending over 33 years in the field of special education, I "retired" to a rural part of Northeast Georgia with my husband. Here we began learning how to produce our own food. My husband started a new service business. In 2010, at age 57, I became a farmer, with little advance preparation.

How it all Started

Everything about farming was new to me, and I depended on my planning and research skills to make it through each week - no, each day! When I discovered the Guinea Hog, I also discovered that little information was available to me. Nobody had written a book about the Guinea Hogs. I realized that if I wanted to read a book, I would have to write it first. Hence the beginning of my project. The completed book's working title is, Guinea Hogs Lost and Found: The Amazing Grace of Breed Recovery. In it, I explain why the Guinea Hogs became almost extinct by 2004. There were only 22 identified breeding hogs left at that time.

Book Content and Research Methods

In my first book about Guinea Hogs, I explore the cultural and agricultural influences that nearly led to their demise. I also share inspiring stories of those committed breeders and conservators who sought out and bred those remaining viable hogs and began a registry to record offspring and ancestors. I enlighten readers about the hog genetics that fell through the cracks and were almost lost forever. And I tell the story of more conservators and breeders who saved those precious genetics. Anyone who knows me at all knows that I am passionate about livestock breed conservation.  I'm dedicated to learning about and sharing my knowledge of the American Guinea Hog, a breed traditionally raised here in the Southeast. In talking to people about the hog, I discovered much more than I bargained for! I'm now involved in a project that involves people throughout the United States and so excited to get this information out for conservationists everywhere.

I've been interviewing people since 2013 to learn about the hogs and learned much more than I'd bargained for! I found stories of near extinction, heroic preservation efforts, anger and betrayal, natural disasters, terminal illness, farmers helping farmers, farmers helping pigs, and more.

Purpose of this Campaign

The time I'm spending to get the book completed and self published is taking me away from marketing my farm products and tending to other farm business. It is also generating additional expenses that won't produce income until the project is complete. So here is my Catch-22: I need to hire editors, proof readers, book designers, format experts and more. I want to get this book into the hands of conservationists and Guinea Hog breeders as soon as possible. I also need to pay the bills.  I have nearly 4 years of research notes and interview transcripts waiting to be transformed into an eye-opening book.  I don't need or want charity, although donations will be gratefully received and appreciated for those who are moved to give. Instead I am offering high quality farm perks to those who want to support my work. By supporting my campaign, you will be forever linked to this amazing breed and its story and you will get high value perks to remind you of this connection. Any amount from $5 to $500 or more will help! If you can't do this, please share the campaign with your friends on social media. You never know who might be interested.

Great Perks

I plan to offer 25 different perks over the next 4 weeks. I'll start the campaign with 11 perks. I'll add 5 additional perks each week, so stay in touch with the campaign and let your friends know. In the first week of the campaign there will be a secret perk just for friends in my social media groups who find my link for a limited edition perk. Why not make things interesting?

Why this Campaign Matters

Why should you care about the history of the Guinea Hogs? Our historical livestock in America are part of our culture, just like our architecture or our cuisine. History will repeat itself if we are not careful, and the Guinea Hog could revert to critically rare status. Information is needed to guide supporters of and breeders of these wonderful animals. They are well worth it. Let me tell you the story!

Monetary Goals

Three years of research does not come cheaply. Neither does breeding for particular historical lines of a breed. It means time for interviews, recording services, transcription services, editors, proof readers, jacket designers, formatting, publishing fees, and more. In the meantime I am breeding and retaining stock from each generation and providing pork to the community. I love every step of the process.

I've set a goal of $4,500 to finish the project. I have unique artisanal perks to share with those who are inspired to support me. These range from dried herb blends, herbs, cat treats, dog treats, wool batting, wool yarn, organic ginger and turmeric, breeding stock, chef services, and more! Just check them out. I plan to add new perks every week, so be sure to check back frequently for updates. Most items can be shipped to the continental United States, while others can be picked up on the farm if you are local to Elberton, Georgia.

My Record - I Deliver!

This is my third indiegogo campaign. I have a history of delivering 100% of perks. You can check out my website and Facebook pages to see pictures of my hogs and get a feel for me as a person. You can also read reviews at www.facebook.com/broadriverpastures. You will note that people most often describe me as knowledgeable, helpful, and passionate about what I am doing.

My Vision

I have a dream to write this story down, share it with the world, and to make a difference in the future of this rare hog. Please help me make a difference! I am a person who likes to set big goals and achieve them by taking one step at a time. I finished a doctoral program while working in elementary education. I learned to farm late in life. I know that I can do this, too.

Please become informed about heritage breeds. Check out the American Guinea Hog Association and The Livestock Conservancy. Share this project with your friends. Contribute monetarily if you can. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello there,

My name is David and I’m an optimist – it is my lifestyle.

I’m always looking for the bright side and I’m being practical about it. When it comes to anything I want to improve at, I set challenges to make sure I can measure my results and reach my goals.

Also, I believe that optimists are different than dreamers. A dreamer only dreams about what he wants in his life – an optimist gets practical about it.

Since I’ve known myself, I’ve always wanted to improve my life and make it better. This year, I’ve added some challenges into my lifestyle, challenges like doing 3 minutes of cold showers every day for 30 days or running 10 km every day for 30 days.

But ... that’s not enough. I’ve noticed that something is missing – the interaction with other people.

I realized quite fast that humans are social creatures and we need one another.

And then it hit me! I think I know what optimism is, but what does it really mean for others?

Therefore, I planned to meet humans from all over the world and listen to their optimistic stories.

I truly want to discover a practical formula for optimism and share it with the world.

But for doing that I need the help of the world.

Get involved in this Indiegogo project and support my mission. Only together we can make the world a better place.

More about David …

  • Personal Blog
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Make Your Life AMAZING - The Importance Of Your Subconscious In Achieving Objectives (book)
  • Shift To Passion - How To Do What You Love Without Starving To Death (book)

 

What Am I Going To Do?

  • I’m going to start with Europe and meet people from 17 different European countries.
  • Interview as many people as I can and discover optimistic practical stories.
  • I'll make a big step towards understanding what optimism is, how it works, and create a practical formula for optimism.
  • I’ll write a book about everything I’ll experience – the final product.

 

Travel Plan & Meeting People

Here are the cities I’ve chosen to visit for this project.

  1. BELGRAD (Serbia)
  2. BUDAPEST (Hungary)
  3. VIENNA (Austria)
  4. PRAGUE (Czech Republic)
  5. BERLIN (Germany)
  6. STOCKHOLM (Sweden)
  7. OSLO (Norway)
  8. COPENHAGEN (Denmark)
  9. AMSTERDAM (Netherlands)
  10. BRUXELLES (Belgium)
  11. LONDON (England)
  12. PARIS (France)
  13. MADRID (Spain)
  14. BARCELONA (Spain)
  15. MILANO (Italy)
  16. VENEZIA (Italy)
  17. LJUBLJANA (Slovenia)
  18. ZAGREB (Croatia)
  19. BUCHAREST (Romania)

Travel vehicle: train.
Accommodation: hostels, airbnb or couchsurfing.

I’ll approach people on the streets, café bars, parks and anywhere I can find people that are available to talk for 15-60 minutes and share their story.

Travel expenses – accommodation, train tickets

Book publishing – proofreading, covers, printing, digital format

Shipping – $6 for Romania | $18 for the rest of the world
every shipment will be tracked

 

The Impact

Through this project and its final product (the book) I’m trying to make the world a better place.

By supporting this project you are part of my movement of discovering a practical formula for optimism.

 

What Happens If The Project Gets Funded With 250% Or More?

I'll consider writing a second volume, which will involve meeting people from North America or Australia. Or both.

 

The Book

The main points of the book will be focused around:

  • Rough life-stories with a high dose of positivity;
  • Practical ways of overcoming life obstacles.

The book (printed and digital version) will be ready and delivered to you in February 2018. I'll keep you updated with the process.

 

Early-Bird Book

Get the book for $14 instead of $20. Only available for the first 100 supporters.

Includes the printed and digital version of the book + other stuff. ❤️

 

Limited OFFER: The Book Bundle

70 AVAILABLE

Support me and get your hands on two more books that I wrote.
All printed. All signed.

Make Your Life AMAZING | Shift To Passion | The Journey Of An Optimist

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way you can support this project is with a donation.

Choose one of the perks from the right sidebar and you’ll get a reward (or more) for your donation.

Other things you can do to spread the word:

  • Share this project on social media;
  • Tell your friends about this project.

 

Last Famous Words

If you don’t do it for yourself, do it for your friends, family or children. Make the world a better place!

 

Thank You!

Ian Hutchinson, Alin Florin Serban, Dora Cerin, Fătu Corina, Robyn Stratton-Berkessel

story:
Because everyone is born a dancer.

Because dance is not just a series of steps.

Because our moving bodies have great powers to transform pain into ecstasy.

And because our body deserves a voice.

a Dance Mag was born.

Launched in July 2018, issue 01 of a Dance Mag explored the theme of Transcendence. It included stories from 14 countries and was sold in 17 cities around the world.

Issue 02 explores the theme of Furor and takes us on a new marvelous trip.

Sneak peek into

Issue 02: Furor

Join the community. Pre-order your copy.

 

Issue 02 tells stories of people who embrace their rage, indignation, defiance, and a love of life that refuses to be subdued. They engage with their full ferocity to face the challenges that surround them. And they end up experiencing the little death that bring us renewed back to life.

In the Furor issue you will read about free-spirited artists who refused being crushed by established systems. You will read about creative forces transforming destruction into beauty and grace. And you will read about flames of hope shining bright in the darkest of nights.

 

Why your support is needed?

a Dance Mag is an independent project that exists because of individuals who believe in it: the makers, the contributing-writers, and you: the readers. Printing and distributing are the biggest challenges facing independent publishing in general and this holds true for a Dance Mag. This is why your support is invaluable. It is a statement that you'd like this magazine to LIVE and that is enough to keep us going...

 

Pick a perk to enjoy this ride with us!

  • Get the Furor issue delivered to your doorstep.
  • Pick a copy of Transcendence before it runs out of stock (the remaining copies are available in the perks section: Grab it!).
  • Get your name published on our supporters' page in issue 03.
  • Like-minded, independent cultural institutions can get their story published in issue 03.

*Please note that perks don't include the shipping fee, a flat rate will be added at checkout.

     

    Who are we?

    We are a transcultural-community of socially engaged artists, dancers, designers, activists, social workers, ethnographers, journalists and somatic practitioners from around the world, immersed in the realities of our communities. a Dance Mag has so far engaged:

    • 35 contributing-authors from around the world: We have collaborated with writers/artists in Lebanon, Palestine, Syria, Turkey, Italy, France, Portugal, Belgium, Iceland, Sweden, Netherlands, England, Macedonia, Australia, United States, Ghana, Singapore, India, Brazil, Thailand, and Sudan.
    • Two editors-at-large: Responsible for spotting stories in need to be heard from regions and communities they are in direct contact with. They also assist individuals who need help writing their stories. Zena Takieddine for the Middle East, and Sara Azzarelli for Italy.  More editors will join soon.
    • One copy-editor: Sean Agass based in London – UK.
    • Two art-directors:  Max Weinland & Timo Durst based in Hamburg – Germany.
    • One creative director (inaugural issue): Ibrahim Nehme based in Beirut – Lebanon.
    • One editor-in-chief: Jana Al-Obeidyine based in Beirut – Lebanon.

    Many thanks to Valerie Nseir and Myriam Tawk for their loving work on issue 01.

       

      What magazine professionals say about a Dance Mag?

          Our latest Magazine of the Week is spectacular in concept, format, text and design.           –Jeremy Leslie, magCulture

      a Dance Mag was so gratifying — spanning philosophy, identity and history, the Beirut-based magazine is giving our moving bodies a voice. –Grace Wang, Stack magazines

       The effect [of design] is surprising, because the magazine seems to move and dance, even without showing any dancer on its pages. –Giovanna Sala, mgzn

       

      What our readers say?

      You guys are a blessing. You are the first magazine that understands dance as a state of mind, not only technique. – Tanya from Beirut

      A beautiful collection of essays on transcend(dance), starting with Sufi swirling and ending with Derrida in a techno club. Not only are the articles well researched but the printing and design of the issue are super-impressive. It’s a gorgeous thing to hold. –Rebecca from Berlin

      Honestly, the best magazine I have ever bought. –Dunn from New York

       

      Timeline

      • 30th of April 2019: We make the final touches to design.
      • 10th of May 2019: Issue 02 goes to print.
      • 20th of May 2019: We start shipping some Furor your way!

       

      What happened since the Transcendence issue?

      • With your help issue 01 was released in July 2018 and distributed in Beirut, Berlin, Hamburg, Amsterdam, London, Bologna, Milan, Perugia, Venice, Porto, Lisbon, Stockholm, New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Hong Kong, Zhoushan City.
      • The Transcendence issue was nominated for Launch of the Year and Magazine of the Year awards  at the Stack Awards for independent magazines, London. It was named one of the best independent magazines of 2018 at Rayitas Azules blog for editorial design.
      • We’ve organized reading-performances and movement-writing workshops in Szeged, Hungary and Bologna and Milan, Italy.
      • The magazine featured at international publishing events: Indiecon –Hamburg; ModMag –London; Fruit exhibition –Bologna; Sprint –Milan, Milan Book Pride, and soon in Venice Dance Biennale.

       

      Spread the Word!

      If you can't contribute to this campaign, you can still support us by sharing it –spreading the word about a Dance Mag.

      Don't forget to join our communities on: Facebook – Instagram

       

      A BIG THANK YOU FOR THE GREAT ENERGY YOU'RE SENDING OUR WAY!

       

      Video Credits:

      Motion Graphics: Timo Durst & Max Weinland

      Voice Over: Zena Takieddine & Natasha Martin

story:
I'm a writer. My poems, short stories and essays have appeared in more than 250 publications, been anthologized, nominated and shortlisted for numerous prizes, and praised by luminaries including Norman Mailer and David Berman. I live in Brooklyn, New York, with my wife and daughter.

More than just a way to offer discounted pre-order copies of WATERSHED to people who have supported me all these years, this campaign will raise money to potentially produce a large-scale print run that will get WATERSHED into a wider range of bookstores around the country. It will also open up new promotional possibilities.

WATERSHED is the story of a troubled, pregnant woman, and the two men—a snake dealer with a sideline in secret messages and a billionaire living under a false name—who vie for her. As their struggle takes them  through a near-future America of anti-technology enclaves and illegal hospitals, where stockbrokers moonlight as assassins, nurses procure obscure pleasures, a deeper, deadlier mystery emerges.

And it's getting some pretty great reviews.

“(R)eaders will never be quite sure what lurks around the next corner… An appealing mix of adventure and contemplation.” - Kirkus Reviews

“(T)he world of WATERSHED is a vibrant one, packed to the gills with absurd and yet oddly-believable detail – everything from a September 11th memorial service that involves a full-scale recreation of the original terrorist attack, to a man who gets off on being locked in a coffin with a bag full of cats... Dodds manages to make all this and more seem not just possible, but vivid and tangible too.... It’s the real deal…a strong contender to be one of the most interesting books you’ll read this year.” - IndieReader Reviews (4.7/5 Stars)

"The masterfully dystopian WATERSHED unpacks the future of a modern America that, while spectacular, nobody was expecting… It’s a future that, as Leonard Cohen sang, is murder. The revelations of prose in WATERSHED makes that murder enjoyable… one of the few things worth believing in.” - Two Thirds North

These days, t seems the only way to write fiction that's not out of date by the time it's finished is to have it take place in the future. That's what makes WATERSHED a topical and incisive adventure through a surprising but believable tomorrow. It's a uniquely optimistic look ahead.  

WATERSHED is something I've been working on for years now. I'm proud of it. And while self-publishing is a demanding, labor-intensive venture, this book is worth it.

If you help, you will be supporting a noble endeavor. You will add to the stock of literature in the world.  And I'll be grateful for your support.

What's more, I'll send you a reward, including a limited-edition copy of WATERSHED, produced exclusively for Indiegogo contributors.

Even if I don't reach the goal, I will still launch the book in May, with a smaller print run, and a less-extensive, more DIY marketing campaign. This will be the fifth novel I'll have published, and I've picked up a few tricks along the way.  

And don't worry if you can't contribute. You can still help.

  • Join the mailing list to find out about discounts, giveaways and events! 

  • Check out some free things to read at thecolindodds.com

  • Spread the word about WATERSHED, and about the campaign!

story:
My Story:

My name is Angela Latta, owner and operator of Angela’s Own Homestyle Originals dried packaged dips, soups, and ready to eat sweet spreads.  When I started in 1997, my goal from the beginning was to make every recipe I create quick and easy to prepare and full of flavor while using simple,  quality ingredients.  My very first four lonely dip varieties I created went with me to any little craft sales I could find.  They were an instant hit with people coming back for more, and soon after I expanded the flavors and added soups and sweet spreads to the mix.  Everyone loved how easy it was, how great they tasted and they wanted more.  So that’s exactly what I did.  20 years later you are enjoying 11 dip, 5 soup, and 2 sweet spread flavors with the same simplicity as it began. 

Since I really enjoy creating and experimenting,  I got busy cooking up a storm for my many willing testers.  I started sharing my ideas and recipes which resulted in overwhelming requests from friends, family, and customers for copies of them so I started a facebook page and began posting.  In less than a year I hit my goal of 150 successful recipes using my products.

As the number of recipes grew, I had many of you asking for printouts, where you could get a hard copy of them all, and even more were requesting  an actual cookbook.  Creating and publishing a cookbook is not a fast nor inexpensive process, but after over 500 hours of hard work, here it is in the final stages and so close to getting into your hands!  It’s been an exciting whirlwind of a year getting to this point and now I need your help to get it to the publisher and make this happen.

We’ve got 35 days to raise $5000 to cover a portion of the expenses and development costs and, as you can see, I’ve got a few great incentives to thank you with in return!  Along with each of these incentives, your name will also be listed on the thank you page in the cookbook.  Any amounts under these levels will also be very much appreciated and will still help in getting a little bit closer to the goal. 

Please share this anywhere you can as much as you can.  Thank you all SO much for helping be a part of bringing this project to life.  This is super exciting, so let’s go make it happen!

story:
The book is a novel that tells the story of four families of different political ideologies and social classes in Venezuela during the Chávez government. Through the stories of these families, the reader sees how Chávez came to power, positioned himself and managed to control the masses. The story involves the reader in the idiosyncrasies of the Venezuelan population while showing the strengths and weaknesses of the Chavista leader and his environment of ambition, control and power. In this way, the reader realizes how the country with the largest oil reserves in the world, who was once the place with the happiest people on earth, is submerged today in a terrible crisis.


"A novel created from real stories of real people who lived and made the history of Venezuela in the last two decades"

This story is told from the point of view of families that genuinely experienced the struggles that the book describes. Speaking from the point of view of these families allowed the writers to create a story that is historically very accurate, but also very humane, raw and powerful. It allows the reader to capture the delicacy of the subtle moments in the life of the characters and also to feel the pain and understand the magnitude of the events that occurred. It's a very real and very intimate reading experience.

CONCEPT:

The book is divided into 3 chapters: I) Hope and Glory. II) Confrontation, Alliances and External Powers. III) Paranoia and Decadence. Three key stages of Chavism, between power, ambition, ingenuity, illusion, fantasy, black magic, witchcraft, appropriation, autocracy, destructuring, betrayal, frustration, gratitude, subsidies, obsession, and fortuitous disappearances.

The name of the book is based on the popular expression: "Better to be a Tail of a Lion than a Head of a Mouse" or vice versa,  or vice versa, meaning that it is better to be at the tail of the larger ones, than at the head of the smallest. Here we have adopted both ends "Head of a Lion and Tail of a mouse", representing, on one hand, the great “head” that was Chávez, who managed to occupy the highest position in his country. Although he was not an intellectual, he had great mental capacity, was intelligent, diligent for his purposes and aware of his ability to manipulate. Through his leadership, Chávez promoted to stay in the memory of the people as a historical character in the scale of Simon Bolivar and Jesus Christ. The tail, on the other hand, represents all the dirty and hidden moves which he took in order to achieve Chavism’s goals.

The concept The concept is reflected in the illustration on the cover of the book: a large dark lion head, representing the leader and his circle, located on the left side, with his back to the right, or in accordance with Chávez, with his back to capitalism. On the right side, seen from the Chavist ideology as the negative side, is the tail, illustrating the connection from the highest position down to the last one of the line, and from capitalism to socialism, all connected and involved in the misfortune of the country. 
 

¿And you? 
¿Do you want to be a Tail of a Lion or a Head of a Mouse?

 

WHY?:  

Our generation has the responsibility to deeply understand and leave a printed record for future generations about what's going on now in Venezuela and what has happened in the past two decades.

It is very important that we create enough literature so that future generations, as well as our own, are able to sufficiently understand what is going on.

There is no better way to communicate social and historical events than literature. Because literature and art, in general, have the ability to connect with people on a very deep, personal level. 

Please join this project today and help us reach our goal and make this book a reality, so that we can share this story with as many people as possible around the world.

WHERE?: The essential core of the story takes place in Venezuela, some scenes happen or make reference to Norway, the United States (mainly Miami), Spain, Cuba and Colombia, and other South American countries. The book has been written between Venezuela and France, it will be translated between Argentina and France, and it will be distributed in all the parts of the world that we can reach. The book will be distributed for FREE to libraries and cultural centers.

WHEN?: The idea of the project was born in Venezuela, in 2014 Carolina started compiling information, at the end of 2016 Kévin became interested in the idea and proposed to be part of the project, convert the book in a novel and write it in French, at beginning of 2017 they started to work together, and today, finally the book is already written. We just need to complete the fundraising phase in order to cover the costs of translation, reproduction, and distribution.

Crowdfunding Campaign: from 26 April to 22 May 2019

Translation phase: from 23 May 23 to 22 June 2019

Printing phase*: from 23 to 30 June 2019

eBook distribution: starting on 25 June 2019

Print distribution: starting on 1 July 2019

Audiobook distribution: starting on 1 July 2019

 

*Book Size: 209 pages, format 15x 23  cm

 

THE TEAM:

Kévin Heraud (The writer):  French, graduated in humanities and scientific culture, currently doing a research masters degree in religions and societies at the University of Bordeaux. Interested mainly in the study of the human being, in the widest possible sense. 

Fascinated by literature, amateur musician, writer of lyrics and poetry. 

Carlos H. València (Editor and translator of the book): Colombian, 29 years old. French philologist of the National University of Colombia (UN Bogotá). Style corrector, editor and text translator. Translator of subtitles of films and series English / Spanish for Univisión for several years. Student of social communication at the University of Buenos Aires (UBA). Amateur musician Lover of literature, poetry, photography, and art in general.

Shirly de Mattern (Collaborator and Public Relations of the project): Venezuelan, cultural manager, and event organizer. With a wide cultural background, director of the Colectivo Libre Cultura, with experience in Grupo Editorial Cyngular, magazine El Librero, magazine The Challenge of the History of Venezuela and cultural promoter for the Bigott Foundation.

Uma’s mom, a big dreamer since she was a child, an entrepreneur since she was young, and hard-working since she was born in a home where she was taught that everything you want can be achieved with effort and work, a professional dancer, a lover of art and culture and a tourist ambassador for her country.

Carolina Durán (Co-author of the book): from the University of Los Andes (ULA - Venezuela) and the National University of Colombia (UN - Bogotá), photographer (Indigenous of Venezuela documentary), student Master's Degree in Anthropology from the Autonomous University of Barcelona (UAB - España).

Born and raised in a humble neighborhood around Caracas, a neighborhood that later became a marginal and dangerous area during Chávez's government until now.

Her life developed between the academic and Andean city of Mérida, in a bohemian environment and of great scene cultural and intellectual; the most controversial and concurrent border between Venezuela and Colombia (San Antonio del Táchira and Cúcuta), where she has been able to notice the great transboundary exchange movements (economic and migratory), and Caracas, where she has worked as an art director in advertisement for Coca Cola, in a middle-class environment and generalized opposition to the Chavism, and the General Inspectorate of the Courts in an environment linked to the state of government.

Tireless explorer, passionate about cultural diversity and human behavior, fan of her family and her country. After having visited different countries, and many cultures explored, today, like many of her compatriots, she is in exile residing in Spain.

COLLABORATION: We are open to all people and organizations who are interested in participating in the project, either with observations, volunteering, distribution or as a part of the team. You can send your comments, recommendations or requests to herauduran@gmail.com

AMOUNTS to cover to finish the project:

Translation French to Spanish ...................... ............................................. 1600€
Spanish English to Translation .................... ................................................ 1600€ 
Literary edition and correction (Spanish, English, and French) .................... 1500€ 
Final revision (Spanish, English, and French) .............................................. 1200€ 
Graphic edition and layout for printing (Spanish, English, and French) ..........600€
Layout Ebook (Spanish, English, and French) ......................................... ......500€ 
Obtaining the ISBN ............................................................................ ...............60€ 
Book printing (Spanish version) 1000 copies ......................................... ..... 2600€ 
Book printing (English version) 300 copies ......................................... .........1200€ 
Book printing (French version) 300 copies ......................................... ......... 1200€
Production and editing Audiobook (Venezuelan Spanish version) ...............1000 €
Online distribution Audiobook and PDF (Spanish, English, and French) ........100€ 
Printed promotional material (Spanish, English, and French) .........................400€
Promotional material for digital content (Spanish, English, and French) ........200€
Logistics and distribution of the printed book ................. ..............................1200€
 

THANKS: We are grateful for all those people who have supported us in carrying out this project up to the point where it is now.

Also thanks to Claudine Heraud Egretier, Alain Heraud, Cecilia Guzman Martinez, Laura Llaborie, Daniel Poza, Virginia Villegas, Diego Villamizar, Antonio Montilla, Gianna Sanchez and Mads Aaserud for inspiration and momentum.

Special thanks to Shahar Edelstein, who has supported the book since it was just an idea and has not stopped encouraging to follow and provide consulting collaboration.

A big thank you!
