story:
My name is Eric Horn, and I grew up with the book Scary stories to tell in the dark. The stories and the illustrations really captured my imagination as a child. My goal here is to create a similar book using my own personal stories and a few stories based on folklore for children ages 8 and up. I have a great imagination for story telling and I would love to bring my imagination to the mind of new readers. I want to bring my stories to life, and I need your help I am asking for 10,000 dollars the more money raised the more books I can put out, I am also going to use a large portion of the funds raised to pay an illustrator to twist the mind into a world of the macabre like Scary stories to tell in the dark did for so many of us.  Any contribution to my project will be greatly appreciated. This year has been hard due to a lay off from my job things have gradually started picking up, but I would like help to get this project and many more projects out to the readers and fans of horror short stories.   Here are a few snippets from Nightmare Diary if you want to know what happens please contribute.   

                                                      Did you hear about Judith

Young Danny was asleep one night when he gets a knock on his window.  it was Danny's friend long time friend and secret admirer Judith. She pours out her feelings for Danny but when Danny tells her he just wants to ne friends, the next day his whole life is turned upside down.      

                                                         The Lightning Storm

All alone at home while her parents celebrate their anniversary. A horrible lightning storm knocks out the power. Scared and alone and unable to see until flashes of lighting reveal something menacing lurking outside her bedroom window.  

                                                         Band-Aid Mouth

Six year old Sam's dad brings home one of the creepiest dolls home from a yard sale. Sam is disturbed by the dolls macabre appearance untill Sams dad gives it a silly name. Sam finds out later that night the doll is just as evil as his appearance.

story:
THE TRUTH BEHIND THE LIE:

There’s never been a media disaster bigger than this; there’s also never been a more perfect one.

When you’re Oscar royalty, you never dream of fame and fortune being a fabrication. Nineteen year-old Olivia Ashbury would bet hard cash on that, until the night she realized she was starring in the biggest government block buster to hit the New York Times: her life. Or at least her illusion of it. 

You may not remember her, but you know her all too well. Before, Olivia Ashbury’s name resonated globally through your YouTube pages, demolished primetime television and polished itself beside high-priced brands: until the unthinkable happened. Now it’s your turn to access the gated communities, live like an Idol and hold the behind the scenes information on the scandals Perez Hilton can’t attain and the Illuminati covered up. It’s with this series of memoirs that Olivia will begin to tell her journey from stardom to the downfall that leads her to question the throne on which she rules. Everyone’s favorite Barbie Bitch may be a piece of art, but the ugliness coiling inside of her will burn her Angel wings and Ignite the true nightmare within. Who ever said heroines were pure? 

{WANT TO READ A SAMPLE CHAPTER? Click over to the "Updates" page.}

Genre: New Adult/Young Adult/Urban Fantasy

Related series: Gossip Girl & True Blood

*PLEASE NOTE: By contributing to this campaign you'll be unveiling the truth behind the lies that the Illuminati's covered up for centuries. Olivia Ashbury is ready to tell her story, and she won't take "no" for an answer. 

MEET THE GIRL BEHIND THE STORY:

Kaitlyn Malone is the girl behind the story. Born and raised in Canada’s North Hollywood, at only nineteen years-old the actress and YouTuber is adding author to her belt as she singlehandedly builds an empire around the biggest celebrity in history, one who’s reportedly hired her to write, produce and deliver her memoirs to the masses. And despite her age, Kaitlyn’s a dark horse in an ancient market. With youth, insight and indestructible fearlessness on her side, she’s established to bring a new revolution to the book industry that the monopolized publishing houses have snubbed. Taking her acting, directing and storytelling chops to the board, she’s designed a marketing genius that only a girl partnered with a Hollywood Idol could pull off. But according to her, life’s not all glamour and pretty lies. She’s not quick to sensor raw truth and even slower to dismiss the ones who’ve done her wrong when commercializing Olivia’s story. The tables are being turned. And as scripture says, Karma’s a bitch. Thankfully, she’s an even bigger one. Because if you learn anything from her, you’ll know this isn’t a sob story.

BREAKING ALL THE RULES:

My goal with this series is to revolutionize the book industry like never before. Gone are the days of lining up to watch an author sign your book before being dismissed. I'm ready to merge the worlds of YouTube and acting into the page turners that transform our wildest dreams. In doing so I plan on not only plastering the world with Olivia's image and story but collaborating with your favorite YouTubers and creating a theatrical book signing that will leave you on the edge of your seats. What else would you expect when teaming up with the one and only Olivia Ashbury? We're ready to Ignite your imaginations and light up your world like never before. I'm prepared to create the ultimate fan experience through videos, giveaways, personal appearances and more. 

BLOOD, SWEAT & GLITTER:
{Or} MAIN GOALS:
We want everyone to get their hands on a copy. The goal for IGNITED is to not only deliver a unique paperback and special edition hardcover, but for IGNITED to be available in multiple locations and formats such as eBooks on Amazon and audio editions on Audible. As of now our primary focus is on Canada, the United States and the United Kingdom (Australia is also in the running). We're also aiming to have IGNITED sold in-store at retail locations such as Chapters Indigo and Barns & Noble. 
Lights. Cameras. ACTION! the Olivia Ashbury memoirs campaign is a visual experience. This means we plan of creating dramatic mini commercial ads featuring known songs and starring Kaitlyn Malone, as well as your  favorite YouTubers (NAMES SOON TO BE ANNOUNCED!!!). The content will be posted on Kaitlyn Malone's YouTube channel with high potential to be featured on various collaborated channels. 
*FUTURE GOALS: Book signings may be at the end of the red campaign carpet but this revolution didn't stop at the silver screen. Kaitlyn Malone has developed the ultimate signing experience that merges a classic book signing with a theatrical event. An elaborate stage, fancy dresses, and bringing Olivia's story beyond the pages into the real world by acting as her PR and co-author to reveal the truth behind the tabloids. There will be glitz, glamour, Q&A's, readings, and all of the inside scoop on Olivia Ashbury that you could dream of! 
the Olivia Ashbury memoirs is also a social experience to merge YouTubers, Instagramers, Tumblrs, Viners, & more to develop the ultimate fan experience through video content, collaborations... 

And it gets better:

My first act in #IGNITED2015 was to allow Instagrammers I've followed for years (and new discoveries) to produce pictures for the series. Meet @jillianlee_x, who won my Instagram #IGNITEDCOVERCONTEST to produce promotional content for the Olivia Ashbury memoirs. Her photography and style is impeccable, and the fact that she's so excited to collaborate on IGNITED earns her status next to Olivia herself. Make sure to check out her photography on Instagram & start following her ASAP!

THE TRUTH BEHIND THE LIE:




There’s
never been a media disaster bigger than this; there’s also never been a more perfect
one.
When
you’re Oscar royalty, you never dream of fame and fortune being a fabrication.
Nineteen year-old Olivia Ashbury would bet hard cash on that, until the night
she realized she was starring in the biggest government block buster to hit the
New York Times: her life. Or at least her illusion of it.  
You
may not remember her, but you know her all too well. Before, Olivia Ashbury’s
name resonated globally through your YouTube pages, demolished primetime
television and polished itself beside high-priced brands: until the unthinkable
happened. Now it’s your turn to access
the gated communities, live like an Idol and hold the behind the scenes
information on the scandals Perez Hilton can’t attain and the Illuminati covered up. It’s with this series of memoirs that Olivia will begin to tell her journey
from stardom to the downfall that leads her to question the throne on which she
rules. Everyone’s favorite Barbie Bitch may be a piece of art, but the ugliness
coiling inside of her will burn her Angel wings and Ignite the true nightmare within. Who ever said heroines were pure? 
{WANT TO READ A SAMPLE CHAPTER? Click over to the "Updates" page.}
Genre: New Adult/Young Adult/Urban Fantasy
Related series: Gossip Girl & True Blood
*PLEASE NOTE: By contributing to this campaign you'll be unveiling the truth behind the lies that the Illuminati's covered up for centuries. Olivia Ashbury is ready to tell her story, and she won't take "no" for an answer. 
 


MEET THE GIRL BEHIND THE STORY:





Kaitlyn Malone is the girl behind the story. Born and raised in Canada’s North Hollywood, at only nineteen years-old the actress and YouTuber is adding author to her belt as she singlehandedly builds an empire around the biggest celebrity in history, one who’s reportedly hired her to write, produce and deliver her memoirs to the masses. And despite her age, Kaitlyn’s a dark horse in an ancient market. With youth, insight and indestructible fearlessness on her side, she’s established to bring a new revolution to the book industry that the monopolized publishing houses have snubbed. Taking her acting, directing and storytelling chops to the board, she’s designed a marketing genius that only a girl partnered with a Hollywood Idol could pull off. But according to her, life’s not all glamour and pretty lies. She’s not quick to sensor raw truth and even slower to dismiss the ones who’ve done her wrong when commercializing Olivia’s story. The tables are being turned. And as scripture says, Karma’s a bitch. Thankfully, she’s an even bigger one. Because if you learn anything from her, you’ll know this isn’t a sob story.

story:
Welcome to Literary Radio!

This really is a new dimension for literature -- the first radio station just for literature, streaming free online, with exciting new work from all over Europe. We will host all-new English-language series by some great literary partner-producers in many countries. It's a chance to get to know the cultures of Europe a little better - and not just from the EU, but all the 47 countries of Council of Europe, including Russia, Ukraine, Turkey, the entire Balkans. . . and more. Our partners will host audio readings and discussions in English with authors and translators, play "literary music", and bring you news, special events and other exclusive content.

This is real community radio, a great way to get closer to each others' cultures and enjoy some of the best new writing from across the continent. We're getting ready for launch -- and we greatly need your support in getting Trafika Europe Radio on the air.

Our background

Trafika Europe launched its quarterly literary journal last summer -- so we're already bringing you some of the best new literature from Europe, with great photos too! It's available free online in an attractive new kind of digest format -- visitors have told us that our on-screen journal is the first time they really feel comfortable reading great literature online.

You can check out our literary journal here.

Trafika Europe is the successor organization to Trafika, a print quarterly of new writing from around the world in English and English translation. In seven issues, Trafika published the work of over 120 authors writing in over 30 languages. Contributors included Czeslaw Milosz, Tomaz Salamun, Natasza Goerke, Don DeLillo, Gyorgy Konrad, Peter Nadas, Denis Johnson, Yusef Komunyakaa, Martin Simecka, Tor Ulven, Ilona Lackova, and Javiar Marias. We were especially proud to introduce many new voices into English for the first time.

Trafika received glowing reviews in over 30 media outlets, including The New York Times Magazine, Time-International, The New Yorker, The Washington Post, NBC Evening News, BBC Radio. Here is some of the press we received:

Good stuff!
 The Guardian

new voices sing out
 Times Literary Supplement

the writing comes from unexpected sources
 The New Yorker

elegantly presented… ambitious
 Poetry Review

screaming orgasm!
 El Pais

elegant… spreads the net more widely
 The Independent

a model for magazines of the future, bringing together writers… to see what we have in common as well as to celebrate our differences
Laughing Bear Newsletter

PEN International honored our overall achievement with an event in our name.

Our Radio

Now Trafika Europe Radio is taking it to a new level!

Imagine a place online you can visit anytime to hear great streaming audio in English language with new literary readings, author discussions, music and events from across Europe. It's a whole new window on literature!

Our Director is an accomplished internet radio host and producer with more than fifteen years' experience, who has also served as a translator, university teacher of literature and literary translation, editor, literary critic and journalist.

We're joined by partner-producers across the continent -- publishers, literary magazines, and others -- eager to bring you new literature with lots of exciting exclusive content in audio form.

What We Need & What You Get

We are working hard to get this radio station ready for Autumn launch, and need your support:

  • ... to fund some literary partners abroad, who want to produce series and present their cultures on our radio, but can't assemble adequate means;
  • ... to complete our office;
  • ... to get a few tools we need for broadcast-quality post-production, and
  • ... to finish our online interface for streaming and archiving shows.

Won't you participate in this community radio effort with a donation? And enjoy  some great rewards as our thanks:

  • SPECIAL CAMPAIGN OFFER: now you can order our first annual "best-of" anthology for just $20!!! This digest, more than 250 pages, is packed with the very best in recent European literature chosen from the first year of our journal - plus a great bonus text (ssh - it's a surprise). It's a win-win: you get to pre-order the digest at this special campaign price, and we receive this payment as a contribution to the campaign. Just choose this new $20 perk, "donate" at least this much, and we'll post you this anthology digest as soon as it's ready.
  • If you want to give just a little more, then for just $35, we'll send you this "best of" European anthology with your name listed in it! It's a great keepsake, suitable for gifts or enhancing your library. If you buy just one book of literature in translation this season, let it be this one - you'll enjoy great new writing from Europe, and have the satisfaction of knowing you're supporting a good cause, as we get Trafika Europe Radio ready for launch.

    This is less like a perk for donating, and more like a great bargain purchase. We're managing it through the campaign for ease of promotion - and because we really need some more help here bolstering our campaign.

  • For donations of $25 or more, we'll include a pack of nine attractive Trafika Europe avant garde art cards, suitable for framing or mailing . . . or just leave them around for friends to enjoy!

  • With any donation of $50 or above, you'll automatically become a Subscriber, and enjoy access for one year to extra premium streaming audio content monthly, plus discounts on selected books by authors we feature.
  • For larger donations, we have larger rewards! Please see the perks section for more details, including. . .

  • For that special donor at the $2000 level, we'll commission an original painting on a theme of your choice by our resident artist, Mark Boston! Here he is in the photo below, preparing a painting that made it into our recent introductory video. Just say the word, and he will create a painting for your home or office (or to give as a present) on your own chosen theme. (No portraits please.) Theme should be confirmed by private message with our Campaign Team Leader.


Adopt a Culture!

Is there a particular culture you want to support with your donation? For example, are you part Italian or all Irish? Living in the Czech Republic? Do you want to help Greece share its wonderful literature? Curious about new Russian writing?

Fantastic! Just message our Campaign Team Leader, identifying a particular culture from anywhere in the Council of Europe countries when you make your donation, and we'll make sure it gets earmarked with the relevant series -- and that you are thanked on our radio as a supporter of that show!

Trafika Europe Radio is a new piece of cultural infrastructure we can all enjoy

This is a great chance for a fresh-page approach to European cultures, to celebrate the diversity and get to know so many cultures a little better, with the best they have to offer, in English translation.

Trafika Europe seeks . . .

  • . . . to find and attract to what is new and excellent in European literature;
  • . . . to create greater community for Europe through our online radio;
  • . . . to support literary translation and increase mutual regard among cultures;
  • . . . to promote new voices and help writers get publishing contracts in English;
  • . . . to partner with existing literary projects, media, and programs, to honor, connect, and promote their efforts;
  • . . . to explore issues of belonging in Europe, such as migration and race, toward building more united and caring communities, overcoming divides of class, religion, nationality and ethnicity, and
  • . . . to be a bridge between traditional and online publishing, explore innovative approaches, and build enthusiasm for European literature among a new generation online.

Now more than ever, such efforts are sorely needed, if we want to maintain a spirit of belonging together and keep cultures open and growing together across the continent of Europe. Doing this by attracting hearts and minds together through culture is the easiest way. It's a shared effort we can all support – but not a difficult one! It’s a joy to support literature in this way, and we hope to attract widest participation with this radio project.

Trafika Europe was pleased to have served as a media partner with the New Literature from Europe festival in New York City in December. You can find some great audio interviews we made there, with participating European authors and with the publisher of New Directions.

We want to connect people through culture. Can you help us? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute. . . but we're still so happy for your help:

  • Won't you please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign? We're grateful for any tweeting and posting on social media, emailing to friends and colleagues, reviews and blogging. . . and thanks so much! We are really dependent on your kindness for sharing news about our efforts.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools where possible. This helps us in the rankings, toward greater visibility for this campaign.

Together we can help this project fulfill its great promise, as a new way to enjoy literature from other cultures in English language, free online. Please support Trafika Europe Radio, and let's make it happen! Thank you so much for your help.

story:
Hi my name is Jacory Wiley. When I was five years old, m eye was injured by glass and I was immediately blind in my right eye. As a result of the trauma, I developed a rare eye disease called Sympathetic Opthalmia. This is basically where my body or immune system does not recognize my left eye, which is my good eye, and it is trying to injure it as if it is a disease or infection. As a result, I had some decreased vision in my left eye. I had forty plus surgeries in my life time. I am twenty three years old, but none of that matters to me. I am still driven to make my vision come true. I had to overcome many trials and adversity in my life, but I pride myself on overcoming it all. Right now, I am training for the Para Olympics, which will be in Brazil. I play beep baseball for the City of Houston.

Hi my name is Jacory Wiley. When I was five years old, m eye was injured by glass and I was immediately blind in my right eye. As a result of the trauma, I developed a rare eye disease called Sympathetic Opthalmia. This is basically where my body or immune system does not recognize my left eye, which is my good eye, and it is trying to injure it as if it is a disease or infection. As a result, I had some decreased vision in my left eye. I had forty plus surgeries in my life time. I am twenty three years old, but none of that matters to me. story:
The Campaign (first round) has ended, and we now have a site! Do check out

http://www.happyrainbowworld.com

to keep following our journey in producing and writing the book!

Vanessa would like to tell her story and motivate those with disabilities to live a fulfilling life of happiness and hope. " A Happy Rainbow World " is the working title of the book she hopes to publish, first online, and later, as a hard copy.

The $5000 will be used to offset the costs of domain registration, webhosting for a year, the design of the website which will feature parts of the ebook and her graphic design work.

Vanessa is currently an installation artist as well as a freelance graphic designer, and this site will help showcase her works.

"If you have a positive mind set you already half succeeded BUT if you think "cannot make it" you will definitely fail the mission. Most important is how you think for all obstacle be brave to go for options.

Dear Me,
I am Vanessa Leong Yu Qi, a bowler, a cheerful girl would be my character no matter how hard things in life become I will still be able to put a smile on my face upon handling. Do i struggle emotionally? Yes, I do. Once when I was on the train on my way to school, a stranger approached me due to my positive characteristic despite medical condition. That's probably the thing I like most about myself. Ever asked myself this question "why am I seeing the doctor? Guess the only answer would be to maintain my health and do checks so if any new problems in health would be able to receive early cures or even good  news. Talking about seeing doctor often asked myself this question: am I scared of seeing? Yes! But I have to go so that things won't get worse who knows doctor visit will turn up to be a good news.Machines need to do their check so am I. Some of the most difficult things my illness would bring me to would be going to the doctors and receiving updates from them which most of the time would be bad news BUT within bad news there are still acceptable options with regards to treatment and medications will give me a HOPE for tomorrow. Some times even good news.

Different people will see chronic illness in many different ways. I have come across almost all kinds of people. Came across many BUT I am just going to list down a few only. One, chronic illness succeed in their life. Two, people with chronic illness will always the people with sad emotions. Third would be chronic illness people will always keep going especially during difficult situations and would thought that I am on the second type but actually type three.

The things that I would like to change about how people see chronic illness would be "People with Chronic illness are people who are not able to be independent where by they can". "People suffering from chronic illness can do thing that others cannot". "People with Chronic illness will tend to be more patient with difficult situation". Most important is people with chronic illness can still lead a positive life"

The above is written by Vanessa a few years back, and from that small excerpt, you can see how positive a person she is!

The ebook and site will be co-created by Vivien Goh, who has done several websites for companies based in Singapore. As time is of the essence ( Vanessa is due for a series of major surgeries and may be in too much pain to concentrate on producing the site and book), do assist in the fulfillment of her dream and her gift to the world.

story:
My name is Kimberly Harris. I'm writing this letter praying someone will read it and will be willing to help my son who is 27 years old serving a 57 year sentence in Menard Correctional Center for a crime he didn't commit.

On May 30, 2006, a young man was killed in our neighborhood. The same night, two young men from our neighborhood were taken into custody for questioning and, as we understand, were held for approximately 30 hours, until they gave the name of the alleged murderer. My son, Andre, was named by these young men mentioned, even though he absolutely did not commit this crime. I took Andre in for questioning, per the advisement of Chicago police officers. I never thought that he would be charged with first degree murder in June, 2006.

Andre’s trial started on November 13, 2007. My 19-year old son at that time was found guilty of murder with no physical evidence being presented by the state’s attorney. Again, there was no physical evidence to support this conviction. I had never seen such an injustice. The system failed my son tremendously. The state presented two witnesses, one who recanted his earlier statement implicating my son and another who made numerous conflicting and contradictory statements. The first witness, Mr. Anderson, told the jury that he had to tell the truth because he did not want an innocent person to go to jail for something he did not do. The second witness changed her initial statements and testimony that she gave to the police and the grand jury. Later on into the investigation it was discovered that two known drug dealers in the neighborhood paid her off to lie and say my son murdered this young man. This young lady was involved with my son’s father years ago and she still had a grudge against me. During the trail there was no evidence presented. There was no murder weapon, no finger prints, no blood or DNA, and nothing else which connected my son to the crime.

On the other hand, there were four witnesses that the defense (my son’s attorneys) presented to testify about my son's whereabouts at the time of the murder. The judge also did not allow us to present a 911 Emergency call in which someone else identified another man as the shooter. There was no evidence against my son.

I've always believed that a person was innocent until proven guilty and that a person cannot be convicted on non-concrete, invalid, and untrustworthy information. My son has not been proven guilty beyond a reasonable doubt, but he has instead been the victim of a wrongful conviction within the legal system. The judge would not allow all of the defense’s evidence to be presented during the trial, and, as a result my son was unable to have the jury hear the provable, substantiated, undeniable facts that they needed to hear to render their decision.

Unfortunately, there are many innocent people in prison, and I do not want my son to be one of the casualties. He is innocent, and given the opportunity, it can be proven in a court of law with a fair and impartial judge and a jury that renders a decision based upon the evidence. My faith and belief is that justice will prevail. I refuse to let my son be one of the numerous victim of injustice. At the time my son was convicted of murder, not only did the state not prove their case beyond a reasonable doubt, there was no physical evidence to tie my son to the murder. They acknowledged that their own witnesses were liars, yet this is what sent my son to prison for 57 years. The trial was not conducted in a fair manner and the jury did not have the opportunity to make a decision based on all the evidence being presented to them. This is a cry for help from me and my family. My son needs help, and our family is continuing to pray for his release and for his record to be cleared. He had never been in trouble with the law. I am fighting for his life, and will do so to the bitter end. We, as a nation, cannot let our young innocent men continue to be unjustly incarcerated and their youth taken away before they have the opportunity to make positive contributions to their communities and their families. We just can't let that happen.

The injustice experienced Jena, Louisiana is unfortunately all over this nation. We have to put a stop to the systemic injustices that our innocent young black men are facing as their spirits are being broken down to nothing. It's time to take charge of our young black men lives. I can't and won't let this system take my innocent son’s freedom away from him. If there is anyone that can help me save my son, please don't hesitate to contact his family or donate to help with his legal fees. We need everyone’s help. Contact Information Kim Harris. Why is it that  no one wants to help the innocent. I refuse to let this prejudice society take my son away from me. I'm tired of people telling me the judicial system is messed up. I know that, so why isn't anyone doing anything about it. Where is all the black leaders that supposed to care about our black young men. They’re all full of hot air, a lot of talk and no action. I’m a mother of a 27 year old young man, fighting for his innocence and freedom. It has been so hard on me and my family, Andre has two sisters that miss him tremendously.

story:
What is  The Bacalao Conspiracy  Project?

The Bacalao Conspiracy looks at the events preceding the first voyage of Christopher Columbus in an attempt to inform the discussion surrounding the voyage and its effect on world affairs. The last half of the fifteenth century is seen through the eyes of three remarkable women whose lives are intimately connected to Columbus, and whose influence on him and his decision to sail west has been ignored in the current debate. Susanna Fontanarossa, Phillippa Perestrella Moniz, and Beatriz Enrique De Arana (his mother, his wife, and his mistress) were from very different cultures, and very different places but they shared one singular condition. They loved, and were loved by one of the world’s most famous men.

The Bacalao Conspiracy also looks at a unique group of people from northern Spain and southern France, known as the Basque. This close-knit cabal of warrior-sailors and fishermen had been exploiting the world’s richest fishery off the coast of Newfoundland for more than a generation, and the increased focus of the day on reaching Asia by sailing west jeopardized the vast fortune being made from that endeavor.

As these women live their lives, we explore the turbulent transition from the Late Middle Ages to the Renaissance in such places as Genoa, Madeira, Lisbon, Bilbao, Bayonne, Cordoba, Seville, and Huelva. We see these places from street level. We smell their food cooking, the aromas of commerce and daily life. We taste the food, experience the conflict, and feel the excitement of a world on the edge of expansion: a world whose boundaries were exploding.

This is the story of how these women turned a travelling salesman, the son of a middle class weaver, into the Admiral of the Ocean Sea. It’s the story of how the Basques used these women, and a fish, to change everything.

You already know how Christopher’s story ends. We have all known since grade school. 
Help me show the world how it began.


What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking your support for promoting and marketing Susanna, Mother of Columbus, the first book in a series of four. The list below shows how much I anticipate needing for the various activities before and after publishing. In Risks and Challenges I go into more detail about the specific plans. Most of the writing is done and Susanna is ready for editing.

Crowd-funding Expenses  $1,800.00

Amount includes Indiegogo fees, merchandise costs, and shipping, presuming full funding.

Marketing   $1,200.00

  Includes cost of books for reviews and merchandise for promotion

   Tour Expenses  $1,500.00

  Includes  books for signing, travel/lodging expenses. 

 Food Samples  $500.00

  Includes food for public appearances and demonstrations

 Editing (Susanna)  $1,500.00 

  Total
  $6,500.00  


                            


Who is John Maxwell?

John Maxwell is a chef. He is recognized by the American Culinary Federation as a Certified Executive Chef and Certified Culinary Educator.  He is a member of the American Acadamy of Chefs., His cooking program, Chef Maxwell's Kitchen, has been televised in more than 80 markets throughout the US. His cooking skills are featured in many videos on You Tube and elsewhere.

He has written and published stories, poetry, cookbooks, and magazine articles. His first novel, Susanna, Mother of Columbus, will be published in early September, 2015..

He was born in the town of Buzzards Bay, on Cape Cod, Massachusetts. His sense of adventure and love of travel was shaped early as he grew up on the Cape, and in Oakland, California, Brooklyn, New York, and Virginia Beach, Virginia. As an adult, he has worked across the United States in nearly every kind of kitchen, from his stint as hot dog cook at Candlestick Park in the early 70’s, to his own highly regarded restaurant in Richmond, Virginia. He has cooked for dignitaries and world leaders, and spent much of his time working to combat hunger and improve nutrition for the most at risk of our neighbors.

He is now semi-retired, dividing his time between the Bacalao Conspiracy and teaching hospitality management and culinary arts at Stratford University


Risks & Challenges

Without your help we will not be able to  secure the services of a qualified editor to refine and correct Susanna, Mother of Columbus.

I am a chef and believe that I am a good writer, but as a chef I understand the difference between an amateur and a professional. My writing needs the guidance of a professional.

Without your help I will not be able to provide advance copies of the book for reviewers and buyers and will have to rely on blind luck that enough people will discover the work on Amazon to make it successful.

Without your help I will not be able to arrange visits to bookstores and other places to promote my book and to sign copies for people. The promotion of Susanna, Mother of Columbus depends on your support.

There are three stages in producing and publishing a book.

1.  The research, outlining, and writing of the work.

2.  Professional editing to make sure the work is up to public standards.

3.  Arranging for a publisher/printer to produce the actual work.

Each of these steps is complete with a couple of exceptions.

First, some work remains on three of the books with respect to the actual writing. Susanna is completed. Phillippa is nearly completed. The first draft is finished and it is undergoing revisions now. Most of the research for Beatriz is completed and the writing has begun. The final piece, The Bacalao Conspiracy, is about one third finished.

Second, an editor has been arranged for Susanna. The work is finished pending any adjustments the editor may suggest.

Third, An account has been opened in Create Space for Susanna. Cover design, formatting, and illustrations are complete and as soon as the editor’s recommendations are reviewed and implemented, the work will be loaded into Create Space and be available on Amazon.

The funds I am seeking from you will be directed primarily to the marketing and promotion of Susanna. I expect sales of Susanna, Mother of Columbus to generate funds for editing and marketing Phillippa and for the two to support Beatriz.

Without your support it will be very difficult for the sales of Susanna to support the development of the project.

 The Bacalao Conspiracy

Susanna has her own Twitter account which will be promoted after the book is published and there is a face book page for the project

  Bacalao Conspiracy Facebook Page

                 

 Not Everyone Can Pledge Money, 

                         But They Can Still Help.

Funds are important. Without financial support the process of spreading the word about Susanna, Mother of Columbus will take a long time. But this project needs help in other ways as well. Please push this project out on your social media sites. Tell everyone you can to visit here and/or the website. I want to change the conversation about Christopher Columbus.

But this project needs help in other ways as well. Please push this project out on your social media sites. Tell everyone you can to visit here and/or the website. I want to change the conversation about Christopher Columbus.

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Alisa Kathryn Stapelman. I am an Author, photographer, wife, mother, and grandmother. I wrote, published, and created my first trailer in 2014. Since then I have been working relentlessly to get the 2nd book finished. Let me state I am by no means an expert but I have some of the best people in the business helping me.

After filming, editing, and showing the trailer for the 1st book. I realized that I was going to need serious help with the 2nd trailer. I wanted to produce a book trailer unlike any other I had seen. So I went out to find a local production company that would be as passionate about my books as I am. I found that in Occulus Films (http://www.occulusfilms.com).

With Occulus Films help, I will be able to produce a book trailer unlike any you have seen before. Think a movie trailer that brings you to the edge of your seat and leaves you wanting more.

The Funds:

If we raise the needed funds, they will be used to shoot the book trailer, pay for the Book Launch Party and any monies left over will be donated to Rebuilding Warriors. Once the trailer is finished, it will be premiered at the Book Launch Party on October 17, 2015.

If we go over that goal, we do have other ideas we'd like to make happen….

Stretch Goals:

If you help us meet our first goal of $9,000, we have some other special goals we’d like to go for as well and any money that is left over from the goals will be donated to our favorite charity Rebuilding Warriors:

$18,000 - - Re-shoot?:

This stretch goal means we will be able to re-shoot the 1st book trailer, I Believe.

$27,000 - - A 3rd Book?:

This stretch goal means we will be able to not only re-shoot the 1st book trailer, but also be able to shoot the trailer for the 3rd book in the series!

Risk and Challenges

There aren’t many risks we can think of, although things can happen. But we are hoping that everything runs smoothly with filming, the cast and crew.

The only challenges that we can think of is actually completing our goals, but we are confident that with your support, we can reach those goals and beyond.

Just a closing note, we want to thank you for viewing our project and or your helping pledge.  It means the world to us to be able to make this project happen.

Other ways you can help

We know not everyone will be able to contribute to this project. But if you want to help, that would be great! How, you ask?

Spread the word to all your friends and family. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Blast it on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, wherever you can!

story:
Have you ever thought about writing your life story, sharing life-altering events? Do you really know about the lives of your loved ones, your family heritage? If you've ever thought about capturing your life story or that of your loved ones, now is the time.  

Introducing Our Life Story, a new and exciting interactive website where you and your family can capture your life stories, thoughts and photos to preserve and share through written, audio and film.   Our Life Story will serve everyone in need of a simple and affordable way of capturing, preserving and sharing their memories, experiences, wisdom, photos and make sure their story is told and passed down.


Storytelling has been a way of life for thousands of years, but as we get older...... life gets busier and living apart from another in various time zones, has us missing out on those everyday opportunities to remember and share our stories with family and friends. We are all missing out on valuable life lessons and empathy for the experiences of generations before us.

Sharing our stories is fulfilling.  It is something we can all do, it brings people closer and is a great way to pass down history.  It is about understanding ourselves, others and our world . These powerful stories illustrate our shared humanity and show how much more we share in common than divides us and that is why we created Our Life Story.

Help us establish this significant initiative to serve everyone for as little as $50.00, giving you membership to “WriteMyStory” where you or your loved ones can capture your stories online, add photos and create a beautiful digital book to share with family and friends. You will be surprised what you discover.  Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!

“No one is commonplace, and I doubt if you can ever read a biography from which you cannot learn something from the difficulties overcome and the struggles made to succeed. These are the measuring rods for the progress of humanity.”  

- Pres. Spencer W. Kimball.

These words run deep through everything we are doing here at OurLifeStory.  We have an insatiable passion for helping others tell their story so they can share it with their family, friends and people who can benefit. Did you know writing about your life helps with your memory?  It also helps train you to express yourself? Writing also helps you review lessons you have learned in the past.  This is where we started to envision “Our Life Story” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:

-  Inspiration through story telling,

-  Learn about family members who are no longer here,

-  Pass down family heritage, by recording families memories before we loose them,

-  Gain clearer perspective on personal experiences and feelings, which in turn brings greater meaning to life,

-  Gain greater self-knowledge, stronger self-image and enhanced self-esteem,

-  Have the pleasure of sharing cherished experiences and insight with others,

-  A way of releasing certain burdens and validating personal experiences, this is in fact central to the recovery process,

-  Helps us and others to better understand ourselves, in ways we haven’t before,

-  By understanding past and present, we derive a clearer perspective of our goals for the future, 

-  Help to create community and show we have more in common with one another than we thought.

When reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel executed properly, we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to tell their story and give their life a medium.  Our features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed in the online journaling industry.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us a key player if not leader in the industry. Our mission is to take care of every funder, supporter and member with the upmost respect and care.  We are good listeners and we feel this will be the key to our growth.

So how does it work?

"WriteMyStory" is the first of four interactive storytelling platforms, designed around the most popular real life stories people want to share, making it simple, affordable and a fun way for you to retell your stories.

Step 1. Log into your private member's area and answer our carefully selected questions that will help make it easy to remember and share your most inspired, life changing moments, those you never want to forget!

Step 2. Submit your answers to us along with any photos you would like to share for each "chapter" in your story.

Step 3. We will format your story into a beautiful eBook you can email and share with your family and friends. Hard cover print books are also available for our members at a massive discount.


With my life coaching background and assisted by a team of experts, we have developed a series of thought provoking questions to guide you through your life's journey at your own pace or you may choose to receive a weekly story challenge to help keep you motivated.

Chapters of Life include:

-  Cover page

-  Introduction to your story

-  Thought provoking questions

-  Parents

-  Grandparents

-  Family heritage

-  Growing up and school

-  Love and relationships

-  Working

-  Military

-  Serious illness

-  Religion and spirituality

-  Passions and hobbies

-  Reflection of life to date

-  Remembering a loved one

-  Questions for fun

We will support you throughout your journey of discovery with tips on how to write your story and capture your family history via the support of our online community, emails, how to videos and webinars. The Our Life Story blogs and newsletters will include responses to frequently asked questions, along with real life stories to keep you inspired.

Why do I care so much about other people's stories?

Hi I'm Cynthia, founder of Our Life Story. This campaign wouldn’t be complete without telling my story and how Our Life Story came to fruition.  When I was 13 years and found out my father wasn’t my real father, I began to learn the importance of writing and documenting life experiences.  I was constantly wondering ‘What was my father’s story?’  From this, I developed a genuine, intuitive nature for listening to people’s stories and appreciating every aspect they shared.  Being a mother of two young children, wife, daughter, sister, friend and recovering from a serious illness, capturing our stories and memories has never become more important. This is a way of sharing with my children when they ask "Tell me about Granny".  

Having trained and worked as a life coach and counsellor, I have seen firsthand the power of writing our stories and reflecting on just how extraordinary our lives really are, giving clarity on our strengths and how we worked through challenges we have experienced throughout life.

With a team of committed and creative web developers, designers, writers and business mentors, I have been researching, creating and developing Our Life Story for over a year now without an income, this is how much it means to me.  I’ve put my heart into it and now I ask you to join this significant movement with                "One Story at a Time".

How We'll Use the Funds?

We need $20,000 in order to break “Our Life Story” onto the market. That will include web design/development, automation, expert writers, marketing and related expenses for start-up.

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realise our concept. It will assist us with the cost of further development, labour and production of the platform. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of the “Our Life Story”.  We will also use our funding to test our concept to make it better.  We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions.

We will also be using the funding to:

-  Continue investing and developing in new technology to bring you the latest and most relevant features to capture and share your stories,

-  Give you the best experience possible,

-  Provide the most up-to-date private and secure hosting environment,

-  Launch the digital and print to hardcover book feature for you to share your story with family and friends,

-  Develop and launch the photo scanning tools for you to easily capture your historical family photos from your album or shoe box to digital.

How You Can Help?

The “Our Life Story” platform needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this platform as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Our Life Story” community.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

We trust you will see this as a worthwhile investment and that your children's children will be glad you did too.

Capturing your story is one of the most significant things you will do in your life, so please check out the supporter rewards.

story:
ABOUT OUR BOOK:

The Federal Reserve has the legal right to do something that no other organization or person in the United States has; it can create money out of thin air. At the same time, they lack competitive pressure, and have little outside oversight. This creates extremely unnatural conditions for the Fed, which also causes a lot of problems.


In writing this book, I am seeking to educate everyday people about these problems, to create awareness, and to offer a solution to these problems that will make everyone better off in the long run. In addition, I hope to educate people about finance and economics in general. This book is written so that anyone can read it, understand it, and hopefully learn from it.


The book will give readers an overview of the Federal Reserve’s origins and how it came to be what it is today. I will also explain the Fed’s objectives, and how it is not only failing to meet them, but also reaching outside of their stated purpose, spending more money then they should be. The Fed is fat and it needs to trim down. 


ABOUT THE AUTHOR: 

My name is Toby Madden, and I was a Regional Economist with the Federal Reserve Bank in Minneapolis for twenty years before my retirement this June. Before this, I worked in private industry as a CPA and consultant. During my time in both private industry and at the Fed, I was able to learn a lot about the economy, the difference between private industry and public, and the good and bad of both. I also have given hundreds of speeches on the economy and finance, and  written for The Fedgazette. I have an accounting degree and an MBA in finance from the University of Minnesota, and completed Ph.D. coursework in applied economics. I want to share what I have learned with you, I want everyone to be as educated, and aware about the economy and the people who are in charge of it, as I am. I’ve got years of knowledge, experience, and stories to tell you.


WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT:

We believe the Federal Reserve is failing America, and needs to be changed. The Fed is increasing wealth inequality, overspending, and failing to regulate the US banking system. No one is holding it accountable. Very few people even know what goes on at the Federal Reserve. It is time to educate people; it is time to take the first step in a better financial system, and it starts with your support. Help us educate the American people, and hold accountable those who have the power. We can't do this without you.


WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO:

Since this book is a book preaching economic efficiencies and scorning wasteful overspending, were going to try to keep our budget as tight as possible. Donations will help to cover the following necessities.


Research Assistants

Editor

Video production and graphics

Office space

Publishing costs


I worked the numbers and the estimated total cost is $45,000. I'm willing to fork out some of my own retirement funds on this, but we need your support too. 


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We know that no journey is without its bumps in the road, and that our book is no exception. Here are some challenges we anticipate..

What book, idea, opinion, or theory hasn’t been disputed? None, probably. We know that not everyone is going to agree with the opinions taken in this book, and some people may be downright upset about them. We are ok with this happening, we embrace challenges to our ideas, and believe that they only strengthen our book. As a lifelong economist, accountant, and overall financial enthusiast, I feel prepared and even excited to defend my positions. I wouldn't create this book if I didn't believe in it myself.


OTHER WAYS TO GET INVOLVED:

Beyond donations, you can show support in other ways.

Follow us on twitter, like us on facebook, subscribe to our emails, visit our website, and of course spread the words to your friends, family, coworkers, or anyone who you think might be interested in this project and our mission.

story:
What is This About?

Hello and thank you for joining me for a few minutes to learn about this very special crowdfunding that I am working on.  To help publish my book "Don't Make Me Come Down There"

I probably look and sound like a very well put together person and today I am but, the fact of the matter is I was diagnosed nine years ago with major depression along with ADD. That was after suffering with it for thirty-six years and failing at two attempts of suicide.    While living with it I can tell you first hand that the pain is very real. Every part of my body ached and some days I was so low that I had to look up just to see the ground.   

Since getting healthy in 2006 I have written a book about the fact that there is help out there for whoever wants it that is in the process of getting edited and ready for publication.

I came to the realization that no one should ever have to live the way I did thinking that it was normal to have all the feelings that I had. So besides writing I had also decided to help my fellow human being by speaking out about my journey from the dark side by going back to college and getting my BA in Social Sciences while at the same time holding down a job. I am also in the process of getting certified as a Life Coach to help people get their lives back on the track to a very fulfilling life. 

It is not something you need to deal with on your own. There are avenues of help, you, just have to be willing to seek them. While living with the depression I had bouts of low self-esteem, did not want to be around anyone, and had days where I did not care whether I lived or died.  Depression and suicide are not choosy. Great athletes have completed suicide as well as well-known authors and people in high government jobs. Isn’t it about time we come into the 21st century and deal with mental illness.    

I thought last August after Robin Williams took his own life there would be much more of an outcry for education to help people who recognized they had some of the same symptoms. That did not happened at least I did not think so. I believe there can never be too much help. I am not one those people who feels frightened to speak out about my illness I feel that if I help one person then I have done my job. That is why I am creating the foundation and why I am asking for your support in donating to it as well as my book.  I am not a wealthy well known celebrity, I am person like all of you who gets up every morning and goes to work and deals with whatever life throws at us. So please will you think about giving. Who knows what lies around that next curve in the road of life; you may be the one who needs my resource for help. 

In closing let me leave you with these words you are only one person in this world but, you may be the world to that one person. Remember you never know who you are talking to you could be saving someone’s life just by talking to them.

Thank you and GOD Bless you.  

This campaighn is to publish the book "Don't Make Me Come Down There" and the expenses associated with publishing and marketing.

Short Summary

Lloyd Rosen was born in New York City. His family moved to Fair Lawn, NJ where Lloyd attended school all the way through high school. After high school Lloyd attended a local community college but stopped after one semester and enlisted in the Air Force. After being diagnosed as being unfit for military duty he was discharged with an honorable discharge and returned to New Jersey and found a job in the hospitality field. In 1978 Lloyd met his first wife and relocated across the country to Seattle. 

Lloyd was married for 12 years and has two children from that marriage. In 1998 Lloyd met his second wife and together they set off to see the United States. They moved first to Nashville, TN then to Jacksonville Fl. where in 2001 Lloyd, had his first real experience with major depression. It was there that Lloyd first thought about and planned to commit suicide. Fortunately he did not fulfill his desire. He got some help but did not get the real help that changed his whole life until 2006 when he and his wife had moved to Texas. It was then while seeing a therapist that Lloyd started writing. 

He ended up publishing his first book titled Search for Happiness My Journey from Darkness into the Light. Which he hopes to use to help other people realize they are not alone in their fight with depression. Most recently Lloyd was divorced from his second wife. Lloyd loves bowling competitively as well as continuing to write he is finishing up his second book. He also enjoys traveling and sightseeing; he has been to 46 of the 50 states. 

Rewards and Funds Breakdown

What's in it for you:

Apart from making the world a better place (Karma will notice), depending on your level you get (if you want to):

  • An online preview of the book before anybody else in the world sees it.
  • Your name as contributor on the book's website.
  • A link to your website from the book's website.
  • A video thank you from the author
  • A digital version of the book, which you can store on your computer and reading device for all eternity.
  • The paperback delivered to you anywhere in the world.
  • A signed paperback with a PERSONALIZED dedication delivered to you anywhere in the world.
  • Book themed thank you shopping bag, in which you can carry your signed paperback.
  • You get listed as sponsor inside the book. 
  • You get lunch with the author (no fast-food).
  • You could even get listed as sponsor of the books.

Below is the expenses breakdown in percentage:

The making:

  • Cover Artwork and professional design: 65%
  • Professional copy-editing: 1%
Marketing
  • Press release: 5%
  • Review copies: 5%
  • Online book clubs presence: 10%
  • Media Exposure: 7%

Indiegogo fee: 4%

Charity Donation: 3%

If we get more - we will delight our readers with an exciting website, we will participate in book fairs (get a booth) and attend conferences.  Speak to groups that need this information.

If we get less - we will be disappointed (no use in denying that) and we will have to look for other ways of additional funding.


The Impact

Depression affects 9.5% of American Adults which amounts to approximately 18.8 million. At least 4% of preschoolers—over one million children—are clinically depressed and they are the fastest-growing market for antidepressants. The rate of increase of depression in children is 23%.

Be part of this project and change the world with this new book. By participating in this project you will give life to the first of a series of books. Transforming the way people see the world. You also get some sweet rewards (only our smart and good-looking Indiegogo supporters will get these perks!). Together we can make this happen.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest undertaking and what I want to spend time talking to you about is a non-profit foundation that I am in the beginning stages of starting it will be called The Rosen Foundation and its basic mission is to educate and support those that need either or both in dealing with a personal relationship with depression and suicide or are dealing with losing someone to suicide.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell Your Friends

There's nothing better than word of mouth, so:

  • Tell your friends, parents, sisters, brothers, cousins, uncles, aunts, co-workers, neighbors and gym club members.
  • Tell the guy sitting next to you on that subway ride, tell the lady from your knitting club. Tell the guy in the supermarket standing behind you in line to the cash register. 
  • Share it with your Facebook friends.
  • Tweet, tweet, tweet!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for believing in us.

story:
“The Writers’ Studio made my love for writing grow stronger and confirmed that I should keep doing it.”

—Dayja, 2014 Camper

YOU can help shape a young writer’s future. The 4th Annual Summer Writers’ Studio Camp offers 7th-11th grade students from low-income Baltimore City schools an immersive, transformative six-day retreat at Mar-Lu-Ridge Retreat Center in Jefferson, Maryland. The Summer Writers’ Studio is an extension of Writers in Baltimore School’s (WBS) ongoing in-school and after-school programs. Last year, your donations enabled 24 talented young writers to attend the Summer Studio Camp, a life changing experience.


The 2015 program will be held from August 9-14, and with your help, we will be able to expand the camp experience to serve 30 youth. For many campers, the Writers’ Studio Camp is their first experience outside of Baltimore City, and  often their first experience away from home (and living in a cabin). Help us raise $10,000 by August 6th to subsidize the cost of the camp experience for 30 promising young writers. The Studio is completely free to all campers.

Who We Are

“WBS is more than a program or a camp. It is like home. I found myself in my writing. WBS is like a family, a forever family.”

— Bryonna, 2014 Camper

Founded in 2008, WBS’s mission is to provide Baltimore middle school students with a vibrant environment for literary development through in-school, after-school, and summer creative writing workshops taught by local writers.

Compared to higher income peers, the reading assessment scores of low-income Baltimore students drop significantly between grades 5-8. WBS believes that by supplementing low-income students’ middle school language arts learning with an intensive program in literary reading and creative writing, these students can enter high school with a renewed interest in literature. WBS steps in where the traditional language arts classroom falls short by giving students a smaller, more participatory setting to hone reading and writing skills.

WBS students’ writing has appeared in the Poetry Foundation blog, The Washington Post, The Baltimore Sun, Real Pants, and Seltzer. For the past three summers, WBS students have received full scholarships to attend the Iowa Young Writers’ Studio and the Kenyon Review Young Writers Workshop.

What We Need

The Summer Writers’ Studio provides low-income teens with invaluable support from an incredible 1:5 counselor to camper ratio. $10,000 in funding will allow 30 students from low-income, disadvantaged backgrounds, to attend the camp.

We have already received support from the Annie E. Casey Foundation and the Harry & Jeanette Weinberg Foundation, but $10,000 is still needed for the 2015 Studio.

Impact

“This camp opened new doors for me. Doors that I didn't even know could be opened.”

— Marie, 2014 Camper

“The Studio made me feel more excited when I write. I don’t feel the same at home.”

—Joanna, 2013 Camper


WBS has served 600+ low-income students since inception, and standardized test scores demonstrate our success. Before receiving WBS instruction, WBS enrollees were 7% less likely to score Advanced (highest score category) on the Maryland School Assessment reading test than their classmates. After one year of WBS, the same students were 33% more likely to earn Advanced scores than their peers. WBS has achieved these results by running 35 in-school and 30 after-school workshops, each meeting weekly for a full year, as well as summer programs.

Your gift enables campers to experience daily Studio workshops focus on topics such as story structure, sentence structure, grammar for writers, character development, point of view, science fiction, and revision. Outside of classroom time, students enjoy hikes, ghost story competitions, swimming, s’mores around a campfire, and a talent show. The Studio culminates in publication of an anthology of student work and an open mic back in Baltimore, to allow for family and community members to attend.

Gift Levels and Opportunities

$10

Every gift counts! Your gift of $10 or more will be acknowledged on the Writers in Baltimore Schools website and Facebook page.


$25

For $25, receive a copy of the Writers’ Studio Anthology (hot off the press!).


$50

For $50, your name will be listed with other $50+ donors inside the Writers’ Studio Anthology, and you’ll receive a copy.


$75

For $75, receive an “Honorary Camper” t-shirt!


$150

For $150, a camper will write send you a personalized haiku on a postcard from camp! Plus you’ll receive an “Honorary Camper” t-shirt!


$500

For $500, receive a fiction manuscript consultation from Writers’ Studio fiction instructor, Khaliah Williams! Khaliah will read your manuscript (up to 400 pages) and conduct a two-hour one-on-one meeting or phone consultation. Khaliah holds an MFA in fiction writing from the Iowa Writers’ Workshop, and her fiction has been published in the Hawaii Women's Journal, Frontier Psychiatrist, and Day One from Amazon. Her story La Sepoltura was selcted for the anthology Day One Year One Best Best New Stories and Poems 2014.  She is also a current fellow at the SMU's Kimbilio Center for African Fiction. (2 available)


$500

For $500, receive a poetry manuscript consultation from a Writers’ Studio poetry instructor! Shangrila Willy, a 2014 Rattle Poetry Prize Finalist, will read and provide feedback on up to 6 pages of poetry. Shangrila holds an M.A. in Fiction and Poetry from Johns Hopkins University, and her work has appeared in cream city review, magma, Sugar House Review, Measure, and Gargoyle, among others. (5 available)


$768

Become a Life Changer: Sponsor a deserving young writer for one week of camp.


$1000

Become an Honorary Camper! For $1,000, spend a day at the Writers’ Studio watching the kids develop the Anthology (Aug. 9 - 14, 2015). You'll feel like a kid at camp again and get to work on writing your own fiction and poetry! (Background check required.)


Or, you can always provide a gift of any amount of your choice! 100% of every donation is tax deductible and goes towards helping low-income teens benefit from the Writers’ Studio experience.

story:
I want this book in YOUR hands.

Last December, I successfully launched the Kindle version of my book "Woman Overboard! Six Ways Women Avoid Conflict and One Way to Live Drama-Free". It went on to be downloaded over 5,000 times and become an Amazon Kindle Best-seller. (Learn more about "Woman Overboard!" here.)

I started hearing from people how this book helped them get clear on why it was okay for them to advocate for themselves. They frequently told me, "I'm going to read it again, more slowly, and fill out the workbook so I can have that hard talk I used to dread. But now I know I can do it!"

But the thing I hear more often than this?

"I wish your book was in paperback."

I agree. 

Let's get physical

I need $4,000 to get the book into print, based on my contract with my publisher. 

Where does this money go?

  • Editing and formatting the book for print (including the special NEW chapter on dealing with difficult people)
  • Paying in advance for a few hundred copies for fulfilling perks and pre-sales, giveaways and my future inventory.
  • Marketing and launching the print version so more people discover "Woman Overboard!"
All the funds raised will go toward getting the book into your hands. If I don't reach my funding goal, I'll continue sourcing contributions until the amount is reached. 

If any extra money is raised beyond the goal, I will donate copies of the book to women's shelters and domestic violence support agencies, especially those that you recommend.

One Reader Says...

"I just finished your book and want to sincerely thank you for writing it. I read it through pretty quickly, over a couple of days on vacation. My original goal was to  support you so that next time I saw you, I would be able to say, 'Yes, Rachel, I did really read it.'  However,  I find my reaction to it is much deeper and more profound than what I anticipated. Your rescue system has given me really valuable tools for the difficult conversations ahead with my mother.  I look forward to getting home to print out the worksheets and reading your book again, at a slower pace, to work on the exercises. You have supported me, rather than me supporting you!  Thank you."  -- C.J. 

Why the delay?

Originally when I launched the Kindle version, I promised my crowdfunders that the paperback version would be out in April (yes, three months ago). 

And that long stall was because I was worried about crowdfunding a second time. Not that I thought the campaign wouldn't be successful (although that's always a possibility), but because I felt concerned that you might think I was frivolous or greedy...or that I'd failed.

While the Kindle version of the book was a successful launch, many of the copies downloaded were during the free days we used to promote the book. I've only earned about $400 from the book so far, and while I so WANTED to get flush enough to pay on my own for this second stage of publishing, I'm just not there yet...

And I don't want to deprive you any longer just because my ego is tender. That has been pretty selfish of me, now that I think about it. 

I am sorry for standing between this work, which is so much more important than my ego, and your need for clarity and support in these difficult conversations. If you're still interested in learning how to "do" conflict with skill, power, and grace, then I'm SO ready to put this book in your hands!


Other Ways You Can Help

I welcome any and all contributions, but even if you don't wish to donate at this time, you can still help by telling a friend about "Woman Overboard" and this fundraiser campaign. 

And of course, I would love your social media support. I lost track of all the amazing people who shared about this book's launch last December, but it was truly humbling and touching for me to see how much you believed in this message...and in me.

When you share or donate to this campaign, I'll give you a social media shout-out and celebrate your awesomeness for the world to see. Cause the world is hungry for people making a difference!


Thank you for helping to free women's voices.
